loans.name: Absolom

texts.en:
Absolom is 34 years old, married to Ruth and they are blessed with 3 children. He has been a small-scale farmer for the last 10 years and it has been profitable. He grows maize, sugarcane and he is also a dairy farmer.

He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow to enable him to increase the amount of milk supplied to his customers and get more income to educate his children.

His future hopes are to grow his farming, make more income and be able to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to increase the amount of milk supplied to his customers and get more income to support his family

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Dolores works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ice cream vending.  

Dolores is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Noteluz

texts.en:
Noteluz is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Noteluz has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread and other groceries.

Noteluz has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread and other groceries

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bread.  

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, canned good, soft drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, canned good, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 58 years old, married, and has five children..  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

Ruth has been raising pigs for 23 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Levy William

texts.es:
Levy tiene 38 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian en la escuela y los otros 2 aún no porque están muy pequeños.
Desde muy pequeño, Levy se dedica a la agricultura ya que fue el trabajo que le inculcó su padres, el lugar donde cultiva a está a 1 kilómetro de su casa para lo cual se va a pie porque no hay transporte, su hijo mayor también le ayuda  cuando no va a la escuela, además tiene bueyes con los que hace viajes y le genera otro ingreso a su familia.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar 4 bovinos de repasto y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos.

Sus aspiraciones a futuro son que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales, además quiere comprar vacas de ordeño para vender leche y sus derivados.
texts.en:
Levy is 38 years old. He is married and his wife takes care of the household. He has 5 children, 3 of whom study at school. The other 2 do not yet because they are very young.

Since he was very young, Levy has worked in farming, since it was the work his parents taught him. The place where he plants is 1 kilometer from his house. He goes there on foot because there is no transportation. His oldest son also helps him when he does not go to school. He also has oxen, with which he takes trips and generates another source of income for his family.

He needs the loan in order to buy 4 beef cows and in this way increase his income.

His aspiration for the future is for his children to be able to be professionals. He also wants to buy some milk cows in order to sell milk and milk products.

loans.use: to buy 4 beef cattle and in this way increase his income

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est célibataire avec 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 9 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des prêts à porter  et des pagnes depuis  08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec  l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 25 pièces de pagnes et 03 douzaines  de prêt à porter.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour aider ses enfants, payer leur scolarité et acheter une parcelle.  Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante et aller à l’extérieur.
texts.en:
Mariam is single and has three children ranging from nine to 15 years of age. All three of her children are in school. She has six dependents.
Mariam has been selling ready-to-wear clothing as well as traditional “pagnes” fabric for eight years. She stocks up at the local market. 

She plans to use her loan to buy 25 sets of “pagnes” and three dozens of ready-to-wear outfits. Mariam would  to use her revenues to support her children, pay their school fees and also buy a land plot. Her goal is to become a major vendor and stock up abroad.

loans.use: to buy 25 sets of fabric and three dozens of ready-to-wear outfits.

loans.name: Saim's Group

texts.en:
Saim’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saim makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
Saran’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saran makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.es:
Tranquilina, de 68 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es madre soltera y vive con un hijo y dos nietos; su hijo trabaja en la agricultura, sus dos nietos estudian.

Tranquilina, se dedica a la producción y venta de maíz, toda su vida se ha dedicado a este negocio, su hijo vive con ella y le ayuda en el negocio, los dos trabajan y al final de la temporada venden el producto y se comparten las ganancias.

El dinero lo necesita para pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra y compra fertilizantes, porque si no la dueña se lo alquila a otra persona, este año quiere cultivar el doble que los años pasados, debido a que obtuvieron buenas ganancias, pretenden incrementar las ganancias para obtener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tranquilina, 68 years old, did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is a single mother and lives with one son and two grandchildren. Her son works in farming and her two grandchildren are in school.

Tranquilina works producing and selling corn. She has been in this business all her life. Her son lives with her and helps her with the business. The two work and at the end of the season they sell the produce and share the profit.

She needs the money in order to pay for the rent on the land and to buy fertilizer, because if she doesn't the owner will rent it to another person. This year she wants to grow double the amount from past years, since they obtained a good profit. They are trying to increase profits in order to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chhay's Group

texts.en:
Chhay’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chhay makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old and describes herself as a calm and responsible person.  She likes helping people, reading and in her free time she tutors elementary school kids.

Despite having a physical disability that limits her walking, she tries to have a normal life. She has a small stationary store and is asking for a loan to buy inventory and offer more products to her clients. She says that her business has allowed her to buy a computer, printer and do some remodeling in her house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her stationary store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish, meat, cassava, maize and spices

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and a group representative of Bethel Group. Evelyn is from Twifo Praso in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married with one child who is sixteen years of age and is schooling as well. She is a petty trader who trades in agro-chemicals and spraying machines. She has been in this business for 21 years. She is also a baker as additional source of income.

Evelyn has been supporting her business with microloans from the field partner since 2007. She has many customers from several farming communities; hence her business has the ability to generate the necessary cash flow to meet her past repayments on time. Evelyn wants to see her business grow larger in the coming years so that she can have enough stock to meet demand at all times, especially during the major farming seasons, and make enough profit towards seeing her child through to the university. Evelyn needs additional working capital support in the form of microloans to buy stock of agro-chemicals and spraying machines to resell to her farming customers. Evelyn is thankful to all her microlenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy agro-chemicals and spraying machines to resell.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Touch makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bela N Nabra - Domonaayili Group

texts.en:
Arishetu is a hard working 40-year-old woman from Demonayili in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has six children. In the group picture,  Arishetu is standing at the back and raising one hand.

Arishetu is a member of a par-boiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 19 years. The name of the group is Bela N Nabra - Domonaayili. She earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their par-boiled rice processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for their customers in Ghana.

Arishetu and Bela N Nabra - Domonaayili Group have asked for a loan of GHS 8,200. Arishetu’s share of the loan is GHS 500, which would be used to buy paddy rice from local rice farmers for processing. She would earn more income as a result and would repay this loan and support her family with food and by paying the children's school fees.

Arishetu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from local rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Sceun's Group

texts.en:
Sceun’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sceun makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Youn's Group

texts.en:
Youn’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Youn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chando

texts.en:
Chando is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be reliable. Chando operates a retail business where he sells flour, rice, maize, sweets, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. Chando describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

He will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of flour, sugar, sweets and other items. His business goal is to have a well equipped shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, sugar, sweets and other items.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 64 years old, and she is married with 5 children.  

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more livestock.

Carmelita has been raising livestock for 15 years now, and she has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married, and she works hard to support her family.

Cecilia has a general store business in the Philippines, though she also earns additional income from fattening pigs. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, as well as other groceries, for her general store business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, as well as other groceries

loans.name: Pern's Group

texts.en:
Pern’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Pern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller by selling groceries to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of this woman and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Channda's Group

texts.en:
Channda’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Channda makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help all of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Carolina Del Transito

texts.es:
Carolina, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo vive en los Estados Unidos, tiene dos hijos, uno estudia y el otro trabaja.

Carolina, trabaja como empleada doméstica, en una casa muy cerca de su casa; también hace pupusas para vender.

Carolina, necesita el crédito para poder construir dos galeras en su casa, ya que donde tiene la pupuseria no está en buenas condiciones.

Ella, desea poder darle el estudio adecuado y necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carolina is 35 years old and studied up until high school. She is married and her husband lives in the United States. She has two children; one is studying and the other one is in employment. Carolina makes a living as a cleaner in a house which is very near to her home. She also makes and sells stuffed tortillas called pupusas. 

Carolina needs this loan in order to build two covered terraces onto her house, since the area where she has her tortilla stall is not in a good condition.
She would like to be able to provide a good and necessary education for her children.

loans.use: to build two covered terraces onto her house.

loans.name: Ngit's Group

texts.en: Ngit and her group of three members live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ngit makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea and her group of four members live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. She makes a living cultivating rice. She also works as a seamstress and sells groceries to support her family.

In Chea’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en: Yat and her three-member group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yat makes a living cultivating rice and also sells things to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Heng makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help all of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Pruch's Group

texts.en:
Pruch’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Pruch makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Map's Group

texts.en:
Map’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Map makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Faithful Vine Group

texts.en:
Francis is a 36-year-old man who hails from Twifo Praso in the Central Region of Ghana. He is the group representative of Faithful Vine Group. Francis is a married man with five children ranging in age from eight years to eight months. Four of his children go to school.

Francis is a trader who deals in hardware products and building materials such as iron rods, nails, paints, shovels etc. He has been in this business for 10 years now and has gained much experience. He has a commercial vehicle that serves as a source of other income to his business. Francis has five shop attendants, and his wife also assists him in the shop. He has been a client of the field partner since 2006 with a good track record.

Francis wants to add other products such as water closets, PVC pipes, and floor and wall tiles to his current stock to meet the demands from his customers. He also sees his business grow in five years to buy his own cargo car to reduce the cost of transporting the goods from his suppliers.

Francis will use part of the profit from his business for future expansion and the remaining profit to support the children's education. He needs micro loan support to realise his business dreams. Francis is grateful to all his micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy tiles, PVC pipes, water closets, plywood, cements, iron rods, and roofing sheets

loans.name: Central Murillo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRAL MURILLO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Severina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan, venta de polleras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de awuayos, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Severina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, por herencia de sus padres, ya que ella apoyaba desde niña, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de refrescos, fideo y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “CENTRAL MURILLO” communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional hub. The group is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Severina serves as charwoman. 

The members of the communal bank run various businesses, which include selling bread, selling traditional skirts, selling prepared meals, selling furniture, selling woven textiles and running a neighbourhood store. 

The loan that the group will take out will benefit the owners of small microbusinesses, including Severina. She says that it is the first time she is working with Pro Mujer and that she became a member at the invitation of the institution during a large promotion. Currently, she runs a a neighbourhood store. She mentions that she learnt this business many years ago thanks to her parents. She used to learn when she was a young girl, and as the time passed she decided to start an independent business herself. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her working capital by purchasing soft drinks, pasta and rice all wholesale which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in her area. This line of work allows her to generate the means to support her family financially as she is married and has three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pasta and rice wholesale.

loans.name: Vachana

texts.en:
Vachana, twenty, lives with her parents in Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family she farms a small rice field, which is located near her house. On average, she is able to make 4 USD a day.

Vachana wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use. There isn’t one in her house now, so she is borrowing 500 USD through HKL to build one. By doing so she can provide her family with sanitary conditions, promote their health and help to lessen environmental degradation.

She is thankful for this loan that has been granted with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 45, is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. For the past three years she has been the proprietor of a sari-sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Marites has applied for a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of items like canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries. She is working hard to save money, expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items like canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries for her store

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 44 years old and married with two children. For the past five years she has run a sari-sari, or small general store, as well as sold rice for an income in the Philippines.

Analie has taken out and successfully repaid five prior loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more items such as sugar, soap and other groceries for her sari-sari. She is working hard to save more money in order to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sugar, soap and other groceries for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 53 años de edad, desde sus 12 años se dedicó a la agricultura ya que para ese entonces sus padres no le daban la importancia necesaria al estudio, está casado y tiene 3 hijos a los que crio con mucho esfuerzo y que ahora han formado sus propios hogares.

Luis toda su vida ha trabajado en agricultura pues fue el oficio que le heredaron sus padres.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar dos terneras para criarlas y luego venderlas en un tiempo determinado y de esa manera poder sacarles ganancia.


Luis desea tener tres vacas lecheras para aprovechar la producción de leche.
texts.en: Luis is 53 years old. Since he was 12, he has worked in agriculture, because at that time his parents did not consider studying important. He is married and has 3 children, whom he raised with a lot of effort, and who now have their own families. Luis has worked his whole life in agriculture, because this was the job he inherited from his parents. He will use the loan to buy two calves to raise and then sell at a specific time, and in this way get profit from them. Luis wants to have three dairy cows in order to profit from milk production.

loans.use: to buy two calves to raise and then sell at a specific time, and in this way get profit from them.

loans.name: Yerelon2 Group

texts.fr: Jacqueline est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est la responsable de ce groupe de 3 membres. Cette dame fait le commerce des légumes depuis 4 ans. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter ses légumes chaque jour pour vendre . A la fin du prêt, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is married and a mother to four children, all in school. She is the leader of this three-member group. This woman has been selling produce for four years. 

Jacqueline needs this loan to buy produce every day to sell. By the end of the loan, she will have a profit that will allow her to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ny makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a seller, selling groceries, to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of his family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en:
Vuth, 33, lives in a small community in Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is a father of a little child. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for 10 years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase aluminum for making kitchen utensils

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old and widowed woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosa has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to resell.

Rosa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Je-Ann

texts.en:
Je-ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Je-ann is 29 years old and both of her children are in school.

Je-ann has a general store business in the Philippines. Je-ann requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft-drinks, sugar, soap and other groceries to resell.

Je-ann has been in this business for three years. In the future, Je-ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, sugar, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Nyonko Do Group

texts.en:
The Nyonko Do group consists of two women and a man. They are on average 40 years old with two children. They all live in Chorkor, one of the neighborhoods of Accra, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties. Group members are small retail merchants dealing in all kinds of sliding doors and windows, charcoal, second-hand clothing, and African wax fabric. To increase their stock, the group decided to work with ID-Ghana and are in their third group loan cycle. 

Christiana has a great reputation at selling charcoal and kids' tops and trousers. She intends to use her loan to buy charcoal, kids' tops, and trousers to sell to customers from the wholesale market. With this loan, Christiana hopes to achieve  a good monthly profit to be reinvested in the business. She aims to buy a plot of land for residential use through her relationship with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, kids' tops, and trousers from the wholesale market to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Succès Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Succès vient de solder son premier prêt kiva sans difficulté. Salimata (responsable du groupe Succès) gère une petit commerce de vente de farine de maïs. Avec son bénéfice qu'elle a gagné, elle a pu construire une petite maison où son fils habite actuellement. Elle a pu aussi acheter un vélo et faire les dépenses courantes de sa famille. Cette brave dame remercie Kiva de lui avoir accordé ce prêt. Salimata voudrait encore un prêt pour acheter 30 sacs  à 420 000 francs CFA et le reste de son argent(105 000 francs) lui permettra de faire les autres dépenses alliées à la transformation de la farine. Son beénéfice lui permettra de continuer son commerce et aussi de faire les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
The group Succès (Success) just settled their first Kiva loan without difficulty. Salimata (the leader of the Succès group) manages a small business selling corn flour. With the profits she's earned, she was able to build a little house where her son currently lives. She was also able to buy a bicycle and to deal with her family's regular expenses. This courageous woman thanks Kiva for granting her this loan. 

Salimata would like a second loan to buy 30 sacks (at 420,000 CFA) and the rest of her money (105,000 francs) will allow her to make other purchases related to making the flour. Her profit will allow her to continue her business and also to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn to make flour to sell.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилоле всего 21 год. Она из маленького района Кубадиён. Зилола замужем и живет вместе с мужем с его родителями. Свекор и свекров Зилоли давно занимались растениеводческой деятельности, и Зилола помогает им. Она вместе с ними наравне работает и трудится. В этом году у Зилола и ее семьи не хватило денег на завершения посева урожая (купли минеральных удобрений). Они посеяли семена и им сейчас необходимо купить минеральные удобрения, обработать землю, чтобы на следующий сезон получить богатый и качественный урожай.
texts.en: Zilola is only 21 years old. She is from a small district of Qubadiyon. Zilola is married and lives with her husband and his parents. Zilola's parents-in-law have been involved in agriculture for a long time, and she helps them. She works with and equal to them. This year, Zilola and her family did not have enough money to finish the crop sowing (purchase of mineral fertilizers). They planted the seeds and now need to buy mineral fertilizers and treat the soil in order to get a rich and quality harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to finish her crop sowing

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдасте из района А.Чоми 46 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Гулдаста приятная в общении женщина. Она любит жизнь и старается прожить свою жизнь не по напрасному. Гулдаста занимается растениеводством и этим приносит в дом очень важный источник дохода. Ее муж преподаватель, но так как зарплата учителей, очень маленькая, доход от растениеводческой деятельности является основным источником пополнения семейного бюджета. В этом году Гулдаста вынуждена закончить посев позже, чем обычно. Она посеяла семена и теперь необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями. У Гулдасты не хватает денег для покупки достаточного количества удобрений, и она обратилась за кредитом, с надеждой сохранить урожай на следующий сезон.
texts.en: Guldasta from the A. Jomi district is 46 years old. She is married and has children. Guldasta is pleasant woman to interact with. She loves life and tries not to live it without a purpose. Guldasta is involved in agriculture and with it brings in a very important source of income home. Her husband is a teacher, but because a teacher's salary is very low, the income from the agricultural business is the primary source for the family's budget. Guldasta has to finish her crop sowing later this year than usual. She planted seeds and now has to treat the soil with mineral fertilizers. Guldasta does not have enough money to buy the sufficient amount of fertilizers and requested a loan hoping to save her harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to finish her crop sowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various goods

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: 21 летняя жительница района Кубадиён - Саида занимается земледелием.  Она не смогла получить высшее образование, но надеется, что имев своих детей, она даст им достойное образование, обеспечить светлое будущее и дать им то, что не смогла получить от своих детей.  Саида уже 2 года работает в сфере сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она уже посадила семена, и только осталось обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями.  Ей не хватает денег, чтобы купить достаточное количество удобрений, и Саида надеется, что лендеры Kiva поддержать ее.
texts.en: Saida, a 21-year-old resident of the Qubadiyon district, is involved in farming. She could not obtain a college education, but hopes that once she has children, she will be able to give them a deserving education, provide a bright future for them and give them everything that she could not get from her parents. Saida has been working in the agricultural sphere for 2 years. She grows agricultural crops. She already planted the seeds and only needs to treat the crop with mineral fertilizers. Saida does not have enough money to buy the necessary amount of fertilizers and hopes the Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat the soil

loans.name: Saidmumin

texts.ru:
Саидмумин житель города под названием Куляб. Ему 36 лет. Он женат и имеет троих сыновей. Сыновьям 8, 7 и 3 лет. Старшие сыновья ходят в школу. Жене 33 лет. Она домохозяйка. Жена параллельно занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. 
Саидмумин ответственный человек. Он хочет начать свой бизнес. Саидмумин  планирует купить автомобиль  марки «NEXIA», работать таксистом и зарабатывать денег, чтобы прокормить свою семью. По этой причине Саидмумин обратился за кредитом. Ваш кредит поможет ему приобрести автомобиль, начать бизнес, обосновать определенный и постоянный источник дохода.
texts.en:
Saidmumin lives in Kulob. He is 36 years old. He is married and has three sons: 8, 7 and 3 years old. The older sons go to school. His wife is 33 years old. She is a homemaker. His wife also sews women's clothes at home.

Saidmumin is a responsible person. He wants to start a business. Saidmumin is planning to buy a Nexia brand car so that he can work as a taxi driver to earn money to feed his family. Therefore Saidmumin applied for a loan. Your loan will help him to buy a car, start a business, and to establish a permanent source of income.

loans.use: A loan of $ 1,225 helps Saidmumin buy a new car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs Hà  works in agriculture farming food. Hà  is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hà's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà  faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

In future, Hà  hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to increase the supply of milk for her customers and get more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
The nice and shiny woman in the photo is Hasmik from Masis village. She lives there with her big family of six: her husband, two sons, daughter, daughter-in-law, and granddaughter. Hasmik and her family have been involved in the farming business for already fifteen years.

Hasmik is a very hardworking woman, and she likes her agricultural occupation. Profit from farming helps her to meet her family's needs. Her family members help Hasmik a lot. Together they managed to enrich the farm, where currently they own four greenhouses where different types of crops are cultivated.

For the further development of the farm, Hasmik needs funds. She asks for this loan to purchase chickens and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. As this is Hasmik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for chickens and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to enlarge the cultivation of crops and gather income for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to supply milk and get more income to support his family and provide for their basic needs.

loans.name: Seresitine

texts.en:
Seresitine is aged 35 years. He is married with five children aged between 3 and 15 years.  They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 20 years. His wife is a farmer also. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 49 years old. He lives in a small village of Kobuleti district with his wife, son and his family. Badri works as a guard and has a small monthly income.

The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and two calves. In addition, they own agricultural land, where they grow maize, nuts, and mandarin trees. They sell the harvested products seasonally.

As the income is only seasonal and not enough for a big family to cover everyday costs, Badri decided to start a taxi business. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,300 GEL. With the received credit, Badri will purchase a car and will serve local people as a taxi driver in order to generate a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 25 años, también tiene venta de gas propano, ya que la zona donde vive es turística y hay mucho consumo de gas.- También, tiene una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 10 años, la comenzó con muy poco inventario, para saber si iba a ser rentable.

José, necesita el dinero para comprar más cilindros de gas, ya que el negocio es cada día más grande y ahora tiene entrega a domicilio y también hace viajes en su pick up, para tener más ingresos.

El sueño de José, es que su negocio crezca, para dejárselo como herencia a sus hijos, cuando ella ya no esté aquí.
texts.en:
José is 59 years old. He did not have the opportunity to study. He has a live-in partner, who has worked selling tortillas for 25 years. José has a business selling propane gas, since the area where he lives is a tourist destination, and there is high consumption of gas. He has also operated a business selling fruits and vegetables for 10 years. He started it with little inventory, to see if it would be profitable. 

José needs the funds to buy more gas cylinders, since his business is growing every day, and he now provides home delivery and also transportation with  his pickup truck, in order to increase his income. 

José's dream is that his business will grow so that he can leave an inheritance to his children when he is no longer around.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders for his business.

loans.name: Yaglm-Nooma(Djantoli) Group

texts.fr: Haoua, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 5 sont scolarisés. Elle a comme activité, la vente des condiments devant sa porte. Le groupe de Haoua respect ses engagements vis à vis de ACFIME. Leurs remboursements se font à la bonne date. Cette brave dame à besoin de crédit pour s'approvisionner en légumes fraîches et sèches pour vendre à ses clients. Son bénéfice lui permettra de gérer sa famille et de continuer ses activités.
texts.en: Haoua, the group’s official, is a married mother of six children, of whom five are in school. She has a business selling condiments in front of her house. Haoua’s group respects their ACFIME-related commitments. Their payments are made on schedule. This good and honest woman has need of loans to stock up on fresh vegetables to sell to her customers. Her profits enable her to manager her family and to continue in her work.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables (tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, zucchini,...) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some fabrics and to renovate his workshop

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, a married mother of two, describes herself as ambitious. She has been operating a retail business selling clothes for five years. Her primary customers are locals, and her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

Eunice will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to import clothes to sell within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Âgée de 35ans, Akuvi a pour mari un déclarant en douane. Ils ont en charge 02 enfants de 9 et 5ans qui sont scolarisés. Elle demande un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille. Elle a démarré en 2011.
texts.en: Akuvi, aged 35, is married to a customs agent. They support two children, aged 9 and 5 years old, who are in school. Akuvi is asking for an initial loan to purchase merchandise in order to satisfy customer demands. She would like to expand her business and ensure her family’s well-being. She began in 2011.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, 'pagne' cloth, and children's clothing

loans.name: Francisca Del Rocio

texts.es:
Francisca del Rocío tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su madre en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila y su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos. Cuenta con más de 4 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos y alimento para la crianza de los mismos. Con esto Francisca del Rocío espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca del Rocio is 29 years old and single. She lives with her mother in the district of Cayalti, located in Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the district is tranquil and its population is principally dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising.
 
Francisca raises and sells pigs. She can count on more than four years of experience in the business, and has very good personal and work references in the zone. 

Her present loan will be invested in purchasing a larger quantity of pigs, plus feed for raising them. With this loan, Francisca hopes to expand her business, obtain more income, and be better able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: invest in purchasing a larger quantity of pigs and food for raising them.

loans.name: Nasibahan

texts.ru: Насибахан, 52 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Много лет в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур и животноводством. На сегодняшний день деятельность Насибахан приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 4 овцы и 2,0 Га земли, где выращивает рис. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насибахан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который направит на полеводство для выращивания экологически чистой продукции. Доход от кредита она хочет потратить на развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Nasibahan is 52 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. To provide additional income, she has been involved in growing agricultural crops and animal husbandry for many years. Today, Nasibahan's business yields a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS). She has 2 cows, 4 sheep and 2.0 hectares of land, where she grows rice. To continue developing her business, Nasibahan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to grow ecologically clean crops. She wants to spend the income from the loan on developing her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her land in order to grow organic rice

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым 42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование - средне-специальное. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулайым, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 8 коров, 17 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулайым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян ячменя и топлива для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Гулайым планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как она хочет накопить на ремонт автомобиля, чтобы супруг мог развозить молоко.
texts.en: Gulaiym is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a specialized secondary education. To provide additional income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1995, when she started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulaiym's hard work, currently her farm contains 8 cows and 17 sheep. To continue developing her business, Gulaiym requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy barley seeds and fuel to cultivate the soil. Gulaiym plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business because she wants to save money to repair a car, so that her husband can deliver milk.

loans.use: to buy barley seeds and fuel to cultivate the soil

loans.name: Emmanuela Group

texts.fr:
Mme  M. ISABELLE  est responsable du groupe EMMANUELLA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Madame est restauratrice depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut acheter  20 caisses de boisson, 02 bidons d’huile  et 01 sac de riz.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans  son activité. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un restaurant et  améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
M. Isabelle is the leader of the Emmanuella group. She is married and a mother to 4 children. The oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. Three children attend school and she has four people in her care. 

M. Isabelle has been working with food for 5 years. She resupplies at the nearby markets. 

With the money she's been granted, she wants to buy 20 cases of drinks, 2 containers of oil and 1 sack of rice. She wants to use the profits of the loan to reinvest in her business. She strives to open a restaurant and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of drinks, 2 containers of oil and 1 sack of rice.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Mme  SOLANGE  est responsable du groupe BADEYA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Madame est restauratrice depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut acheter  01 douzaine d’assiettes  et 01 carton de poissons.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour créer de  nouveaux  endroits  de restauration et agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme  Solange is the leader of the group called Badeya. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 18 and the youngest is one year old. Three children attend school and Solange is responsible for five persons. 

Solange has been running a restaurant for 11 years. She stocks up in surrounding markets. With the loan she is granted, she wants to buy one dozen plates and one carton of fish. 

Solange wants to use the profits from the loan to create new restaurants and expand her business. Her ambition is to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy one dozen plates and one carton of fish

loans.name: Las Amigas Centralistas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MIGAS CENTRALISTAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos cosméticos, venta de libros, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bertha es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, de su amiga con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Las Migas Centralistas communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Bertha is the president.  The businesses the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them are selling cosmetics, selling books, selling vegetables, selling food, and selling clothes.  

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Bertha is a member.  She says that this is her first time as a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a large promotion that the institute did in her area.  She currently has a business of selling cosmetics.  She says that she learned this business several years ago from a friend.  As time went by she decided to establish an independent business.  The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy cosmetics wholesale).  She will get the cosmetics from wholesalers in the city of La Paz.  She will later sell the cosmetics at her sales space.

This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Alejandro Mario

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 23 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería electrónica.
Él es inteligente, atento, despierto, alegre, responsable, buen estudiante y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los desarrolla en la universidad tecnológica en la carrera de ingeniería electrónica, caracterizada por encontrarse en el centro de la ciudad al lado de restaurantes, oficinas, empresas y todo tipo de comercio, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-16 grados centígrados. 
Alejandro es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, complexión física delgada, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla sólo con sus abuelos porque estudia inglés como segunda lengua y habla español por sus estudios universitarios. Su vida la comparte con sus abuelos que son jubilados, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de Ingeniería electrónica en primer año, y se prepara para resolver problemas de la ingeniería tales como; control de procesos industriales, transformación de la electricidad para el funcionamiento de diversos tipos de equipos y otros. Su aptitudes principales son; habilidad en la área de matemática y física, destreza en el manejo de las Tecnologías de la información, capacidad de interpretar, analizar y sintetizar información, habilidad para identificar y resolver problemas, tiene disciplina de estudio y capacidad para organizar su tiempo y trabajo de forma autónoma y en grupo. Paralelamente a sus estudios trabaja como cajero de un banco local. “estudié y me preparé bastante para trabajar en el banco ahora estudio para subir de cargo y desarrollar mi vida profesional…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar su carrera para subir de cargo, él desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil y una impresora multifunción (impresora, scanner y fotocopiadora) para continuar con sus estudios hasta finalizarlos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en su 1 año de estudios en la universidad. 
Es por esos motivos que Alejandro solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y una impresora multifunción para continuar con sus estudios hasta finalizarlos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 23-year-old man. He is single with no children, and he is studying for a degree in electronics engineering. 

He is intelligent, attentive, alert, cheerful, responsible, a good student, and very hard-working. He is studying at the technological university for a degree in electronics engineering. The university is in the city center, surrounded by restaurants, offices, companies and all sorts of businesses. The local climate is cold and dry, with daytime temperatures varying between 2 and 16 degrees Centigrade.
 
Alejandro has brown skin, short black hair and dark eyes. He has a slender build and is of medium height. His native language is Aymará, which he now speaks only with his grandparents, since he is studying English as a second language and he speaks Spanish in his university coursework. He shares his life with his grandparents, who are retired. They live in a house of their own, built of brick with a metal roof, with water, sewer and electricity connections. He is in his first year of the degree program for electronics engineering, and he is learning to solve problems such as the control of industrial processes, the transformation of electricity for the operation of various types of equipment, etc. His main aptitudes are: math and physics skills; achievements in information technology management; the ability to interpret, analyze and synthesize information; skills in identifying and resolving problems; study discipline; and the ability to organize his time and to work independently and in groups. 

Parallel to his studies, he is working as a teller in a local bank. "I studied and prepared myself quite a lot to work in the bank, and now I am studying to advance my career and develop my professional life," he comments. His dream is to finish his degree in order to get a better job. He wants to buy a portable computer and a multifunctional printer (printer, scanner and copier) to use in his studies until he completes his degree. This is his first loan sequence with the institution, during his one year of studies at the university. 

For these reasons, Alejandro is requesting a loan to buy a portable computer and a multifunctional printer to continue with his studies until he graduates.

loans.use: to buy a portable computer and a multifunctional printer to use in his studies until he completes his degree.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
María Aurora tiene 62 años de edad, es separada, vive con su hija y 2 nietas en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, confitería y gaseosas, su negocio esta ubicado en su propio domicilio. Se dedica a este negocio hace muchos años contando con mucha experiencia y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de ella. El presente crédito será para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto para darle más variedad de productos a su negocio, el cuál repercutirá en un mayor ingreso a su unidad familiar lo que va a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Aurora, age 62, is separated.  She lives with her daughter and two granddaughters in the Cayaltí district, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture, in commerce, and raise animals as their primary business activities.

She sells candy, sweets, and soft drinks.  Her business is located at her house.  She has been in this business for many years.  She has a lot of experience and fixed customers who give her very good references.

This loan will be to buy a greater quantity of merchandise in order to increase the stock in her business.  This is to give her a greater variety of products in her business.  The impact this will have is greater income for her family, which will allow her to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise in order to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Deth

texts.en:
Deth, 36, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He is a farther of three childen. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he is has been in this type of business for twenty two years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation, as well as the dry season which leads to low stock. 

He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to open two more butcheries within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and then sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 43, is a small-scale farmer who specializes in horticulture. She is based in a small village called Londiani, near Kericho, Kenya. 

This charming mother has been practicing agriculture on her small, fertile piece of land for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. 

Caroline is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. Her biggest challenge over the years as a farmer has been the lack of adequate capital. 

It is very hard for small farmers to save enough capital for expansion, since farming is marred with all sorts of external risks, such as climatic conditions, pests and diseases, political instability, fluctuation of prices and high costs of inputs. 

Because of these factors, the sure way farmers can obtain adequate capital is through leveraging their businesses. With your loan investment, Caroline is going to expand her horticultural farm in order to increase its output. 

If and when the investment pays off, Caroline will plow the profits back into the farm and increase her asset base.

loans.use: to expand her farm.

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар 56 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее высшее образование, большой трудовой стаж, работала учителем немецкого языка, сейчас на пенсии, работает бухгалтером. Также в качестве дополнительного источника доходов для семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес в 1995 году с 20,000 сом (KGS). Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть корова, 25 овец, на 2,30 Га земли есть фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анар обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Anar is 56 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She has a college education and extensive work experience. She worked as a German-language teacher before, and now that she is retired, works as an accountant. Also, to provide additional income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1995, when she started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). Her husband and children actively help her with the business. Today, her farm contains a cow, 25 sheep and 2.30 hectares of land, where she grows beans. In order to continue developing her business, Anar requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers and cultivate the soil. Anar plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic beans

loans.name: San Expedito 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Expedito 2 está en su ciclo 2, ellas son de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona aun en crecimiento, de difícil acceso y bastante alejado de la zona de la capital.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale y llega en casa por casa para hacer sus manicuras, ya que no cuenta con local propio para recibir a sus clientas. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de las capacitaciones vaya creciendo y mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, alicates y otros para poder seguir haciendo sus servicios a sus clientas e ir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
The group called San Expedito II is in its second loan cycle. They are from the city of Concepción, an area that is still growing and which is hard to get to and quite far from the capital city area. Maria is one of the members. She is from an area far from the center of the city where she comes and goes from house to house to do the manicures since she does not have her own place to receive her clients. 

She hopes that with time and through help from the trainings she will keep growing and getting better. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it into buying nail polish, nail polish remover, nail clippers, etc., to be able to continue delivering her services to her clients and to grow little by little.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, nail clippers, etc.

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Vân is 49 years old and she is married with 2 children. Vân lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

Vân works in agriculture, farming food. Vân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. In 2012, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Vân faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Vân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, who is 36 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one little child. 

To support the family, she is working very hard on her own rice farmland by growing the crop and selling it to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 3.50 a day, on average. 

As a supplementary earning, she has come up with a new business idea. She wants to raise pigs to sell. However, her insufficient capital investment doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy pigs. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her standard of living. 

She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Tương

texts.en:
Mrs. Tương works in agriculture farming food.

Tương is 63 years old and she is married with four children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Tương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tương hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Loynie

texts.en:
Loynie is a married, young entrepreneur who works as a store attendant and operates her own sari-sari store in her home at Doña Consuelo, Ozamis City. She personally assists and manages her store on weekends. When she's on duty, her mother, with whom she stays, watches over her store. She earns well from the business and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used for the business. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional goods to sell. She is determined to successfully improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is 59 years old, married and has five adult-age children. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. Aside from planting and harvesting rice and vegetables, he was also engages in a hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. He aspires to further improve this business but he has insufficient capital. For this reason, he is asking for an additional PHP 20,000 to buy vitamins, hog feed and vaccines for his hogs. He is hoping that this financial assistance will be a great help for him to further improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, hog feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 63 years old, married, and has nine children. Two of her children are in school.

Ninfa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ninfa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ninfa has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a 41-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Venancia has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Venancia has been in this business for 11 years. Venancia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Venancia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marietta works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Marietta is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food business.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old, and she is widowed, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Violeta has been raising pigs for ten years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for growing rice.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 39 years old. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 14 years. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 2 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for growing rice. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption. 



The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for growing rice to sell.

loans.name: Idalia Esther

texts.es:
La señora Idalia muestra su agradecimiento a la micro financiera Mi Crédito y a KIVA por haberla apoyado con un financiamiento que le sirvió para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de nacatamales y otras comidas nicaragüenses. Esto le fue de ayuda porque pudo cubrir la creciente demanda por sus platillos y aumento su capital de ingresos. 
Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, condimentos, carne de res y demás productos que son básicos para la elaboración de los platillos. Además utilizará parte del dinero para pagarle el sueldo a una muchacha que la ayuda en la preparación de los mismos.
texts.en:
Idalia would like to thank the microfinance institution Mi Crédito as well as Kiva for having supported her with funding. This funding allowed her to invest in her business, selling nacatamales [Nicaragauan tamales which are corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf] and other Nicaraguan food. This was of help to her, as she could meet the rising demand for her dishes and she increased her capital revenue.

She is requesting a new loan in order to buy raw materials like corn, firewood, condiments, beef and other products that she needs to make her dishes. She will also use part of the money to pay the wages of a girl who helps her to prepare them.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like corn, firewood, condiments, beef and other products.

loans.name: Beatriz De Jesus

texts.es:
Beatriz inicio la venta de variedades específicamente acolchados, hace meses atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como mujer pujante y emprendedora busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por su hijo.

Debido al costo de vida tan alto, Beatriz se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es por este motivo que necesita un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta. 
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 5 horas.
