Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de acolchados para mejorar su inventario.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén con gran variedad de productos y sabe que está por buen camino de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Beatriz began selling a variety of things, specifically bedspreads, months ago, work that she learned thanks to a friend. She looked for this work as an alternative to generate money and especially as a thriving and enterprising woman, she desperately looked for sustenance for her household made up of her son.

Due to the high cost of living, Beatriz has the need to generate a larger volume of earnings, and for this reason she needs a loan to help her improve the variety of products that she displays and offers to her customers daily and to people door to door. 

She works alone every day for 5 hours.

She asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of bedspreads to improve her inventory.

Her primary dream is to become the owner of a shop with a large variety of products and she knows she is on the right road with the hand of Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of bedspreads to improve her inventory.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre muy entregado a su trabajo pues a sus 40 años de edad trabaja incasablemente todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo en su negocio de producción de comidas rápidas y algunos panes.
 
Padre de 2 hijos que dependen totalmente de el ve una oportunidad de una entidad que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito para mejorar su negocio y soñar con su fábrica de producción de alimentos y hacerle creer que es posible alcanzar este sueño. 

Le dedica 6 horas diarias a su negocio.

Solicita un crédito para realizar mejoras a su local y compra de ingredientes para los alimentos que vende.
 
Con la ayuda de este crédito la Luis producirá mas alimentos y le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cada día darle mejores oportunidades de vida a sus dos hijos
texts.en:
Luis is a man who is very dedicated to his work, since at 40 years old, he works tirelessly every day of the week from Monday to Sunday at his business making fast food and some bread. 

He is the father of two children who depend entirely on him. He sees an opportunity from an entity that offers the confidence of having a loan to improve his business and dream of having a food-making factory, and make him believe that it is possible to achieve this dream. 

He works 6 hours each day at his business.

He asks for a loan to make improvements to his space and purchase the ingredients for the foods that he sells.

With the help of this loan, Luis will make more food and it will allow him to get more income so each day he can give better life opportunities to his two children.

loans.use: to make improvements to the space and purchase ingredients for the food he sells.

loans.name: Rosalba De Jesus

texts.es:
Rosalba es una mujer muy tierna, carismática, amorosa, ella una trabajadora, nacida en el campo, pero por motivos fuera de su alcance llego a la ciudad de bello, allí se radico y como la perseverante y luchadora mujer de inmediato busco algo para hacer, con ayuda de préstamo, ayuda de otros entes compro una cafetera y una vitrina donde vendes café, perico (café con leche), tinto, vende fritos como pasteles, tortas de carne, empanadas y buñuelos.

Ella es madre de 6 hijos y su  humilde negocio es el soporte para su familia, ahora busca sostenibilidad, diversificar sus productos, y o quiere hacer con la ayuda del proyecto Kiva, algo que la impacto y hasta le robo una lagrima la saber que hay tantas personas en el mundo que leerán su historia y estarían dispuestos a ayudarla.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de refrescos, para dar alternativas de bebidas, jugos naturales, e insumos para preparar alimentos.

es una republicación de un prestamo ya terminado
texts.en:
Rosalba is a tender, charismatic, loving woman. She is a hard-worker, born in the country, but for reasons beyond her control she arrived in the city of Bello. This is where she made her home and like the resilient fighter that she is immediately sought something to do. With the assistance of a loan and help from others she purchased a coffee machine and a food stall where she sells various types of coffee as well as fried pastels, meat tarts, empanadas, and buñuelos (fried dough balls).

She is the mother of six children and her humble business is the support for her family. Now she is looking to be sustainable, diversify her products, and with the help of Kiva do something of impact as she sheds a tear knowing how many people in the world who will read her story and be willing to help. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of soda, to have alternative beverage choices, natural juices, and ingredients to prepare food. This is a re-publication of a loan that's already completed.

loans.use: towards the purchase of soda, natural juices, and ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Neder

texts.es:
Neder es un hombre del campo, el cual trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, su actividad es la agricultura la cual aprendió de su padre y espera enseñar a sus dos hijos, pues no los ve como unos agricultores ya que es un trabajo demasiado pesado, quiere que sean unas personas estudiadas que apliquen sus conocimientos para mejorar la actividad, la forma de trabajar y las ganancias de la agricultura.
Su trabajo es humilde pero con este logra sostener a su familia, llevarles alimento, darles estudios, útiles escolares, uniforme y algo que es indispensable en su hogar el amor. 
Neder solicita un pequeño monto del préstamo para comprar algunos insumos de mantenimiento de cultivos como lo son abonos y gallinaza, con estos ayudara la cosecha que ya está próxima sea de muy buena calidad y abundante.
texts.en:
Neder is a man of the fields, which he works on from 5 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. His business is agriculture which he learned from his father and he hopes to teach to his two children, for he does not see them as farmers because it is a very labored job. He wants them to be educated people that apply their knowledge to improve the business, the way of working, and the agricultural earnings.  

His work is humble but with it he manages to support his family, bring them food, give them schooling, school supplies, uniforms and something that is essential in his home: love. 

Neder is asking for a small loan amount to buy some crop maintenance supplies such as fertilizers and manure. These will help the next harvest be of very good quality and plentiful.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of his crops (fertilizers and manure)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a bigger-sized poly tank to store more water for his water vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a poly tank and store water for cooking, and to buy bags of sachet drinking water to resell at her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains to resell later

loans.name: Ref Group

texts.en:
Ref is a group of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Samera, who is a 25-year-old single woman, is the leader of the group. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a sewing machine to expand her business. 

The new sewing machine will help Samera to complete more projects in a short time. She will be able to complete more of her customers' orders. 

In the beginning, she was refusing many requests from customers because her business was lacking a lot of sewing equipment. 

In truth, this loan will make her profits increase, thus helping her to provide her family with better living conditions. 

One of her sisters has good abilities in the art of sewing but she doesn't have the proper environment. Samera will help her work on that new machine to help her, as well as to gain more experience in this field. 

With this loan, Samera will create jobs in her community. She hopes to open a large sewing store outside her house.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.name: Grupo Chuiwonabaj Group

texts.es:
Pasucala (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una mujer de 39 años de edad, está unido solamente con su esposo con el que tiene tres hijos de las edades entre once y dieciséis años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Pascuala una mujer responsable y amable, que para generar sus ingresos tiene una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes, desde hace ocho años en el lugar de su domicilio, ella para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica de su región, ella cuenta que gracias a estas dos actividades  ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Pascuala con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos y ver su negocio crecer ha organizar a un grupo de mujeres para juntas solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá surtiendo los productos de su tienda comprando recitos, refrescos, aceite, arroz y azúcar.
El gran sueño de Pascuala es poder hacer de su negocio algo más grande e instalar en ella un molino de nixtamal.
texts.en:
Pascuala (first one from right to left) is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and has three children that are between eleven and sixteen years old. This beautiful family lives in the community of Sololá.

Pascuala is a responsible and kind woman. Her source of income is a small store she owns. She has been buying and selling groceries at home for eight years. To improve her income, she also makes traditional regional clothes. She says that thanks to these activities she has managed to maintain her family.

Pascuala realized that she needed to improve her income and expand her business, so she decided to start a group of women in order to request a loan group together. She will use it to buy supplies for her store, such as snacks, beverages, vegetable oil, rice, and sugar.

Pascuala’s biggest dream is to expand her business and buy a corn grinder to make nixtamal [corn soaked and cooked in limewater].

loans.use: to buy groceries such as snacks, beverages, vegetable oil, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Limaniya Group

texts.fr:
Magan est celui qui a sa main sur la charrette 
Magan est un artisan Malien âge de 46 ans. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants dont tous vont à l’école. L’âge des enfants se situe entre 18 et 3 ans. La conjointe de Magan est une commerçante d’habits, bouillie.
Magan, limite dans l’exercice de son travail d’artisan fabrication de : charrettes, les charrues, les semoir et les daba. Il veut être équipé dans l’avenir avec des machines à souder, machine à couper et les fers lourds. Son espoir est qu’il possède suffisamment de connaissance pour exercer son travail.
Il fait recourt au RMCR parce qu’il n’a pas assez de moyen pour l’achat d’une grande quantité de fer pour la fabrication des charrettes et la charrue.
Magan s’approvisionne en fer, en bois  sur les marchés publics urbain et revend sur les marchés locaux.
Magan emploie l’argent pour l’achat de fer et de bois, il a 30 ans expériences pour la fabrication des charrues et les charrettes.
L’emprunteur se heurte souvent à du manque de produit sur le marché (fer, bois).
Le profit qu’il réalise   lui permet de subvenir au besoin de sa famille (sante, frais scolaire des enfants, nourriture …).
texts.en:
Magan is the one with a hand raised in the photo. He is a Malian artisan, 46 years old, and a married father of six children, all in school. Their ages range from 3 to 18 years old. Magan’s wife is a merchant selling clothing and porridge. Magan’s work involves handcrafted carts, plows, seed spreaders, and short-handled hoes. In the future, he wants to be equipped with a welding machine, a cutting machine, and some heavy iron. His hope is that he has enough knowledge to carry out his work. 

Magan has turned to RMCR, since he cannot afford a large quantity of iron for making carts and plows. He gets his iron and wood from public markets in cities and resells his goods at local markets. He is using the money to purchase iron and wood. He has thirty years of experience in making carts and plows. This borrower often runs into the problem of a lack of products on the market (iron, wood). The profit he earns enables him to meet family needs (healthcare, the children’s school fees, food, …)

loans.use: to purchase iron to make farm tools

loans.name: Bắc

texts.en:
Bắc works in agriculture, farming food. She is married with 2 children and lives in Bim Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Bắc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bắc has been involved in agriculture for 8 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Bắc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY est un promotrice qui évolue dans la commercialisation des bijoux et des bracelets dans la marché de la ville. Elle est un habitué du Guichet et y vient souvent pour faire des opérations de dépôt et retrait. Etant à son 5 ème prêt, elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des bracelets et des bijoux pour les revendre à ses clients.Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants ainsi que les frais médicaux. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 14h. Elle n'a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l'institution. A l'avenir, elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus en diversifier ses marchandises. De ce fait elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
KHADY is an entrepreneur who has been selling jewelry and bracelets in the town market. She  frequents the field office, often to make deposits or withdrawals. Being on her fifth loan, she is requesting this amount to buy bracelets and other jewelry to resell to her clients. She is married and the mother of a family who helps her husband cover the daily expenses and school fees of her children, as well as the medical expenses. She has more than 10 years' experience and begins her day at 9 am to end it at 2 pm. Khady has no relatives who are recipients of UIMCEC. 

In future, she hopes to grow her income by diversifying her merchandise. That will allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy bracelets and other jewelry for resale to her potential customers

loans.name: Same

texts.en:
Same is 47 years old and lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is the lovely mother of three children. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use.  There is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 57 years old, married and has eight children. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Emma has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Emma has been farming rice for seven years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 40 years old and married, and she has ten children, four of whom are in school.

Mary Rose is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Rose requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Rose has been raising pigs for three years now, and she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, a widow, works hard to support her family. She has been operating a buy and sell sand and gravel business in the Philippines for 17 years now.

Having repaid her previous loan, Fe has requested a new one for PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy more tons of sand and gravel and pay for the laborer's salary.

Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more tons of sand and gravel and pay for the laborer's salary

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 32 years old. He is married with five children between the ages of 3 and 12 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been farming for the past 10 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and for their welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Thọ

texts.en:
Mrs Thọ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. Thọ is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thọ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thọ faces in her life is not having latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thọ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Xuyến

texts.en:
Xuyến has a retail business selling tapes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years.

Xuyến is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Xuyến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Xuyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Janice has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as sardines, diapers, soap, noodles and other groceries to sell.

Janice has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Janice would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sardines, diapers, soap, noodles and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is a 43-year-old married grocer with four children who lives in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been doing her business for over 14 years. Three of her four children are factory workers and one attends school. Her husband is a 50-year-old man and he earns some income from water selling. The family can earn around $32 each day. 

Pao would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, Pao is going to save money to build a  proper new house and support her child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Dilrabohon

texts.ru: Дилрабохон 21 летняя жительница города Турсунзаде. Она замужем и мать одного сына. Дилрабохон живет вместе мамой, сестренкой и сыном. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Дилрабохон в городе занимается продажей одежды. Она продает рубашки, футболки, джинсы и свитеры. Дилрабохон 5 лет продвигает эту деятельность. Она любит свою работу. Ей нравится встречаться с новыми людьми и помогать им с выбором. На данный момент у Дилрабо возникли финансовые затруднения, по которым она вынуждена, обратилась за кредитом. Дилрабохон за счет кредита привезет новую весеннюю одежду на продажу, и привлечь больше клиентов. С такими планами  она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Дилрабохон верит, что Вы ей поможете, и доходность от продажи не упадет.
texts.en: Dilrabohon is a 21 year-old resident of Tursunzade. She is married and the mother of one son. Dilrabohon lives with her mother, sister and son. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Dilrabohon sells clothes in town. She sells shirts, jeans and sweaters. Dilrabohon has been doing this for five years. She loves her job. She likes to meet new people and help them make decisions. Currently, Dilrabohon is having financial difficulties which have forced her to request a loan. Dilrabohon will use the loan to bring new spring clothes for sale and attract more customers. To accomplish these plans, she has turned to you for a loan. Dilrabohon believes that you will help her, and that her income from sales will not decrease.

loans.use: purchase seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Despite getting older, Concepcion still has her eagerness to grow her business. Concepcion is engaged in retailing grocery items in their village. She is managing the business while taking care of her grandchildren. Concepcion's husband is a farmer. Sometimes her husband assists her in selling when there are lots of customers who want to buy items in their store. 

Concepcion is aiming for bigger income so that she will be able to save some of it for the future of her husband. Concepcion wants to borrow a loan of P20,000 to buy coffee, sugar, powdered milk, and detergent soap. She will do her best to serve her customers well, encourage more customers, and sell more items for bigger income as well.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, powdered milk, and detergent soap.

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Sambat, 55 years old, is originally from Kampong Cham Province. She has five children. She is an experienced and active farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 5 a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost thirty years.

To supplement her farming operation, she would like to use a rice milling machine. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a rice milling machine. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can operate her business better and faster. She is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy a rice milling machine

loans.name: Thế

texts.en:
Mrs Thế works in agriculture farming food. Thế is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thế joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thế has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thế has been involved in her business for eight years.  The main hardship that Thế faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thế hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền works in agriculture farming food. Hiền is 34 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in her business for eight years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In future, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a mother of three children. To earn a living she is engaged in an internet cafe business to aid her husband in providing the needs of their family. It is a growing business for her family because they get their children's allowances from this business. She decided again to take a loan to purchase equipment for the maintenance of her internet cafe.

Juanita wants to expand her business in the future. She wants to have another internet cafe business for additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the maintenance of her internet cafe.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 55 years old and has a live-in partner with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Nimfa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Nimfa has been in pig fattening for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruit and legumes to sell across from the local hospital.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 51 years old and widowed. She has been blessed with 4 children, and they are currently living in a rural community. 

As a way of generating income, Dominga runs a small retail business, and she also buys and sells fruits and vegetables within her locality. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve her business in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to borrow an additional 20,000 PHP to buy more inventory of grocery items, fruits, and vegetables to resell. 

Being a hardworking mother, Dominga believes that she will improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of grocery items, fruits, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She operates an auto shop and provides tire and wheel services as well as general auto services. 

Carina is a 49-year-old married mother of 5 grown children. For more than 10 years she has been running her business.

Carina has requested a loan to buy tools and equipment. These materials are beneficial in the operation of her business. She will be able to provide quality services at very affordable rates, allowing her to to attract more customers and increase her family's daily earnings.

Carina hopes that she will be able to both set aside some of the earnings for the renovation of her business as well as become economically sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 36, lives in a small community in Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is a father of three children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 7.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Meth, who is 50 years old, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has 5 children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farm. She grows rice and sells her agricultural products to local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for 15 years. On average, she is able to earn 5.00 USD each day.

In this farming season, Meth lacks the money to buy some supplies. To continue farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva lenders to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides.  

Meth is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fishing products to sell.

loans.name: Sry

texts.en:
Sry is a 59-year-old woman from a remote area of Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of four children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. She is able to make an income of 2.50 USD per day, on average. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for almost 40 years. 

She would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the NBP (National Biogas Program) project and in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and that she will reduce smoke from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate from its general loans. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en: Racquel is 25 years old and single. Due to a lack of job opportunities, she engages in reselling general merchandise within the public market. She has been in this business for more than one year and she aspires to further improve it in order to earn a higher income. Having insufficient capital, she would like to access an additional PHP 50,000 to buy more stock of dry goods (RTW), footwear, toys and accessories to resell. Through this financial assistance, Raquel believes that she will further improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods (RTW), footwear, toys and accessories to resell

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 32 years old and married with two children.

Annaliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Annaliza has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Annaliza aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 38 years old, and she is married with 3 children who are all attending school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 5 years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She is selling goods such as biscuits, chocolates, canned goods, beverages, soap, condiments and soft drinks. She is a 64-year-old married woman with seven grown children from Talibon, Bohol.  To have an additional source of income, she engages in a food vending business. She has been operating a store for almost six years now. 

She has requested a loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and shampoo. These are very helpful goods that would fill her store and attract more customers to purchase. In this way, her daily sales will improve and she will be able to settle her obligations. She could now set aside some savings for her business expansion.

Carmelita hopes to have more capital for the sustainability of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and shampoo

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad, toda su vida  se ha dedicado a la agricultura ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, luego se casó y procreó tres hijos, años después su esposa viajó a EE.UU. y se llevó a dos de sus hijos, por lo tanto solo uno vive con José y estudia octavo grado.

José toda su vida ha trabajado la agricultura ya que es de donde puede ganarse el dinero para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su hijo.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar materiales agrícolas y darle mantenimiento a la hectárea y media de milpa que ha sembrado.

José sueña con poder ir a EE.UU. con su hijo menor y reencontrarse con el resto de su familia.
texts.en:
For his whole life 43-year old José has worked in agriculture as he didn’t have the opportunity to go to school. Then he married and had three children. Some years after that his wife travelled to the USA taking with her two of the children. Only one lives with José and he is in grade 8 at school. 

José earns his living as a farmer so he can pay for basic necessities and his son’s needs.

He plans to use the loan to buy agricultural supplies to put on the 1.5 hectares where he grows maize. His dream is to be able to go to the USA with his younger son and rejoin the rest of his family.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies for the 1.5 hectares where he grows maize

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer  amable y responsable que tiene  36 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juana para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres  con los gastos de la casa, tiene una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes, ella eligió esta actividad porque en su comunidad no hay ninguna tienda, es por ello que la gente lo busca cada día más. Juana a pesar de su dedicación y esmero por hacer de su tienda algo más grande, que hasta ahora no ha sido posible porque sus ganancias no se dan abasto para surtir mejor el negocio, por tal motivo él solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá comprando mercaderías como  azúcar, gaseosas, galletas y golosinas.
Juana sueña con poder tener una tienda más grande  donde ella pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is a friendly and responsible woman, 36 years old, who is single and lives with her parents in a community in Sololá.

Juana, to generate her income and support her parents with the household expenses, has a small store where she buys and sells groceries. She chose this work because in her community there aren't any stores. For this, people come to seek her out more and more each day. Juana, despite her dedication and desire to make her store something bigger, hasn't been able to up to now because her earnings aren't sufficient to stock her store better, so she asks for a loan which she will invest in purchasing merchandise such as sugar, soft drinks, cookies and sweets.

Juana dreams of being able to have a larger store where she can get better income.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sugar, soft drinks, cookies and sweets to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
María, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado y no pudo continuar estudiando,  porque sus padres, ya no podían seguir pagando sus estudios, está soltera y tiene 3 hijos, pero ninguno de ellos vive con ella, solamente cuida una nieta y una sobrina. 

María, ha dedicado toda su vida a los oficios del hogar y para salir adelante ha trabajado en lavar y planchar ropa ajena.- Anteriormente, trabajaba vender comida, ahora cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar lámina para colocárselo al techo de su casa, además quiere instalar la energía eléctrica, porque actualmente no tiene ese servicio.

Ella sueña con arreglar por completo su vivienda y además espera tener una vida larga para ver crecer a sus nietos.
texts.en:
María, 56 years old, went to school up to the third grade and couldn't continue her education because her parent's couldn't keep paying for her schooling. She is single and has 3 children, but none of them live with her, she only cares for a granddaughter and a niece. 

María has worked her whole life doing the household tasks and, to get ahead, she has worked washing and ironing of other people's clothing. Previously, she worked selling food, now she has the support of her children. 

The loan is needed to purchase metal sheeting to place it on the roof of her house; in addition she wants to install electricity because currently she doesn't have that service. 

She drams of completely fixing up her house and in addition hopes to have a long life to be able to see her grandchildren grow up.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting to place it on the roof of her house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre trabajador de 39 años, goza de su gran familia conformada por sus 4 hijos y su pareja Eva, ambos siempre se han apoyado para salir adelante por sus hijos. Juan se dedica a la agricultura principalmente el cultivo de maíz, siempre se ha preocupado por el medio ambiente, es por ello que realiza practicas amigables con el medio ambiente. Juan solicita el préstamo para incursionar en la ganadería; comprara ganado vacuno, Juan espera producir carne orgánica, alimentando a su ganado con forraje de calidad. Juan espera tener como ventaja una comercialización a un más alto costo que la carne producida bajo un método de producción tradicional.
texts.en: Juan is a hard-working man, 39 years old, he enjoys his great family made up of his 4 children and his partner Eva. Both always have helped each other to get ahead for their children. Juan works in agriculture, primarily growing corn. He has always been concerned about the environment, so he uses practices that are friendly for the environment. Juan asks for the loan to enter into animal husbandry, he will purchase cattle. Juan hopes to produce organic meat, feeding his cattle with quality forage. Juan hopes to have as an advantage a sale at a higher cost than the meat produced with the traditional production methods.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Carinositos Group

texts.es:
Roxana es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, de buen trato, amable, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’, un área caracterizada por la producción y manufactura, donde microempresarios de áreas; como la costura, el diseño y las artesanías, reproducen productos extranjeros para ofertarlos en los principales mercados, es el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-32 grados centígrados.
Roxana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie, la segunda de la izquierda, viste blusa negra). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de ampliar su actividad y mejorar su negocio la impulsó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; llantería, venta de blusas, servicio de fotocopias, venta de refrescos naturales, venta de frutas, venta de cosméticos por catálogo y venta de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana en un puesto de venta fijo. “mi mamá me enseñó a cocinar, después trabaje como ayudante y actualmente me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende dentro del mismo mercado y se abastece de ahí, la desventaja es que el lugar es alejado y en la semana circula menos gente. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y abrir otro en un mercado cercano. Ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes de forma adecuada. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Roxana solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Roxana is a 36 year old single woman. She has 3 children of ages 12, 10 and 8. Her business is selling traditional food. She is a good and fair mother, kind, steadfast, responsible and hard working. She carries out her business in the “plan 3000” zone, an area known for productivity and manufacturing where there are small businesses in areas such as tailoring, design and crafts, which imitate foreign products to sell them in the central marketplace. It is the most populated neighborhood in the city and has a warm tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-32 degrees Celsius.

Roxana is short and has dark skin, brown eyes, long black hair she keeps tied up and a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Guarani which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work that she does (she is standing, second from the left, wearing a black blouse).

She shares her life with her children who are in school. She lives in a rented room made of brick and cement with a sheet metal roof. It has potable water, electricity and sewage services. 

Needing to expand and improve her business pushed her to establish a bank with people with jobs like tire repair, photocopying services, selling blouses, natural drinks, fruit, cosmetics from a catalog and empanadas, in order to request a loan and grow their businesses.

Her business is selling traditional food like locotos rellenos (peppers, diced meat, onion), arroz con queso (rice, milk, cheese), ají de panza (pork belly, onion and tomato accompanied with rice) and others. She does this work every day of the week from a fixed stall. “My mother showed me how to cook, then I worked as a helper and I am now independent” she says. The advantage of her business is that she sells in the same market where she restocks supplies from. The disadvantage is that the place is far away and less people circulate during the week. Her dream is to expand her business and open another at a nearby market. She wishes to purchase tables and chairs for attending to her customers in an appropriate way. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Roxana requests a loan to buy tables and chairs for attending to a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs in order to attend to a greater number of customers.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, 40, is married and has three children attending school. As a hardworking mother, she supports her husband in generating income through direct-selling Avon, Natasha, MSE and Tupperware products within her community. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aspires to further improving her business to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of 12,000 Philipinne pesos to buy more stock of Avon, Natasha, MSE and Tupperware. 

With this financial assistance, she believes, someday, she will be able to improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more Avon, Natasha, MSE and Tupperware products to sell

loans.name: Armeliza

texts.en:
Armeliza  owns a sari-sari (variety store), where she sells basic commodities, such as biscuits, chips, chocolates, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. She is the mother of a two-year-old son. Her husband works as a mechanic's helper, and his income helps address the family's daily needs. Together with her family, she lives in Getafe, Bohol.

Armeliza has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to purchase rice, soft drinks and assorted items for her general store. An increase in stock will attract more customers to shop and purchase at her store. Her earnings will increase, and she will begin to afford a healthy diet for her growing child.

Armeliza dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks and assorted items for her store

loans.name: Reiner

texts.es:
Reiner tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en el distrito de Pomahauca, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café. Adicionalmente se dedica a cultivar maíz, frejol, yuca, rocoto. Cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, con esto Reiner espera tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto y obtendrá mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reiner, 38, is in a common-law relationship and lives with his wife and son in the district of Pomahauca, situated in the Jaén province of Cajamarca, in the Northern Sierra region of Peru. Life in the district is peaceful and the population mainly work in agriculture, trade and cattle-raising.

He makes a living working in agriculture, specifically coffee farming, but also cultivating corn, beans, cassava and peppers. He has 6 years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional recommendations in the local area.

Reiner will use the awarded loan on agricultural needs such as applications and incorporation of pesticides, fertilizers and manual labour for his harvest. This will help him improve his crops in physiological, morphological and productivity terms and he hopes to have a more suitable crop. Consequently his production will increase, as will the quality of produce, therefore he won’t have any problems selling his produce and increasing his earnings which will in turn allow him to better the quality of life of him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, fertilizers and manual labour for his harvest.

loans.name: Godofredys

texts.es:
Godofredys tiene 35 años de edad, desde pequeño ha trabajado en la agricultura ya que su padre solo lo apoyó para que sacara el noveno grado, hoy en día está casado y ha procreado un hijo que tiene 12 años de edad el cual estudia séptimo grado.

Él cultiva diversas hortalizas como chile, tomate, pipián, entre otras lo cual son sus principales fuentes de ingresos.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar varias plantas de chiles ya que tiene una casa maya y necesita sembrarle el cultivo.

Godofredys sueña con tener un invernadero para poder cultivarlo, sacar mejores ingresos y ayudar a su hijo a seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Ever since he was young, 35-year old Godofredys has worked in agriculture. His father only supported him until he had completed grade 9 at school. Now Godofredys is married and has a 12-year old son who is in grade 7. 

Most of his income comes from the various kinds of vegetables he grows like chili, tomatoes, squash etc. He is now seeking a loan to buy chili plants that he will grow under netting. His dream is to have a hothouse where he can grow the plants, earn more money, and help his son continue his education.

loans.use: buy chili plants that he will grow under netting

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 36 years old. She is a married mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercy has a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soap, and other groceries.

Mercy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soap, and other groceries.

loans.name: Chankhon

texts.en:
Chankhon is a 39-year-old married factory worker with three children. She lives in the Kandal province in Cambodia. 

She has worked in a factory for over 14 years. Her husband, 38, is a house builder. She and her husband can earn around $19 (US) per day. 

Chankhon would like to buy construction materials to renovate her house and build fences around it, so she is applying for this loan. The loan will help provide enough money to build a proper house and achieve better living conditions. 

In the future, she wants to help her children earn a high education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house and build fences around it

loans.name: Sreyroath

texts.en: Sreyroath is a 31-year-old married factory worker with two young dependent children. She lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has been working in a factory in a nearby province for over 2 years. Her husband is 33 years old and he works as a security guard. Sreyroath and her husband can make around $12 each day. She wants to improve her family’s finances, so she seeks a loan to buy clothes and lotion to sell to the factory workers who work in the same factory. In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy clothes and lotion to sell to the factory workers

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet, 52, is originally from Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of six children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing and selling rice to local dealers. She has been in this business for around 30 years and earns, on average, $3 (US) a day.

Samet resides a little bit far from her water source, so it is hard and time-consuming for her to get water. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan to dig a well for household use.  

With the support of this loan, she hopes to access water more easily than before and in a shorter amount of time. She is thankful to lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 62, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice field located near her house. She has been in this type of business for nearly 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of $6 (US) a day.

She wants to improve the entire family's general living conditions with a latrine, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. 

By doing so, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for this loan, granted through Hattha Kaksekar Ltd. with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon, 44, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for nearly thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the opportunity to borrow through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling soap. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional tools and materials for her furniture-making business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and materials for her business

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifan from Lahore, Pakistan! She is married and the responsible mother of two sons and two daughters.

Hanifan requested a loan for her husband: he offers fruit chat (a Pakistani food) at evening-time to the common people of his area. For this he needs fresh fruits like apples, bananas, and spices, etc. in large quantities. Hanifan helps her husband during preparing fruit chat at noon-time. He wants to offer more fruit chat to his customers because the demand has been increasing over time. 

Hanifan hopes that through this loan her husband would be able to generate more income than earlier. She thanks to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan team.

loans.use: to increase in her husband's fruit chat business

loans.name: Selca

texts.en:
Selca is 67 years old and the widowed mother of three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Selca has a hardware business in the Philippines. Selca has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of hardware to resell.

Selca has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Selca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of hardware to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a power generator since the one that he has is already past its useful life and it is indispensable for his work

loans.name: Kelly Mariella

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, patos, cuyes, etc; cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Kelly, 37, is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  She lives with her family in the Oyotún district, in a rural area of the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The people in the district work mainly in agriculture and ranching.

Kelly earns a living raising and selling roosters, hens, chickens, turkeys, ducks, guinea pigs, and other animals.  She has more than 15 years of experience in the business and good personal and professional references.

She's requesting the loan to buy a large quantity of animals to increase the stock in her business.

This investment will help her have a wider variety of animals and better productivity, which will impact her business.  She plans to increase her stock to be able to serve the various tastes and needs of her customers in the area.  This will have a positive impact on her sales level and, consequently, will improve her family's quality of life and her own.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals to increase her stock

loans.name: Maria Aminta

texts.es:
María, de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos, pero todos están acompañados y solamente una nieta vive con ellos.

María, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 8 años, el negocio lo aprendió de su familia, además tiene un molino desde hace tres años.- Anteriormente, ha trabajado en los oficios domésticos, el negocio lo atiende todos los días, desde las 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 u 8:00 p.m.  

El préstamo lo necesita para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, quiere hacer la pared más alta y necesita adobe, teja y madera para terminar de poner el techo y pagar mano de obra. 

Su principal sueño, es terminar de arreglar la casa y seguir trabajando para que no les falte nada, en un futuro espera darle el estudio a su nieta.
texts.en:
María, 65, studied up to first grade.  She's in a relationship and her partner is a farmer.  They have four children, but they're all married and only a granddaughter lives with them.

María has had a small store for eight years.  She learned the business from her family.  She also has had a mill for three years.  Prior to that she worked in housekeeping services.  She tends her business from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

She needs the loan to make improvements on her home.  She wants to make the wall taller and she needs adobe, tile, and wood to finish putting on the roof and to pay for labor.

María's main dream is to finish fixing up the house and to keep working so she always has what she needs.  She would like to give her granddaughter an education in the future.

loans.use: to make improvements on her home

loans.name: 12 Corazones Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “12 CORAZONES” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de ropa, venta de polleras, venta de queso. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, con un pequeño capital para emprender su negocio, menciona que este negocio lo aprendió de su sobrina que tenía un negocio similar. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra abarrotes y carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank '12 Corazones' (12 Hearts) will begin their twelfth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamerican regional hub. The group is made up of nine members and is led by an executive board. Nancy is the president of the board. The businesses that the communal bank members run are varied and include selling meals, fish, clothes, skirts, and cheese.

This loan will benefit the small group of microbusinesswomen that Nancy is a part of. She told us that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago after being invited by a friend who was a client of the institution. Nancy currently runs a business selling meals and she let us know that she started this business several years ago with a small amount of capital to set it up. She also mentioned that she learnt how to run this business from her niece who has a similar business.

The loan that Nancy is currently taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying groceries and meat in bulk) that she will acquire from vendors in the city of El Alto and later use to create meals which she will sell in her workplace. This form of work allows her to generate an income to financially support her family since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Nancy replied that she liked the training and the health service offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy groceries and meat in bulk

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 61 years old and has three children. She is widowed and has one child who is still in school. Victoria is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines, which she has been doing for the past five years.

Victoria has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Catalina is 50 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Catalina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Catalina has been in this business for nine years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Zorayda

texts.en:
Zorayda is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling feed and pig fattening. Zorayda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Zorayda has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fidel De Jesús

texts.es:
Fidel de 51 años de edad, no estudió porque desde pequeño se dedicó al trabajo, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene una hija que estudia cuarto grado de educación básica y nadie mas depende de Fidel.


Fidel se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la siembra de hortalizas, también a la ojalatería, tiene 30 años de experiencia en la  actividad y anteriormente se dedicaba a sembrar maíz y frijol.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar una yunta de bueyes para arar la tierra.

Él sueña con ampliar su negocio, emplear a sus vecinos y darle estudios a su hija.
texts.en:
Fidel, 51, didn't go to school because he worked from a young age.  He's married and his wife is a homemaker.  He has a daughter in fourth grade.  Nobody else is dependent on Fidel.

Fidel earns a living raising cattle and growing vegetables.  He also works as a tinsmith.  He has 30 years of experience in this job.  Before that he worked growing corn and beans.

He needs this loan to buy a team of oxen to plow the land.

Fidel dreams of expanding his business, employing his neighbors, and giving his daughter an education.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen to plow the land

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan has worked in agriculture for 8 years. She is 37 years old and is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main harship that she faces in life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Loan plans to improve her business. She hopes to earn enough money to provide for her kids and hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora lucia, tiene 28 años de edad, trabaja y vive en una comunidad rural junto a sus 2 hijos, sufrió el abandono dsu pareja, por tal razón ella sola realiza una sacrificada labor para ofrecer el sustento y educación a sus hijos. Se dedica a la actividad económica de agricultura por los gastos generados en la agricultura y los precios de sus productos que disminuyeron en la temporada pasada, bajaron sus ingresos. Con la intención de mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia la señora lucia solicita un crédito para arriendo (alquiler) de terreno  agrícola en su misma comunidad para aumentar su producción de hortalizas y verduras. Lucia es una persona muy responsable y en el futuro quiere realizar inversiones mayores para la producción agrícola y de esta manera ofrecer productos alimenticios de mejor calidad al mercado y aportar al desarrollo de la región.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucia, 28 years old, works and lives in a rural community together with her two children. Her partner abandoned her, so for this reason she has made sacrifices on her own to give her children sustenance and education.  

She makes a living through agriculture. Because of the expenses in farming and the prices of her products that have declined in past seasons, her income has gone down. 

Intending to improve her income and family’s quality of life, Ms. Lucia is asking for a loan to rent farm land in the same community to increase her production of vegetables. 

Ms. Lucia is a very responsible person, and in the future wants to invest more in her agricultural production – and thus offer better quality food products at the market and contribute to the development of the region.

loans.use: to rent farm land to increase her vegetable production to improve her profit and family’s quality of life.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 33 years old and single. She owns and manages a small retail store and offers short order snacks and coffee within her locality. She aspires to improve her business and earns a higher income to support her parents and her younger brother and sisters. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to avail an additional of PHP10,000.00 to buy more grocery items, like coffee, seasonings and ingredients needed in cooking snack foods for sale. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, like coffee, seasonings and ingredients needed for for snack food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio de productos lácteos, tienen dos hijos, ambos ya están casados y son independientes económicamente, solo depende ellos sus dos nietos.

Luis, trabaja en un centro comercial, pero siempre se ha dedicado a la ganadería y a la producción de leche, cuajada, crema, queso, etc. Viaja en autobús para llegar al potrero donde tiene su ganado, porque está como a 7 kilómetros de distancia.

El préstamo lo quiere para comprar harinilla y concentrado para el ganado, además el pasto que tiene se le está terminando y quiere comprar un silo, porque se lo venden barato.- Además, tiene dos vacas que están por parir y quiere darles un cuidado especial, para tener una buena producción de leche.

El sueño de Luis, es ser un distribuidor mayoritario de productos lácteos, tener una de las mejores ganaderías de zona y además contratar un empleado más, porque actualmente tiene uno y con otro le daría mayor atención a su ganado.
texts.en:
Luis, aged 63, studied up to second grade. He is married, and his wife makes a living selling dairy products. They have two children, both of whom are married and financially independent. Only their two grandchildren are their dependants.

Luis works at a mall, but he has always worked raising cattle and producing milk, curd, cream, cheese, and the like. He takes the bus to get to the field where he keeps his cattle because it is located at a distance of about seven kilometers.

He is requesting a loan to buy wheat middlings and concentrated feed for his cattle.

He is almost out of fodder grass, and he wants to buy a silo because it's being offered to him at a low price. He also has two cows that are about to calve, and he wants to give them special care in order to have a good milk production.

Luis dreams of being a wholesale distributor of dairy products, of having one of the best ranches in the area, and of hiring one more worker because he currently has one and he could use an extra hand to take better care of his cattle.

loans.use: to buy wheat middlings and concentrated feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en:
Shiela Mae is 24 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past five years.

Shiela Mae has requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, aged 38, is from the Kenyenya area of Kenya. She has been married to her husband for 10 years and they have a lovely family!  Rose has been a farmer for as long as she has been a wife. She operates on a small piece of land under her husband's name, keeping dairy cattle and poultry and growing crops and trees. 

Rose is seeking a small loan of KES 10,000 to buy farm implements. Working with modern tools will help her work to move faster and to become more efficient. She expects to see major improvements in the quality and quantity of yields led by the use of improved tools. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making folding beds in the Philippines.

Charita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Charita has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Charita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. Loreta is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Loreta requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Loreta has been in this business for 15 years now.

Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Zaida is asking for the loan to buy fruit and pastries to get ahead with her refreshments business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito son personas amables que se dedican a la agricultura y comercio como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace 03 años contando con experiencia en este sector y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Miguel espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 51 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own house with his two children in a rural area in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district are kind people who make a living primarily from agriculture and trade.

Miguel offers transportation services in his mototaxi (auto rickshaw). He has been doing this work for three years. He has experience in this sector and good references from his neighbours. 

He is requesting a loan in order to repair and maintain his vehicle, since it is currently in a bad state. In this way, Miguel hopes to be able to offer a better service to his clients, which will generate greater earnings for him and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle, since it is currently in a bad state

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of five from Nkubu, a remote town in the central province of Kenya. She has spent the past 3 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Agnes is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. Agnes wants to diversify and start a cereal gain selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereal grains for resale. The Nkubu area has a ready market for cereal grains, but the problem is that there are no cereal grain suppliers. With your loan, Agnes will be able to sell cereal grains to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan and she will also be able to save extra money. Agnes is very concerned about her childrens’ education, so profits from cereal grain business will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children. Agnes awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 65 years old and is married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Belinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more inventory such as shampoo, detergent soap, cooking oil, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, vinegar, eggs, etc. 

Belinda has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items in her grocery store

Belinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as shampoo, detergent soap, cooking oil, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, vinegar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is 28 years old and is married with 3 children. She earns a living with her business fattening pigs in the Philippines. 

Cecille is borrowing 22,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cecille has been running her pig fattening business for 10 years, though she also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Cecille is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
