Laura, de 70 años de edad, no estudio, su familia era numerosa y sus padres consideraban que el estudio no era necesario, se casó a los 23 años de edad, tuvo 3 hijos, pero dos se murieron, actualmente vive sola con su esposo que es carpintero, el único hijo que tienen ya está acompañado y vive cerca de su casa.

Laura, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, su esposo aún trabaja como carpintero, es peluquero del caserío y trabaja la agricultura como subsistencia cultivando maíz y frijol.

Laura, con el préstamo reparara el techo del corredor de su casa, donde trabaja su esposo en su pequeño taller de carpinteria.

Su sueño es tener un hogar más seguro y adecuado para trabajar, porque en época lluviosa se moja la madera y las herramientas.
texts.en:
Laura, 70, didn't study.  Her family was big and her parents considered that studies were not necessary.  She married at 23 years of age and had three children, but two died.  Nowadays, she lives with her husband who is a carpenter.  Their only son is married and lives near their house.
Laura spends her time keeping house.  Her husband, in addition to working as a carpenter, is the barber of the hamlet and works in subsistence agriculture raising corn and beans.
With the loan, Laura will repair the porch roof of the house where her husband works in his little carpentry workshop.
Her dream is to have a more secure home adequate to work in since during the rainy season the wood and tools get wet.

loans.use: to repair the porch roof of her house where her husband works in his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: José Maximiliano

texts.es:
José de 74 años de edad, no posee ningún tipo de preparación académica, solamente vive con su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

José tiene alrededor de 30 años dedicándose a la agricultura, esta actividad fue heredada por su padre quien le enseñó a cultivar maíz y frijol, pero hace 5 años atrás un amigo le enseñó la actividad de ganadería, por lo tanto ahora se dedica a las dos actividades de modo que no le falten los ingresos económicos.

Él solicita este préstamo a Credicampo para comprar dos bueyes que le servirán para arar la tierra.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y prestar sus servicios de arado a otros productores.
texts.en:
74-year-old José has not had any education. He lives with his wife, who spends her time doing the household chores.

José has been working in agriculture for around 30 years. He learnt this work from his father, who taught him how to grow maize and beans, but five years ago a friend taught him how to raise livestock. Now he does both kinds of work so that he has the income that he needs.

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo in order to buy two oxen, which will help him to plough the land. His dream is to continue working and to offer his ploughing services to other farmers.

loans.use: to buy two oxen, which will be useful for ploughing the land

loans.name: Irma Luz

texts.es:
Irma, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es jornalero, tiene 4 hijos que viven con ellos,  2 de ellos trabajan y solamente una estudia octavo grado.  

Irma, tiene venta de pupusas desde hace más de 10 años y una tienda desde hace 5 años, tomo la iniciativa para aportar para los gastos de la casa; cuando su pareja llega de trabajar, le ayuda a vender sus productos; la tienda la abren todos los días desde temprano y las pupusas las hace en la tarde. 

El préstamo lo necesita para construir un cafetín, para colocar la tienda, ya que donde está es en la sala de su casa y le abarca mucho espacio, es por eso que comparará bloques, cemento, arena, hierro y pagará la mano de obra. 

Ella espera que su negocio cada día vaya en aumento y atraer a más clientes, para que en futuro sea una tienda grande.- Además, espera que su hija termine el año escobar con buenas calificaciones.
texts.en:
43-year-old Irma studied up until the sixth grade. Her partner is a day labourer. She has four children, who live with them. Two of her children are working. Only one of her children (a daughter) is studying; she is currently in the eighth grade.

Irma has been selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) for more than ten years, and she has had a store for five years. She started her business in order to contribute towards paying for the household expenses. When her partner comes back from work, he helps her to sell her products. They open the store early every day and she makes the pupusas in the afternoon and evening.

She needs the loan in order to build a small café to put the store in, since at the moment it is in a room of her house and it takes up a lot of space. For this reason, she will use the loan to pay workers and to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, and iron.

She hopes that her business will keep increasing and attracting more clients every day so that it becomes a large store in the future. She also hopes that her daughter finishes the school year with good grades.

loans.use: to build a small café so she can relocate her store

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida is a 33-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three daughters and one son. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home.

Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard, her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. In this way, he can generate more income to financially support his family.

Farida is applying for a loan from Kiva’s field partner for her husband's shuttering work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Brasil Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BRASIL” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de gorras, venta de pantalones, venta de busos, venta de polainas, venta de deportivos, venta de edredones, venta de masitas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tejidos; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años, aprendiendo la técnica de tejido en su colegio, posterior a conseguir un poco de capital decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en la frontera de Bolivia - Perú. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "BRASIL" Community Group will start its 11th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of the Andes. It is formed by eight members and it is led by a board where Mrs. Justina is the President. The businesses run by this community group are diverse, among them: blanket sales, hat sales, pants sales, sweatsuit sales, gaiters sales, sportswear sales, comforter sales, and pastry sales. The loan obtained will benefit small micro entrepreneurs, of which Mrs. Justina is part of. She stated that this is the first time she participates with Pro Mujer, as she responded to an invitation sent through a massive promotion done in her zone. Currently, she has a knitting business. She started this business several years ago, learning the knitting technique at her school. Later, she obtained a little capital to invest on an independent business. This loan will be used to increase the capital to buy wool wholesale, which she will buy from wholesale saleswomen in the city of La Paz. Later, after working the wool, she will sell it at the Peru-Bolivia border. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, since she is married with two children. When asked what does she like about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health sector offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a widowed mother of 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old, and 2 of her children are still in school.

Cristita has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more firewood to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines.

Gloria has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional firewood to sell to her customers.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo es empleado, tiene una hija de 5 años de edad y está embarazada. 

Ana, tiene venta de medicina natural, tiene 3 meses de haber iniciado con este negocio,  anteriormente, era empelada de una farmacia, salía tarde y le quedaba lejos de su casa, fue por esa razón que decidió dejar ese empleo y dedicarse al negocio propio, la venta la tiene en su casa, pero en las mañanas sale a vender en el mercado. 

El préstamo lo necesita para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y comprar medicina al por mayor, porque se la dan en un buen precio. 

El sueño principal de Ana, es que su hija el otro año empiece a estudiar y que poder tener buena clientela en el negocio,  para aumentar sus ingresos y cubir los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old. She went to school up to high school. She is married and her husband is an employee. She has a 5 year old daughter and she is pregnant.   

Ana sells natural medicine. She started this business 3 years ago. Previously, she was an employee at a pharmacy. She would leave late and it was far away from her house. That is the reason that she decided to leave that job and decided to open her own business. She sells from her house, but in the morning she goes out to sell in the market. 

She needs the loan to keep investing in the business and buy medicine wholesale, because they give it to her at a good price.  

Ana's main dream is to start going to school and be able to have a good clientele in the business in order to increase her income and cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to continue investing in the business and buy medicine wholesale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina de 73 años de edad, no posee ningún tipo de nivel académico, tiene dos hijos pero solo uno vive con ella, es viuda pues su esposo falleció hace unos años.

Marina solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos, pero su esposo falleció y por lo tanto decidió trabajar en la agricultura con su hijo, ahora cultivan dos hectáreas de maíz para que no les falte el sustento de cada día.

Este crédito lo necesita para pagar el alquilar del terreno donde cultiva y para comprar insumos agrícolas.

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando y contar siempre con el apoyo de su hijo.
texts.en:
Marina is 73 years old. She doesn't have any education. She has two children, but only one of them lives with her. She is a widow because her husband died a few years ago. 

Marina used to just take care of the home, but her husband passed away and therefore she decided to work in agriculture with her son. Now they plant two hectares of corn so they won't lack to support themselves day to day. 

She needs this loan to pay rent on the land where she plants and to buy agricultural materials. 

She dreams of continuing to work and to always have her son's help.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land where she plants and to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.ru: Это Махлиё. Она молодая девушка. Ей всего 21 лет. Она замужем и мать одного ребенка. Она живет вместе мужем и свекровью в городе Турсунзаде. Махлиё шустрая и талантливая девушка. У нее есть свой бизнес. Махлиё занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она берет заказ на дому. Она ведет домашнее хозяйство и параллельно занимается шитьем. В швейной деятельности ей нравится ежедневный доход. Махлиё зарабатывает и помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Сейчас ее старая швейная машинка хорошо не выполняет свои функции, и она решила, взят кредит. За счет кредита она купить новую швейную машинку «YAMATA» и на часть, оставшаяся денег купить швейные принадлежности.  Махлиё заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Meet Mahliyo.  She is 21, a young wife and the mother of one child.  She lives with her husband and her mother-in-law in the city of Tursunzoda.  She is a smart and talented young woman.  She runs her own business: she sews women's clothes and works from orders, at home.  She takes care of the household and works as a seamstress at the same time.  She likes her activity for the daily earnings that it brings.  Mahliyo makes her own living and helps her husband to provide for the family.  Nowadays, however, her old sewing machine doesn't fulfill some of its functions any more.  For this reason, Mahliyo has decided to take a loan.  She will use this loan to buy a new "Yamata" sewing machine and, with the rest of the money, some sewing supplies.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some sewing supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old, married, and had a child. She and her husband manage a furniture-making business for income. Her spouse makes furniture to sell such as cabinets, tables, and chairs. 

Josephine wanted to improve their output; that is why she is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy wood for use in making furniture.  

Josephine will save the profits for educational purposes. She hopes to achieve financial stability for the family.

loans.use: to buy wood to use in making furniture

loans.name: Brenda May

texts.en:
Brenda May runs a store that sells read- to-wear (rtw) like various footwear and t-shirts for both genders.  She has been in this business almost four years. She is a 35-year-old married woman with three dependents ages 12, 9 and 7 years old. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more rtw stock. This will attract more buyers to shop and her income will go up. She would be able to attend to the needs of her children, and be able to handle her finances.

Brenda May hopes that she could improve her existing business to be able to send her children for a college education.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear stock

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Sofia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from rice retailing.  Sofia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Sofia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo de 38 años de edad, solo logró estudiar hasta quinto grado en la escuela, actualmente está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.

Desde muy joven, Gerardo se ha dedica a la agricultura, junto con su con su padre trabajaban el cultivo de maíz, actualmente Gerardo cultiva dos hectáreas de maíz y además en sus tiempos libres trabaja como albañil.

El crédito será invertido para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, entre otros para sembrar una hectárea de maíz. 

Como todo agricultor él tiene planes a futuro, uno de ellos es tener un buen cultivo de maíz ya que el precio de los granos básicos ha aumentado y además le gustaría reparar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 38 years old and only managed to study through 5th grade in school. Currently, he is married and his wife handles all the household chores. They have two children who are studying in school.

From a young age, Gerardo has been engaged in agriculture. He worked along with his father cultivating corn. Currently Gerardo cultivates 2 hectares of corn and also in his free time works as a bricklayer.

The loan will be invested in purchasing seeds, fertilizers, and other items to plant a hectare of corn.

As a farmer he has future plans. One of them is to have a good harvest of corn as the price of basic grains has increased. Also, he would like to repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other items to plant a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Kadia's Group

texts.fr: Kadia,  au deuxième rang à l'extrême droite sur la photo, est membre d'un groupe de 12 productrices agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Nafadji, au sud-ouest de Bamako, au Mali. Kadia, qui est âgé de 66 ans, vit dans une famille de 36 personnes dont 21 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet de nourrir ses enfants; elle explique que « quand on parle de vie on parle d'abord de nourriture ». Elle a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour les techniques de semi et de désherbage. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Kadia a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champs d' 1 hectare. A travers cet achat, Kadia espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements afin de pouvoir acheter un semoir et, de gérer les problèmes sanitaires et nutritionnels du village.
texts.en:
Kadia, at the far right in the second row in the photo, is a member of a group of twelve farmers who work and live in the village of Nafadji, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. Kadia, who is 66 years old, lives in a 36-person family, including 21 children. Farming enables her to feed her children; she explains that “When we talk about life, we first of all talk about food.”

Kadia decided to sign up at myAgro for sowing and weeding techniques. For her first year with myAgro, she bought a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts on her 1-hectare field. Through this purchase, she hopes to be able to increase her yields in order to purchase a seed spreading device and to manage village health and nutrition problems.

loans.use: a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a selling firewood business in the Philippines. Lucia is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lucia requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years. Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last five years. 

For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are not working. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. 

Therefore Shagufta has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. 

This will help him to continue his business. Shagufta is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lydia has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lydia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра жительница городка  под названием Турсунзаде. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Сайёра в городе занимается животноводством. Она любит животных и поэтому выбрала животноводческую деятельность. Сайёра занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота более 15 лет.  У нее есть коровник, где она ухаживает о своих животных. Ей в работе помогает дети. Сайёра хочет расширить животноводство. У нее осталось малое количество скота. Она запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести крупнорогатого скота и увеличить поголовье скота. Это кредит поможет ей сохранить деятельность. Сайёра верит в Вас и на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Sayora is a resident of the small town of Tursunzoda.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  She loves animals and chose this activity for this reason.  She has been raising cattle for more than 15 years.  She has a barn, where she takes care of her animals.  Her children help her with the farm work.  Sayora wants to expand her activity because, at the moment, she only has a small number of animals left.  She is taking a loan to buy some cattle and increase her livestock headcount.  This loan will help her to keep her activity.  She confidently relies on you and your support.

loans.use: to increase her livestock headcount and expand her activity.

loans.name: Mahinabonu

texts.ru: Махинабону 22 лет. Она молодая жительница города Турсунзаде. Она замужем и мать одного ребенка. Она в городке проживает вместе с мужем, свекровью и ребенком. Ее муж водитель такси. Он служить людям и зарабатывает на жизнь.  Сама Махинабону занимается шитьем женской одежды. По ее словам ей удобно занимается у себя дома. Потому, что у нее маленький ребенок, она ухаживает за ребенком. Махинабону активная девушка.  У нее есть свои клиенты. Она запрашивает кредит для купли новую швейную машинку. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. Вы можете поддержать Мухинабону.
texts.en: Mahinabonu is 22 years old.  She is a young resident of the town of Tursunzoda.  She is married and the mother of one child.  She lives in this small town with her husband, her mother-in-law and her child.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  He makes a living providing services to his clients.  Mahinabonu sews women's clothes.  According to her, she finds it convenient to work from home because she has a young child and she can take care of him.  Mahinabonu is a dynamic young woman.  She has her own customers.  She is taking a loan to buy a new sewing machine.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her activity and attract more customers.  Please support Mahinabonu.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 35-year-old mother who has three studying children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she helps her husband in gaining income by buying and reselling snack foods and frozen foods within their community. 

She aims to acquire more goods to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP10,000 to buy more stock of soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, fish, dressed chicken and frozen foods to sell. 

Being a hard working mother, she believes someday she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, fish, dressed chicken and frozen foods

location.town: Brgy. Oyao, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Laynie

texts.en:
Laynie is married and has two grade-school children. Her husband is a private employee. Her husband's salary is enough to sustain their daily needs, but Laynie wants to have savings for their future. 

With her desire to help her husband, Lanie runs a retailing of frozen foods and making bags and wallet coin purses out of beads. Laynie wish to sell more items but she can’t do it because she doesn’t have enough capital. 

Therefore, Laynie is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy materials need in making bags, wallets, ball pen holders, etc... She also plans to use the loan to buy sausage, hot dogs, and ham to sell. She will also use the loan to buy materials in beads making. 

Laynie has the willpower to sell more items and earn more.

loans.use: to buy materials need in making bags, wallets, ball pen holders, etc...

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish. She has been fishing for more than 10 years, together with her husband. This is the source of her income. She is a 50-year-old, married woman, and she has four children. Her youngest child is 15.

She has requested a loan to buy fishing net. These will enable her to improve her ongoing catch, and this will result in selling a higher volume of fish. She could then provide her family with proper diets and better living conditions.

Emelita is hoping that someday she will be productive in handling her business, for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina is 62 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Macrina has been in this business for 10 years.

Macrina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional firewood to sell.

In the future, Macrina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 53 years old and a widow with six children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sonia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Sonia has been raising pigs for six years, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has an electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an  additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is 32 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, sugar, bread and other groceries.

Maricor has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years, and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Maricor aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, sugar, bread and other groceries.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick, 19, is an ambitious and progressive member of Lolminingai village, found in the North Rift area of Kenya. He started dairy farming five years ago on a 3 acre piece of land in Lolminingai. Through the years, he has been able to learn and grow the business. He now owns three dairy cows and over 100 trees. His main income source is milk. 

Erick is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle that he plans to use to transport milk to the market. He has been saving for the motorcycle for a while now and he is going to use the loan money to top off the amount. 

The motorcycle will serve more purposes than mere transportation of milk: he will use the motorcycle to offer transportation services to the public. The additional income from transportation services will help him to come up with the money for the loan repayment much faster. 

Profits from this investment will help Erick to become financially stable as he prepares to start a family of his own in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eugenia works hard to support her family. She has a coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  

Eugenia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell to customers.

Eugenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Merlyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

Merlyn is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more fish, to sell in her food stall.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Groupement Awa

texts.fr:
Le groupement » Awa tilène », est composé de cinq femmes qui travaillent toutes au port. Elles se sont réunies en groupement afin de bénéficier d’un financement donné par l’U-IMCEC pour appuyer les groupements de femme.
La dame Awa est la responsable de ce groupe. Elle vend du poisson comme la plupart, elle a démarré en 2005 avec un capital de rien du tout. Au début, elle allait chez des mareyeurs qui lui remettaient une quantité en poisson qu’elle remboursait après vente. Avec le crédit, elle pourra acheter la quantité qu’elle désire, vendre et prendre son bénéfice. Elle appuie ses enfants dans leurs besoins quotidiens. Et pour maximiser le bénéfice, elle désire diversifier et vendre des produits divers.
texts.en: The group “Awa tilène” is composed of five women who all work at the port. They have united to benefit from financing given by U-IMCEC for supporting women’s groups. Madam Awa is the official of this group. She sells fish, as most do. She started off in 2005 with no capital at all. At the start, she used to go to wholesale seafood merchants, who placed an amount of fish with her that she paid for after selling it. With this loan, she will be able to purchase the amount she wants, sell the goods, and earn a profit. She supports her children by covering their day-to-day needs. And to maximize her profit, she would like to diversify and sell a variety of goods.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en: Yahya is a 35-years-old married man from Dier El balah city. He lives with his wife and kids in a simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in transferring goods for the traders using his rickshaw. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. Yahya took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one. This loan will help him to improve his business and increase his income. Yahya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Lan's business is in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Lan is 38 years old and she is married, with two children.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Lan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs Hà operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Hà has been involved in this business for nine years. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hà is 48 years old, and she is married with two children.

In 2011, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hà has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hà to buy a motorbike. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: 030402060003060003. Thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Thanh works in agriculture farming vegetable. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future. Thanh is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Thanh is the group leader of the 030402060003. Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in her business for 6 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new motor bike.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is a hardworking mother, who manages a small eatery in her community. She is 43 years old, married, and has been blessed with eight children. She needs to earn a higher income in order to support the education of her children, due to the high cost of school fees. She aspires to improve her business, in order to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use it to buy pork, vegetables, fish, seasonings and other ingredients. She needs these ingredients to cook and sell. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, fish, seasonings, and other ingredients that she needs

location.town: Brgy. Oyao, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Cilos

texts.es:
Cilos tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en la provincia de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café variedad catimore, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz así como a brindar servicios como peón agrícola. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cilos is 43 years old and lives with his partner and son in his own home built out of rustic materials in the province of Callayuc, a community that works in farming and cattle and is located in the region of Cajamarca in the northern ranges of Peru. 

Cilos works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of Catimore coffee. He has six years of experience in this field and has good personal and work references from his neighbours. He also works as a farmhand growing corn. 

The loan that Cilos will be granted will be used for farming. He will start applying pesticides and fertilisers to his crops and pay for labour to harvest them. This will help him to improve the physiology, morphology and productivity of his crops to obtain a timely harvest and as a consequence a larger quantity of crops and better quality product which he will have no problems selling. In turn, this will grant him a greater income which will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to work on the farm, apply pesticides and fertilisers to his crops and pay for labour to harvest them

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Felicita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Lolita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 39 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Mtskheta district. Ketevan's husband is confessor, and they have five children. 

Ketevan owns a small shop where she sells ecclesiastical things. She wants to expand the business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. 

With the received credit, Ketevan will purchase more products and will generate more income to improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to purchase ecclesiastical products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old, married and has six children. Three of her children are in school.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from a passenger tricycle business.

Gloria aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is a smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills region of Kenya. He is a family-oriented man who has been married for 13 years. He has four children.

Sylvester started farming from scratch 15 years ago. He has been able to achieve great strides that include acquisition of a 1 acre piece of land, two dairy cows, and motorcycle. He also has planted tea on the property. 

As his business grows bigger, his land grows smaller and smaller. As much as Sylvester would love to add the number of cows and the area for tea, he is constrained by unavailability of space. 

It is for this reason that Sylvester is seeking a loan to acquire a plot of land to expand his farm business. 

Additional income from this investment will help Sylvester provide a better life for his family and take his children to a boarding school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 57 years old; she is married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Judith has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Judith aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 58 años de edad,  está casado y su esposa le ayuda en las actividades agrícolas, tiene 6 hijos pero solo 4 viven con él.  

Miguel se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, tiene mas de 25 años de experiencia en esta actividad, él aprendió este oficio en capacitaciones recibidas por diversas instituciones por ser un líder entregado a su comunidad, Miguel compra ganado para arar la tierra y además en sus tiempos libres se involucra en proyectos para apoyar a su comunidad. 

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de hortalizas. 

Él planea  cultivar mas con las ganancias obtenidas  y mejorar su ingresos para darle estabilidad  a su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is 58 years old. He is married, and his wife helps him with his agricultural work. They have 6 children, but only 4 of them live with him. Miguel grows vegetables, and has more than 25 years of experience doing this work. He learned this job through leadership training offered by different institutions to his community. Miguel buys cattle to plow the land, and in his free time he gets involved in projects to help his community. He needs this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow his vegetables. He plans to plant more with his earnings and increase his income, in order to provide stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase accessories, perfumes, and incense, for further expanding her business.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Ade. Ade ives in Lebak, a regency located at Banten province, about 3 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife. Ade owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business using technology. Together with his wife, he realized that they need to save more money for their children’s education, so he decided to join Ruma last year. 

As the business grows, Ade needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Ade’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Ade is the one who is standing and holding Ruma’s banner. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in essences and natural medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes, bags, and more to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en: Epifanio is 63 years old, and a father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is widowed and has seven children. He earns their living through planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Being a responsible father, he wants to raise the living standard of his family and give them a better living. He aims to improve his farming business, but he has limited capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 19,000. He will use it to buy certified seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides needed in his vegetable-production business. With this financial assistance, Epifanio believes that he will expand his vegetable plantation and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides needed for vegetable production

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 56 years. She is married and blessed with two children.

Ruth has a retail shop where she sells general household goods, a business she has been doing for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Ruth is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil and pay school fees.

Her dream is to purchase a posho mill and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil and pay school fees.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida raises and sells hogs to earn for a living. She is 45-year-old married woman with three children, ages 19-9 years old.  Aside from the hog raising business, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling goods like biscuits, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, powdered milk, soap and seasonings.  

She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets, feed, and groceries for the store. In this way, her hog raising business will be productive, producing more healthy pigs to be sold.  Her store will be full of stock and augment her income. 
 
With this, Adelaida and her family will continue to handle her business to become more sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and groceries for the store

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado caprino y vacuno. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor is 63 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca. His community works in agriculture, commerce and cattle and is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern ranges of Peru.

Victor works in farming, specifically in the cultivation of cacao. He also raises and sells goats and cows. His has both experience and a stable client base who have given him very good personal and work references. 

Victor has applied for a loan to buy compost and fertiliser to maintain his crops. As a result he will be able to offer his clients a good product and generate a higher income which will allow him to improve both his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertiliser to maintain his crops

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Hannah is 18 years old and is the fifth of the six children in the family. Her mother Amada, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Hannah is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Airline Management and is currently in her second year of this four-year course.

Amada is borrowing PHP 9,000 to pay for tuition fees for her daughter Hannah for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Hannah plans to be gainfully employed so she can help to improve the quality of life of her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan is 34 years old. He lives in Batumi with his wife and two children. Ruslan has a car. He serves local people as a taxi driver and thereby generates income. He decided to purchase an additional car to rent out daily, and increase his family's income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2600 USD to purchase a car. The Start Up program will be a great support for Ruslan's family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car that he will rent out daily, to increase his family's income.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF, to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She supplements her income with earnings from her general store business.

Elena dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Touwindsida Group

texts.fr:
Mr OUANGO est responsable du groupe TOUWINSIDA. Il est marié sans  enfant et il a 02 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est gérant de kiosque depuis 03 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter une bouteille de gaz.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer ses activités. Il ambitionne  agrandir son kiosque et  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. OUANGO is the office of the group TOUWINSIDA. He is married and has no children. He has two persons to support. Mr. OUANGO has been the manager of a kiosk for three years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase a bottle of propane. He wants to use the profits from the loan to bolster his business. His ambition is to expand his kiosk and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a bottle of propane

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 62 years old, widowed with four children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marilyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kis Sida Group

texts.fr:
Mme VERONIQUE est responsable du groupe KIS SIDA. Elle est mariée et mère de  01 enfant. Le plus  âgé a 32 ans et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Madame  vend du bois depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 50 000 frs de bois.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour élargir son activité. Elle ambitionne  renforcer son activité et  améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Ms. VERONIQUE is the official of the group KIS SIDA. She is a married mother of one child. The oldest is 32 years old. She has five persons to support. Ms. VERONIQUE has been selling wood for four years. She gets her supplies from surrounding markets. With the money granted, she intends to purchase 50,000 francs of wood. She wants to use the profits from the loan to expand her business. Her ambition is to bolster her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 50,000 francs of wood

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from several other businesses: corn farming, pig fattening, and tricycle passenger transportation.

Josephine is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fresh vegetables to sell to customers.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a smallholder farmer from Songhor location in Nandi Hills, Kenya. Nandi Hills is known for its cold weather and craggy terrains. Eliud's home is on a 0.5 acre farm in the Nandi hills where he stays with his wife and 1-year-old child. On the farm, he owns two dairy cows, eight heads of poultry and 20 trees. 

Unfortunately for Eliud, he can not implement crop farming due to the physical state of his farm - too steep and rocky. This, however, can not stop Eliud from profiting from the lucrative cereal produce business that is thriving in the region. Eliud may not be growing cereals, but he aggregates cereal produce from farmers who do. When purchasing, he is able to secure produce at a reduced price caused by the saturation of cereal produce in the market after harvest season. He then transports and sells the produce to far off markets with less circulation of cereal produce. The key to his success is having enough capital to lay out for inventory.

Eliud is seeking a loan to buy cereals from producers. He is going to use the model explained earlier to make additional income besides the one he makes from selling milk. Additional income will help him meet growing basic needs of his new family.

loans.use: to pay for cereals

loans.name: Eduvinia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eduvinia de 52 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel académico, actualmente se dedica a la agricultura y también a la compra de ganado de repasto, su esposo  falleció hace diez años, tiene dos hijos de  los cuales solo uno vive con ella.

Desde que su esposo falleció, Eduvinia y sus hijos se dedicaron a llevar las riendas del hogar, actualmente cultiva dos hectáreas de maíz y cuida ganado.

El dinero del crédito será utilizado para comprar novillos para pastarlos y luego venderlos ya que se acerca el invierno y es buena temporada.

Su sueño es que su hijo menor pueda realizar sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en: Eduvinia is 52 years old and did not complete any level of education. She works in agriculture, and also buys cattle to raise. Her husband died ten years ago. She has two children, only one of whom lives with her. Since her husband died, Eduvinia and her children have been in charge of the household. They now cultivate two hectares of corn and raise cattle. The money from this loan will be used to buy steers to graze, and later to sell, because winter is coming and it is the right season. Her dream is for her younger son to be able to study to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy steers to graze, and later to sell, because winter is coming and it is the right season.

loans.name: Mehmooda

texts.en: Mehmooda is a 41-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three daughters and three sons. Her son owns a small business selling ready-made garments at home. He purchases clothes from the market at a low price and sells them at a high price in his community. The people in town like his garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the summer weather is going to start and people are demanding seasonal clothes. She requested a loan so that her son can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Mehmooda wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her son's garments sale shop

loans.name: Pathurohman

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Pathurohman. Pathurohman lives in Lebak, a regency located at Banten province, about a three hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  He lives there with his wife and his two sons.  

Pathurohman owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. Pathurohman is a really good and hardworking guy, and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Pathurohman needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. 

Pathurohman’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called 'Mapan'. As seen in the photo, Pathurohman is the one who is standing and holding Ruma’s banner. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to buy mobile airtime credits and provide bill payment services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in coconut and milk preserves, grated coconut, cherries in honey, etc.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда 63 летняя жительница города Турсунзаде. Она живет вместе сыном, невесткой и внуками. Сын находится за границей, чтобы заработать и отправить деньги домой. Мавлуда 10 лет своей жизни занимается животноводством. Она в основном разводит крупнорогатого скота и в дальнейшем после откорма перепродает их на скотном рынке. В настоящий момент Мавлуда просит кредит, чтобы купить крупнорогатого скота и увеличить поголовье скота и за счет этого увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности.
texts.en: Mavluda is a 63 year-old resident of Tursunzoda. She lives with her son, daughter and grandchildren. Her son is working abroad to earn money to send it home. For the last ten years, Mavluda has been working in animal husbandry. She primarily breeds cattle and then, after fattening them up, sells them at the livestock market. Currently Mavluda is asking for a loan to buy cattle and increase the number of livestock she has, thereby increasing her income.

loans.use: A loan of $ 275 helps Mavluda buy cattle.

loans.name: Yovania De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Yovania de 52 años de edad,  madre soltera con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, e independiente  económicamente, es originaria de Managua, ha sido una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, con ganas de salir adelante  desde muy joven fue emprendedora con su negocio inicio vendiendo refresco en sus casa de habitación. En la actualidad ha prosperado gracias a su perseverancia, dedicación y empeño.  Y ha cumplido metas y sueños como formar a sus hijos en profesionales.
En la actualidad tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa nueva en su casa de habitación. Es una pequeña tienda que vende productos como. Pantalones, blusas, vestidos, faldas, ropa de niños, jugos de sabanas, toallas, pantalones de hombre y mujer, short.   Ella dedica unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Yovania agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Yovania is 52 years old and a single mother with four children who are all adults and financially independent. She comes from Managua and is a courageous woman with the desire to get ahead in life. She has been enterprising from a young age when she started a business selling refreshments from her home. She has become prosperous today thanks to her perseverance, dedication and effort. She has achieved her goals and dreams of raising her children to become professionals. 

Yovania has a small shop selling new clothing in her home. In this small shop she sells products such as pants, blouses, vests, skirts, children's clothes, sets of sheets, towels, shorts and men's and women's pants. She spends about 12 hours each day selling these products. The aim of this loan is to invest it in working capital and stock up her store so that in the not too distant future she can obtain a better income. 

Yovania is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources from poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have a decent form of employment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy clothes such as pants, blouses, vests, skirts and children's clothes; sets of sheets, towels, shorts and men's and women's pants

loans.name: Arly Manuel

texts.es:
Arly de 60 años de edad, casado con cinco hijos mayores de edad independiente económicamente, es originario de Managua, se caracteriza por ser trabajador responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Desde muy  joven ha desempeñado el servicio de taxista oficio que aprendió de su papa.   Para ayuda con los ingresos de hogar ya que no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad de es propietario de un taxi, el cual ha sido el fruto de su esfuerzo, perseverancia,  para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.
 Él se desempeña como taxista  dese hace quince años, negocio que inicio como iniciativa propia por las noches  para poder aumentar los ingresos de su hogar, en la actualidad solamente se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxista  ya que hace unos años pudo adquirí una unidad de taxi.   Su jornada de trabajo es de unas diez horas diaria ofreciendo su servicio para que  en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en  mantenimiento de su unidad de taxi, y comprar llantas nuevas, para brindar un buen servicio. Y aprovechar la demanda de la semana santa, ya que es una buena temporada, porque la clientela aumenta en estas fechas.  Arly agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Arly, 60, is married and has 5 grown children who are financially independent.  He is a native of Managua, and is known to be hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal success.  Ever since he was very young, he has worked as a taxi driver, an occupation he learned from his father.  He worked to help with the household expenses, as he was not able to study due to a lack of financial resources.  Now Arly owns his own taxi, which has been the fruit of his efforts and perserverance, so that he can provide for his children.

Arly has worked as a taxi driver for 15 years.  He started the business on his own initiative working at night to increase his household income.  Now he works exclusively as a taxi driver, because some years ago he was able to buy his own vehicle.  He works 10 hours a day so that in the near future he can have more income.  His goal with this loan is to invest in the maintenance of his taxi and to buy new tires so that he can provide good service.  Also, he wants to take advantage of the increase in demand during Easter week, because this is a good time for his business as he gets more customers at this time.  Arly is grateful for the assistance being provided by the Kiva lenders to low income people in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his taxi and to buy new tires

loans.name: La Colina Group

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de salteñas. 
Ella es buena madre, independiente, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur  de la ciudad, área residencial y muy poblada, casas antiguas y rústicas,  muchas sin acceso a servicios básicos, conviven formando un lugar de comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas. Los suelos de esta parte son predominantemente arenas, arenas finas y otras limosas,  de clima cálido con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-32 grados centígrados. 
Yolanda es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie al centro, viste blusa negra y calza floreada, lleva un bolsón verde con agarrador amarillo). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que trabaja en el comercio y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de expandir su negocio la impulsó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, arreglo de tv color, llantería, venta de plásticos, venta de verduras, venta de perfumes y venta de desayunos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de salteñas, (La salteña es una empanada rellena con carne de res o de pollo, huevo duro, especias, y otros ingredientes, horneada, tradicional en la gastronomía popular) negocio que comenzó desde su casa, haciendo una mínima inversión con la venta de empanadas de queso y algunas masitas que llevan insumos fáciles de encontrar en el mercado, a medida que recuperaba su capital, invertía en la oferta de salteñas para el público. “a quién no le gusta una salteña a media mañana, es tradicional y los clientes la buscan desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sabe hornear y tiene experiencia en la elaboración de salteñas, la desventaja es la competencia con alimentos alternos fríos y calientes. Su sueño es abrir un snack en su domicilio, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un horno grande e insumos necesarios para su negocio (harina, manteca, huevo, carnes, etc.). Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yolanda solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno amplio para elaborar salteñas en mayor cantidad, vender por mayor y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Yolanda is a 31 year old woman. She lives with her partner, she has 3 children ages 9,7, and 5 years old. Her business is the preparation and sale of saltenas (empanadas.) She is a good mother, independent, understanding, patient, responsible, and hard working. She works in the southern zone of the city, a residential area well populated with ancient and rustic homes. Many of these homes do not have basic services. They live together forming a point of trade and manufacturing in all the areas. The flooring in this area is primarily sandy, with fine sand and other alcaline material. The climate is warm with a temperature which fluctuates between 21-32 degrees Celsius. Yolanda is dark complected, with long, black hair tied back, brown eyes. Her native tongue is Guarani which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish as general knowledge and for business. (Standing in the middle, she wears a black blouse and flower printed pants, she carries a green purse with a yellow handle.) She shares her life with her partner who works in trade and her children. The two oldest children are in school, and the small one is not yet of school age. They live in a small room which they own, built of brick with a corrugated metal roof. It has running water, electricity, and sewage. The need to expand her business pushed her to join a group of people with businesses such as: food sales, color TV repairs, tire repair, plastic sales, vegetable sales, perfume sales, and breakfast sales, and to request a loan and improve their activities. Her business is the preparation and sale of saltenas. (Saltenas are empanadas stuffed with beef or chicken, hard boiled egg, spices, and other ingredients. They are baked, and are a traditional dish in popular cuisine.) She started this business at home, making a small investment with the sale of cheese empanadas and other pastries with ingredients easy to find in the market. As soon as she regained her capital, she reinvested it in selling saltenas to the public. "who doesn't like a saltena at mid morning, it is traditional and customers look for them since early morning..." she stated. The advantage of her business is that she knows how to bake and has experience making saltenas, the disadvantage is the competition with other cold and hot foods. Her dream is to open a snack bar in her house. She wants to expand her business by buying a large oven and the necessary ingredients for her business (flour, lard, eggs, meats, etc.) This is the first loan with the institution in 4 years of owning this business. This is why Yolanda needs a loan to buy a large oven to make saltenas in larger quantities, to sell them wholesale and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy a large oven to make saltenas (empanadas) in larger quantities, sell them wholesale and increase their sales.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, and all of them go to school. She has no additional household members.

She sells green bananas from home, on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO. She will use it to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize flour and other shop items in bulk.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional dependents. She sells dry fish at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy dry fish. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting dry fish from village to the market for sale. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy dry fish

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a hard working mother who always cares for her childrens' future. Martina is engaged in selling snack foods. Her husband is generating income through working as carpenter and doing some farming. Martina sells snack food in the morning like soup and noodles. In the afternoon she prepares barbecue to sell before night. Martina is thankful for another source of income to assure her childrens' need for schooling. She is now requesting a loan of P 16,000 to buy raw meat and ingredients for cooking snack foods and barbecue to sell. She believes that the loan will contribute to the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy raw meat and ingredients for cooking snack foods and barbecue to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa Magdalena

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Ángeles De Colon. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general. 
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada de esta  relación tienen  tres hijos de 17, 15 y 11 años, dos  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es albañil.
Doña Narcisa es una mujer que le gusta ir mejorando su calidad de vida, ella siempre utiliza los créditos para varias actividades como los estudios de sus hijos o para herramientas que necesita el esposo para su trabajo el cual es la fuente de ingresos que ellos tienen, otra parte de los créditos recibidos ella lo ha utilizado para arreglos en su casa, esta vez ella espera arreglar el techo de  su casa pues con el invierno y la caída de las lluvias se le moja parte de su casa lo cual les ocasiona muchos inconvenientes. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar tejas y estructuras de hierro para el techo así como unas herramientas para el trabajo de su marido. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito. Sus sueños es tener su casa bien construida y darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en: In the area known as Los Angeles, in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Los Angeles De Colon credit group meet every two weeks. They work at a variety of activities such as agriculture and commerce. Narcisa lives here. She is 53 years old, is married, and has three children from her marriage who are 17, 15 and 11 years old. Two of them are in college, and the youngest is in school. Her husband is a bricklayer. Narcisa is a woman who likes to improve her quality of life. She uses loans for various activities such as her children's education, or to buy tools that her husband needs for his work, which is their source of income. She has used other loans to repair their house. This time she wants to repair the roof of their house, because it is winter and falling rain has caused part of their house to be wet, which is creating many problems for them. She will use this loan to buy tiles and iron structures for the roof, as well as tools for her husband's work. She has been with the credit group since its beginning. Her dream is to have a well-built house and to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy tiles, iron structures, and tools.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda, de 64 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, su familia fue numerosa y su papá los abandonó cuando eran niños, actualmente vive sola, se acompañó dos veces, pero no pudo formalizar nunca un hogar.

Arminda, se dedica a la compra y venta de lácteos, esta actividad la hace desde hace varios años, lo aprendió gracias a la esposa de un hermano de ella; ahora lo hace de forma independiente.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 30 libras de queso y 15 botellas de crema, ella espera vender durante la semana, en los caseríos de alrededor de su casa y con la ganancia cubrir los gastos de la casa.

En un futuro sueña con comprar algunos muebles para la casa, ya que actualmente no tiene muchas cosas.
texts.en:
Arminda is 64 years old. She did not go to school as she was one of many children and her father abandoned them when they were young. She currently lives alone. She has had two partners but she was never able to start a family.

Arminda has bought and sold dairy products for many years, a business that she learnt thanks to the wife of one of her brothers. Now she is able to run this business independently.   

Arminda needs this loan to buy 30 pounds of cheese and 15 bottles of cream. She hopes to sell her products in the surrounding villages during the week and with these earnings she hopes to cover the household costs. 

Arminda's dream for the future is to buy some furniture for her house as she doesn't have many things at the moment.

loans.use: to buy 30 pounds of cheese and 15 bottles of cream

loans.name: Levan

texts.en: Levan is 52 years old. He lives with his wife and his son in the Batumi district. Levan serves local people as a taxi driver, with his own car, and generates income. He decided to expand his taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative from Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2100 USD. With the received credit he will purchase another car and will rent it out daily in order to increase his income. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase another car and rent it out daily in order to increase his income.

loans.name: Esther Monserrate

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Ángeles De Colon. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general. 
En este lugar vive la señora Esther, tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tienen  dos hijos de 9  y 3 años de edad, el mayor es  discapacitado y estudia en escuela especial. El marido mecánico.
Doña Esther es una gran mujer que con  su trabajo le ayuda a su marido con los gastos que genera la crianza de sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de bisuterías, visita a sus clientes que en la gran mayoría son de la familia y conocidos del lugar, ella les deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, parte del crédito se lo da a su esposo el cual tiene un taller mecánico y requiere del crédito para comprar  aceites, líquidos de frenos y muchos otros repuestos que el emplea en su trabajo. Ella lleva un año en su actividad y su marido muchos años más. 
Este crédito es para comprar bisuterías, aceites y repuestos para el taller del marido. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su actividad comercial. Sus sueños son tener sanos a sus  hijos.
texts.en: In the area known as Los Angeles in the community of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Credit Group Los Angeles de Colon meet every 15 days. They work in diverse activities such as agriculture, and commerce in general. Mrs. Esther lives here, she is 28 years old, she has a common law relationship and has two children ages 9 and 3 years old. The oldest child is handicapped and studies at a special education school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Mrs. Esther is a great woman who helps her husband with the expenses generated by raising children. She works selling custom jewelry, and she visits her clients who in their great majority are relatives and acquaintances of the area. She leaves the merchandise on credit to her clients, and collects her payments every eight days. She will give part of the loan to her husband who has a mechanic's shop and needs the credit line to buy oils, break fluid, and other spare parts for his shop. She has one year in this activity and her husband has worked in his business many more years. This loan is to buy custom jewelry, oils and spare parts for her husband's shop.
