She started with the Credit Group since the beginning, and she likes it because she started her business with the loans. Her dream is to have healthy children.

loans.use: To buy custom jewelry, oils and spare parts.

loans.name: Sougrlapanga Group

texts.fr:
Mr  RAHAMANE est responsable du groupe SOUGRLAPANGA. Il est marié et père de O6  enfants. Le plus âgé a 28 ans et le moins âgé a 16 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 02 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est gérant de kiosque depuis 02 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter ½ sac de riz et 02 grandes boites de Nescafé.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour épargner et renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne  améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Mr. RAHAMANE is the official of the group SOUGRLAPANGA. He is a married father of six children. The oldest is 28, and the youngest is 16. Four children go to school. He has two persons to support. Mr. RAHAMANE has been the manager of a kiosk for two years. He gets his supplies from surrounding markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase a ½ sack of rice and 2 large cans of Nescafé. He wants to use the profits from the loan to save money and to bolster his business. His ambition is to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ½ sack of ice and 2 big cans of Nescafé.

loans.name: Baoblawende Group

texts.fr:
Mme  HABIBOU  est responsable du groupe BAOBLAWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé a 9 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Madame est coiffeuse et vent des habits prêt à porter depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut acheter  03 douzaines de prêt à porter.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir et agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un compte pour  l’ainée de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. HABIBOU is the official of the group BAOBLAWENDE. She is a married mother of three children. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 9. Three children go to school. She has five persons to support. Ms. HABIBOU has been a hair dresser and a vendor of ready-to-wear clothing for five years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, she wants to purchase 3 dozen of ready-to-wear. She wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in her business and expand it. Her ambition is to open an account for her oldest child and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 3 dozen of ready-to-wear

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as tomatoes and pepper

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гулзада, 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Гулзады - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулзады, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 25 овец и 2,40 ГА земельного надела, на котором выращивает картофель и люцерну. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 19,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулзада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на постройку сараев.
texts.en: Gulzada is 40 years old, married, and, along with her husband, is raising five children of school and pre-school age. Gulzada has a secondary education. She farms and keeps livestock, which is the family's primary source of income. She started 5 years ago when she purchased 4,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of her hard work, Gulzada's farm now has four cows, 25 sheep, and a 2.4 hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes and alfalfa. Her monthly income is about 19,500 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Gulzada asked the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy cattle. She plans to invest profits from the loan into futher expanding her livestock herd, and she wants to save enough money to build a barn.

loans.use: buy additional livestock to expand her herd.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 31 год, замужем, есть сын. У Айнуры - средне-специальное образование, в поисках доходов для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством, стартовав 11 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 3 овцы, а также арендованный земельный надел размером 1,0 ГА, на котором выращивает арбузы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений для парника, чтобы в этом году иметь возможность выращивать экологически-чистые арбузы. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и хочет построить сарай.
texts.en: Ainura is 31 years old, married, has a son. Ainura has a vocational education. To earn income for her family she has been farming for the past 11 years. Because of her hard work, Ainura's farm now has 3 cows, 3 sheep, and leased 1 hectare plot of land where she grows watermelons. Her monthly income is 13,800 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Ainura appealed to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy seed and fertilizer for her greenhouse. This year, she has the opportunity to grow organic watermelons. Ainura plans to invest profits from the loan into further developing her business, and she wants to build a shed.

loans.use: buy seed and fertilizer in order to grow organic watermelons

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 53 years old and married with four children. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and school supplies.

In the future Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ganapati Group

texts.en:
Village Titigunguri is a slum area of Titilagarh town in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India. In this village, most of the households belong to a poorer community. The people of this village are mainly weavers of bamboo craft. They reside in small huts, and their children hardly get better education.

The main business of this community is making hand fans of bamboo and selling them in the market and supplying them to traders. The income they get from this is hand-to-mouth only for them.

Dhanamati, aged about 32, is a woman from this community. She is standing in the back row, the second person from the right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is married and lives with her husband, one son, and two daughters.

Dhanamati is doing her traditional work of bamboo hand fans, and kula, bhuga and tupa making (baskets), and marketing them at the nearest market. Both Dhanamati and her husband together are engaged with the assembly of hand fans, kula, bhuga and tupa. They procure the raw bamboo from a distance of 100 kms. Her husband goes by train to bring the material. Both the wife and husband sell the finished products in the town and the nearby local market.

Apart from making of hand fans, kula, bhuga and tupa, Dhanamati also procures finished products from the neighbors and sells them in bulk to the traders in other places. Dhanamati earns a monthly income of Rs. 5,500 from this business. According to Dhanamati, this small income is not at all sufficient to meet the requirements of her family and a better livelihood. In this situation, she was in search of a credit source, and Mahashakti intervened with its work in the same area.

Dhanamati, along with twelve other members, formed a group named Ganapati that availed themselves of a loan. Now she plans to purchase more raw bamboo for working for a longer period to raise her production for more income, and also purchase finished products for supply after her loan disbursement.

Dhanamati hopes to construct a house, provide better education to her children, and lead a prestigious life in the society.

The other twelve members of this group are professionally in different types of micro-enterprises such as a general store, vegetable vending, fast food centre, goatery, net business, home shopping, cycle store, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo in bulk.

loans.name: Shirinbubu

texts.ru: Ширинбубу 54 года, вдова, мать 5 детей. У Ширинбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Ширинбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 лошади и 2,24 га земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ширинбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и подготовку к весенне-полевым работам. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение бизнеса.
texts.en: Shirinbubu is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of 5 children. Shirinbubu has a secondary education. She farms and keeps livestock, which is the primary source of income for her family. She started doing this 16 years ago when she bought 10,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of her hards work, Shirinbubu's farm now has 2 horses and 2.24 hectares of land where she grows beans. Her monthly income is about 20,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Shirinbubu asked the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy fertilizer and make preparations for the spring field work. She plans to invest profits she makes from the loan in expanding her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to prepare for spring field work and growing organic beans

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 32-year-old farmer from Chepkuruyuk village who practices dairy farming for a living. He married a lovely young wife three years ago, and together they have three children, all infants. His main income source is milk. On his 0.5 acre farm, he also has grown tea crops and trees.

Jackson is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will be the second on the farm. This means Jackson is most likely to double his income from this investment. Additional income from this investment is dedicated towards meeting his children's needs: food, clothing, health care and education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Maritza Esperanza

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Ángeles De Colon. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general. 
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada de esta  relación tienen  tres hijos de 17,  14 y 7 años, dos  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es chofer.
Doña Maritza es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para darles una buena educación a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos,  es  la encargada del bar de una escuela en la localidad, allí vende los  alimentos que prepara de la manera más saludables para que los niños tengan muy buena alimentación, ella varían el menú todos los días para que los niños cada día tengan algo nuevo que saborear, ahí mismo vende almuerzos pero esto es para los profesores que laboran en su escuela. Lleva 2 años con su negocio el cual lo ha ido mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos recibidos en el grupo.
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a  los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos por lo cual lucha día a día.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Los Angeles in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo the members of 'Grupo de Crédito Los Angeles de Colon' meet every fortnight. These members carry out different businesses in areas from agriculture to general commerce.

This area is where Maritza lives. She is 39 years old, married and has had three children in this relationship who are 17, 14 and 7 years old. Two study at high school and the youngest goes to primary school. Her husband is a driver. 

Maritza is a woman who likes to work so she can give her children a good education. She makes and sells meals and is in charge of the kiosk in a school in her community. She sells meals there that she prepares in the healthiest way so that the children can have a very good diet. She varies the menu every day so that the children have something new to taste every day. She also sells lunch there to the teachers who work in the school. Maritza has run this business for two years which has improved with the help of the loans she has received with the group.

This loan will be used to buy the necessary supplies to prepare her meals. She has been with Grupo de Crédito for four cycles and she likes it because, thanks to her loans, she has improved her business. Her dream is to give her children the best in life which is why she strives to improve day after day.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается полеводством и животноводством, как и все сельчане проживающие в одном селе вместе с ней. Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры и активной помощи ее детей и супруга, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 5 овец, а также земельный надел размером 1,11 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для полеводства и выращивания органической фасоли. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmira is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education. She farms and keeps livestock, as do all the villagers living in the same village with her. Because of her hard work and that of her husband and children, Gulmira's farm now has a cow, 5 sheep, and a 1.11 hectare plot of land where she grows beans. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Gulmira asked the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy fertilizer for growing field crops and organic beans. Gulmira use profits from the loan to invest in further developing her business.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer in order to grow organic beans.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, aged 39 years, is married with six children aged 14, 12, 10, 8, and 6 years. She has applied for a loan of shs 4,000,000 (four million shillings) to buy more cattle for rearing, as well as cattle foodstuffs. She rears cattle as her major source of income. She started in the year 1998 with high hopes of earning income to look after her family. Her business is located in Kayembe, Mashonga, and her clients are people around Kayembe.

She is a hardworking woman who works eight hours a day and six days a week, but is faced with challenges of too much sunshine and low prices for cattle products. But Annah hopes to boost her businesses through her hard work and achieve her future dream of establishing a processing plant that adds value to cattle products in Bushenyi. She requests lenders to keep on financing her businesses to boost her returns from the business of cattle rearing.

She appreciates the great services.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: To have an additional source of income, Mary has been engaged in raising chickens for sale. She is 58 years old and blessed with six children. Due to financial hardship, she aspires to further improve this business in order to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy feed and corn for her chicken. Through hard work and strong determination, Mary hopes that, someday, she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed and corn for her chickens.

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jacquelinne Margarita

texts.es: Jacquelinne de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad que son su mayor orgullo. Ella se dedica a la venta de granos básicos por mayoreo actividad que realiza desde hace 12 y años y que le permite brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Jacquelinne desea realizar una inversión en su negocio ya que desea obtener mejores ingresos y para ello necesita tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arroz, frijoles, maíz, etc., y de esta manera brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jacquelinne is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two sons who are 17 and 12 years old and her greatest pride. Jacquelinne has sold bulk grains as her main business for the last 12 years which has allowed her to create better living conditions for her family. 

Jacquelinne would like to invest in her business to obtain a higher income and for that she needs to have a larger amount of products to sell. This is why she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in rice, beans, corn, etc. and in this way provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in rice, beans, corn, etc.

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан 51 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи  занимается животноводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бурмакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Бурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на обучение внучки.
texts.en: Burmakan is 51 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education. The primary source of income for the family is her work in animal husbandry. She started 11 years ago when she bought cattle with 10,000 KGS. Because of her hard work, Burmakan's farm now has 4 cows. Her monthly income is up to 25,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, she turned to the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy cattle. Burmakan plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding her livestock, and she wants to save money for her granddaughter's education.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Quenni Marie

texts.en:
Quenni Marie works hard to support her family and has a buy-and-sell used tires business in the Philippines.

Quenni Marie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used tires to sell.

Quenni Marie has been in this business for three years now.

Quenni Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used tires to sell.

loans.name: Imeelyn

texts.en:
Imeelyn is a 28-year-old married woman. She and her husband would like to improve the standard of living for themselves and their two children.

Imeelyn runs a small retail store in the local community, and her husband works as a farmer and laborer. She would like to increase her business, but she does not enough capital. She has asked for a loan of 10,000.00 PHP to buy more stock of grocery items, frozen foods, and coffee to resell. With this financial assistance, Imeelyn believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items, frozen foods, and coffee to resell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 27 years old and supports eight family members. He has been a pub operator for the last 12 years and the business earns him KES 8,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, and also to add more stocks of beer to sell to his customers.

He plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hope is to eradicate poverty in his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, and also enables him to add more stocks of beer to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old. She is married with one child. She does tailoring and has been in business for five years. Her monthly income is eighteen thousand Kenya shillings. She also has a retail business.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase tailoring materials like clothing, threads, etc.

She plans to use the profits to improve her standard of living. In the future she wants to be financially stable with a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials like clothing and threads.

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гульжамал, 59 лет, в разводе, мать 2 детей, бабушка 2 внуков. У Гульжамал- высшее образование, она работает в статистическом комитете главным специалистом. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гульжамал занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Гульжамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 22 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульжамал обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров и овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulzhamal is 59 years old, divorced, and the mother of 2 children, and the grandmother of 2 grandchildren. Gulzhamal-has a higher education. She works for the Statistics Committee as a supervising specialist. to make extra money, Gulzhamal works in animal husbandry. She started 10 years ago. Because of her hard work, Gulzhamal's farm now has 2 cows and 22 sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. This is not enough for a decent standard of living.  In order to further expand her farm, Gulzhamal asked the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 150,000 KGS to buy dairy cows and sheep for fattening and selling. She plans to invest profits from the loan into expanding her livestock herd and repairing her house.

loans.use: buy some dairy cows and sheep to help bolster her family's income.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  is a 47 years old lady from Kisumu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married  and supports the family, five people total.

She has a tailoring stall which has been operating for the last nine years and generates a monthly income of KES. 7000. She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase material for her tailoring business. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the current business.

Her dream is expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Gema María

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Ángeles De Colon. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gema tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno de 2 años  y un bebé de 5 meses. Su marido es comerciante. Ella aprendió belleza en un centro de la localidad.
Doña Gema e una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su familia a salir adelante, ella tienen un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversos trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal, también realiza trabajos a domicilio si sus clientes así lo desean. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 21h00 y si algún cliente requiere  de sus servicios hasta más tarde no le incomoda ya que su salón lo tiene en su casa, trabaja sola y lleva más de 2 años con su labor la cual le encanta y con la que se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para arreglar unos muebles que ya están  deteriorados y así brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus metas son tener un SPA.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Los Angeles in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo the members of the loan group 'Los Angeles de Colon' meet every fortnight. These members carry out different businesses in areas from agriculture to general commerce.

This area is where Gema lives. She is 21 years old and lives with her de facto with whom she has two children: a two year old and a 5 month old baby. Her husband is a businessman.

Gema learnt how to do beauty treatments in a centre in her community. She is a woman who likes to work to help her family to get ahead. She has a beauty salon where she does various beauty treatments and personal grooming. She also does treatments at home if her clients request it. Gema works every day from 9am to 9pm and if any client requires her services beyond this time it doesn't inconvenience her as her salon is located in her home. She works alone and has done so for more than two years. She loves her work and it allows her to earn a living.

This loan will be used to repair some furniture which has deteriorated so she can offer her clients a better service. Gema has been with her loan group for three years and she likes it because of the support the loans provide her with. Her goal is to have a health spa.

loans.use: to repair some furniture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of stylish fabrics and threads to sew women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, to  add more stock to his retail shop, and to continue serving his customers to their satisfaction.

loans.name: Binapani Group

texts.en:
Supriya, aged 46, is the leader of the Binapani Group that hails from Ghodar village of Titilagarah, Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and has two children aged about 18 and 14 years. The member standing in the second row the third person from the right-hand side of her group with a raised hand is Supriya. 

Supriya has a house in her village which she also uses for a broiler (chicken) business purpose with the active support of her husband. Her husband helps her with boiler transportation and selling in the nearby market and different village areas. 

Supriya, along with 10 other self-dependent members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses and better livelihoods. The concerned members are under the poverty line, but they didn’t fail to sacrifice their life and instead raised their heads towards their family and community growth. 

Supriya's income per month of 5,700 INR is not sufficient to meet the daily requirements of the family. Out of their small income, they are maintaining their family in a very pitiable condition. Now she is very much confident in the broiler business and acquainted herself with the market situation. 

From the loan by Mahashakti Foundation, she wishes to purchase more and more broilers from the nearest market. Both she and her husband will mutually develop their business and meet their social needs.

The other 10 members of her group are well established in their businesses, like a grocery shop, vegetable cultivation, a milk business, a mixture shop, a chicken stall, rice trading, tailoring and laundry.

loans.use: to purchase more boilers (chickens)

loans.name: Zama

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Zama. Zama lives in Lebak, a regency located in Banten province, about 3 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  Zama owns a stall that sells mobile phone accessories and airtime credits, and provides bill payment services to his community. He learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. Zama is a really good and hardworking man, and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As his business has grown, Zama has found that he needs additional capital. He is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits, and provide more bill payment services to his community. Zama’s goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product which is called Mapan. 

In the photo, Zama is the one who is standing and holding Ruma’s banner. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Dier El balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. 

Mohammad works in transferring goods for the local traders, using his rickshaw. It is a good business, and provides him with a good income. 

He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Mohammad to buy a new rickshaw to replace his old one. This will help him to improve his business, and increase his income. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace his old one.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 20-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. He works in transferring goods for the traders using his rickshaw. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. 

Samer took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to use instead of the old one. This will help him to improve his business and increase his income. 

Samer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to use instead of the old one.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 64 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Andresa hace 30 años, con ella tuvo 4 hijos, y con el trabajo unido de ambos han ido creciendo poco a poco.
El señor es de profesión albañil y siempre ha trabajado por su cuenta en forma independiente, actualmente en la casa ha habilitado una despensa en donde su señora se queda encargada, son una pareja muy unida y luchadora que se está esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar herramientas para poder usar en su oficio de albañil. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Jorge is 64 years old and has been married to Andresa for 30 years with whom he has had four children. With their combined employment they have been able to improve bit by bit.

Jorge is a builder by trade and has always worked for himself as an independent contractor. He recently built a grocery store at home which his wife is in charge of. They are a very united and determined couple who strive to improve and get ahead in life. 

Jorge is requesting this loan to buy tools that he can use in his profession as a builder. He is thankful for the opportunity that he has received.

loans.use: to buy tools to use for building

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is a 21-years-old single man from Dier El Balah City. He lives with his family in a simple house. He works in transferring cooking gas for homes using his rickshaw. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. Naser took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one. This will help him to improve his business and increase his income. Naser appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Her greatest dream in life is to enable her children to finish their education and become professionals someday. Juliet and her husband are both helping to provide the best living for their children. While she is busy managing her direct selling business, Juliet's husband is managing their farm. 

Juliet rounds their village to offer the products she is selling, and at the same time to take her customers' orders. She sells cosmetics and ready-to-wear products. Juliet wants to deliver her customers' orders on time in order to satisfy them with the service she offers. 

Juliet is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy lipstick, fragrances, make-up, and clothes. She hopes to prosper with the business she has, and generate bigger income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, fragrances, make-up, and clothes.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and they all go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. 

Ritah operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week and gets additional income from providing outside catering. 

Ritah has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy rollers, hair relaxers, treatments, weaves and braids. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Ritah's goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy rollers, hair relaxers, treatments,weaves and braids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, enabling her to add different types of foods to sell in the market, and to meet customer demands.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and three go to school. She has no additional dependents. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses and buy a van for transporting green bananas from the village to the market for sale. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and cassava

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is 29 years old. She is married and blessed with two children.

Beryl has a retail shop where she sells soft drinks and snacks, a business she has done for the last five years, generating a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Beryl has applied for her second loan with VisionFund Kenya Ltd., which she will use to purchase snacks and household foodstuffs in bulk. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business.

Her dream is to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks and soft drinks so as to increase her volume of sales

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline  is a 37-year-old widow, who is the mother of four children, and lives in Kisumu County, which is located in the western part of Kenya.

She has a retail shop which she has been operating for the last 4 years, and makes a monthly income of 9,000 KES. Jackline is taking her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, and soap for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock.

Her dream is to increase the stock in her shop, and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells soap, sodas and sugar, among other items, in a retail shop. She started the business so as to support her family. She needs a loan to buy general merchandise, like soap, sodas, sugar and juice, to sell. She faces a challenge of competition, plus general price fluctuations, yet she desires to have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, like soap, sodas, sugar and juice, to sell.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a 52-year-old married woman with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Juditha is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

Juditha has been farming rice for 5 years, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, aged 42 years old, is married with six children aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 7 years old. He does retail trading as his major source of income. He has applied for a loan of UGX1,500,000 (one million, five hundred thousand shillings) to buy more daily household-use items, i.e. corn flour, rice, sugar and bread, among other items for sale in his retail shop.

He started business in the year 1996 with high hopes of generating income to cater to his family. He also does agriculture, majoring in goat rearing and tea growing, to supplement his monthly income. His business is located in his local area of residence in Swazi, Bushenyi District, and his clients are people in Swazi.

He is a hardworking man who works 10 hours a day and is faced with challenges of high costs of stock and price fluctuations, but William is determined to grow his business through his hard work. He hopes to become financially stable and start up a wholesale business. He requests lenders to keep on supporting people's businesses by financing them with loans.

loans.use: to buy daily household-use items.

loans.name: Anna's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Anna, who as a group leader, is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to three children. She is known by her community as a very trustworthy person.

Initially, Anna joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Anna plans to send her children to school.

Between the nine farmers in Anna's Group, a total of 5.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Even though Anna will not receive a solar light, some members of the group will receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Surma

texts.ru: Сурма, 58 лет, замужем, многодетная мать 3 детей. Образование-высшее, работает фельдшером, получая заработную плату в размере около 11,300 сом (KGS). В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей большой и дружной семьи она занимается животноводством, в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 4 овцы, лошадь. Для содержания скота есть все условия, летом скот отгоняется на пастбище, зимой содержится в теплых сараях. Ежемесячный доход Сурмы составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сурма обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 15 овец. Она является лидером группы "Сурма", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Сурма планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Surma is 58 years old, married, and the mother 3 children. She has a higher education and works as a medical assistant. She earns about 11,300 KGS. To make extra money for her large and happy family, she works in animal husbandry. Her farm has three cows, four sheep, and a horse. In the summer, the cattle are kept in a pasture while they winter in warm barns. Surma's monthly income is about 20,000 KGS. In order to further develop her business, Surma asked the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy 15 sheep. She is the leader of the group "Surma", which consist of her and two other people. Surma plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding the business and improving the welfare of the family.

loans.use: buy 15 sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Dilaramkan

texts.ru: Диларамкан, 47 лет, вдова, мать 2 детей. Образование-высшее, работает медсестрой, получая заработную плату в размере около 7,600 сом (KGS). В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход Диларамкан составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, так как это наиболее прибыльный вид деятельности, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Диларамкан является участником группы "Сурма", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита она  планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Dilaramkan is 47 years old, a widow, and the mother of 2 children. She has a higher education. She works as a nurse, earning about 7,600 KGS. To make extra money for her family, she works in animal husbandry. Her farm has 4 cows and 15 sheep. Dilaramkan's monthly income is about 15,000 KGS. This is not nearly enough for a decent standard of living. In order to further develop her business since that's where she makes most of her money, she turned to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep. Dilaramkan is a member of the group "Surma", which consist of her and two other people. She plans to invest profits from the loan into expanding her business and building a barn for livestock.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Doreen's Group

texts.en:
Doreen is the group leader of her group in Kakamega North District, and she is representing 10 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of four children. Doreen joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Doreen decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She is also very excited to get a solar light, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours to enable her children to study. Doreen plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Doreen's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 5.5 acres of land.They will also get a total of seven solar lights among them.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old single man from Dier El balah city. He lives with his family  in a simple house. 

Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector, where he makes a low income. He also works in transferring goods for the local traders, using his rickshaw. It is a good business, and provides him with a good income. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to replace his old one. This will help him to improve his business, and increase his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace his old one.

loans.name: Karen Jessenia

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Ángeles De Colon. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general. 
En este lugar vive la señora Karen, tiene 22 años de edad, está separada pero de ese relación tiene dos  hijos de 7 y 3 años, el mayor  estudia en una  escuela de la localidad. Ella vive en casa de los padres.
Doña Karen es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende  sabanas, sobrecamas, cortinas entre otros productos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro  días a la semana sus recorridos y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento de ella y sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, sobrecamas, cortinas entre otras cosas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 ciclos  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños es darles la mejor educación  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area known as Los Angeles in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo the members of the loan group 'Los Angeles de Colon' meet every fortnight. These members carry out different businesses in areas from agriculture to general commerce.

This is where Karen lives. She is 22 years old and separated, however she has two children from this relationship who are 7 and 3 years old. The eldest child studies at a school in the community. Karen lives in her parents' home.

Karen is a woman who loves to work so she can bring up her children. She works in business selling sheets, bedspreads and curtains, amongst other items. She sells from door to door three or four times a week and she also sells from home where her clients she knows can find her. They buy their products on credit and she collects weekly repayments from them. She has been working in this business for three years which is how she is able to earn a living for herself and her children.

This loan will be used to buy sheets, bedspreads and curtains, amongst other items. She has been in her loan group for four cycles and she likes it because she started her business thanks to her loans which have allowed her to get ahead. Her dream is to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with one child.

He has had a motorcycle transport business for five years. He has asked for a loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to purchase another motorcycle and serve more customers, as well as make more income.

With the anticipated profits, Peter will be able to educate his children and provide for his family's needs.

His hopes and dreams for the future are buying more motorcycles and being successful.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle and serve more customers as well as make more income.

loans.name: Juliter

texts.en:
Juliter is a 59-year-old married woman with 6 children. 

She has had a retail shop business for 20 years. She will be using the loan to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil. 
 
Juliter's anticipated profits will help her buy more retail goods, and meet the high demands of her customers. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are expand her retail shop, and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gindah

texts.en:
Gindah is 31 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Gindah is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gindah has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gindah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Masindi-Uganda where he runs a bar and guest house that generate income to support his family. He also does farming and earns a monthly salary that provides him additional income. 

Robert wishes to complete his residential house and begin some rentals. He expects to yield a lot in the future from this activity. He faces a challenge of competition and inadequate capital which affect his profit margin. Robert needs a loan to buy materials, such as sand and bricks, to build his house.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as sand and bricks, to build his house.

loans.name: Malyuda

texts.ru: Малюда, 47 лет, замужем, есть сын. Образование-высшее, работает медсестрой, получая заработную плату в размере около 13,500 сом (KGS). В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход Малюды составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 овец. Малюда является участником группы "Сурма", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и постройку большого дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Malyuda is 47 years old, married, and has a son. She has a degree and works as a nurse. Her salary is about 13,500 KGS. to make extra money for her family she works in animal husbandry. Her farm has three cows and 15 sheep. Malyuda's monthly income is about 20,000 KGS. In order to further develop her business, she turned to Bai-Tushum for a loan of 80,000 KGS to buy 12 sheep. Malyuda is a member of the group "Surma", which consist of her and two other people. She plans to invest profits from her loan into expanding her business and building a big house for her family.

loans.use: buy 12 sheep to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Deni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of Ruma’s agents, Deni. Deni lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about 5 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. 

Deni owns a stall that sells wall paint, and provides bill payment services to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in another sector, which is technology. Deni is a person who is curious, and never stops learning. He attracts many customers.

As the business has grown, Deni needs additional capital, and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits, and provide more bill payment services to his community. 

Deni’s goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. In the photo, Deni is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to increase his daily revenue by selling mobile airtime credits, and providing bill payment services for his communities.

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Juan Bautista está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
La Sra. Gumercinda, una de las integrantes de este grupo, se destaca por ser una persona luchadora que quiere crecer y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo. Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas de marcas y volver a venderlas ya sea:, blusas, remeras para hombres y mujeres, ropas para criaturas.
Ella quiere seguir capacitándose y luchar para poder ir mejorando su situación de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group "San Juan Bautista" [St. John the Baptist] is in its second loan cycle. It is a committee of women, where all work and help each other to succeed. Each one of them is putting forth her best effort to be able to grow and to be someone in life.

Gumercinda is one of this group's members. She stands out for being a determined person who wants to grow and help her family through her work and her effort. She is requesting this loan to purchase brand-name clothing and re-sell it, such as blouses, men's and women's t-shirts, and children's clothing.

She wants to continue empowering herself and fighting to continually improve her situation in life and that of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's brand-name clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Central De Cachilaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRAL DE CACHILAYA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante es uno solo, mismo que esta basado en la producción pesquera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde niña trabaja con este producto, al adquirir una red inicia un negocio independiente hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de red) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente realizará la comercialización de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The 'Central de Cachilaya' community bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Copacabana. The group is made up of eight members and are led by an executive board of which Veronica is president. The group members all share the same type of business which is based on fishing.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microbusiness holders that Veronica is a part of. She told us that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after being invited by a massive campaign that was launched in the area by the institution.  Veronica currently has a business selling fish. She told us that she learnt this trade from her parents since she has worked with fish since she was a child. When she purchased a net some years ago she started her own business. 
 
This loan will be used to increase her capital (purchasing a net) which she will acquire from the bulk vendors in the community and then she will sell her products. This form of work will allow her to generate an income to support her family financially now that she is married and has a son. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Veronica replied that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a net

loans.name: Mat's Group

texts.en:
Mat’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mat makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Mark's Group

texts.en:
"Mark", pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is now proud to represent his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 58 years old and is married with 9 children.

Mark likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Mark is also excited to be getting a solar light as he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and thus save more money. He plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Mark’s Group will receive 11 solar lights between them and inputs to cultivate 7.75 acres of land."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.ru: Гулзар, 39 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У Гулзар высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулзар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 10 овец и лошадь. На 5,59 Га она выращивает кукурузу, фасоль и клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулзар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулзар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и обучение ее детей.
texts.en: Gulzar is 39 years old, married and has 5 children. Gulzar has a college education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to Gulzar's hard work, today her farm contains 6 cows, 10 sheep and a horse. She grows corn, beans and clover on 5.59 hectares of land. To continue developing her business, Gulzar requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 3 bulls in order to increase her livestock headcount. Gulzar plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and into educating her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 bulls in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Mkaratusi Group

texts.en:
Mwansiti, who is in her mid 40s, is single with three children, and all of them are big. She has been selling fried fish for twenty years now. She works from 7am to 12 noon and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Mwansiti's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing her stock of fish, and she can now sell to more customers. She was really happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to take care of herself and her extended family, for loan repayment, and to cover household expenses.  

She will use this loan to increase her stock of fish and meet customer demand. She dreams of building her own house. 

Mwansiti will share this loan with her loan group "Mkaratusi" which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish and meet customer demand.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony  is 33 years old. He is married and blessed with 2 children. 

Antony has had a farming business for 12 years and it has been profitable. 

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer, herbicides and manure. He hopes this will help him grow his business and generate more  income. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children, buy more cows and produce food in plenty for sale.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer, herbicides and manure

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 28 years old and widowed, with two children who both attend school. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

Safina deals in buying and selling fish, and she gets additional income from cocoa growing. She started the business four years ago to get income, and she dreams of expanding the business, raising money for school fees for her children, and promoting the family's standard of living, despite the challenge of high competition in fish marketing.  

Safina needs a loan to buy more fish to sell.

The photo was taken at her business place in the market where it was hard to exclude other people.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marjilina

texts.en:
Marjilina is 27 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Marjilina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marjilina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marjilina has been in pig fattening for nine years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Marjilina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 27 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, работает учителем русского языка и литературы, коллеги отзываются о ней как о трудолюбивой, честной женщине. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Динара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 11 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,0 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Dinara is 27 years old and married. She has a secondary education and works as a Russian language and literature teacher. Her colleagues call her a hardworking and honest woman. To provide additional income for her family, Dinara is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business 15 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Dinara's hard work, today her farm contains a cow, 11 sheep and 2.0 hectares of land, where she grows beans. Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Dinara requested a loan in the amount 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock headcount. Dinara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 42 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. У Айнагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет от 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Ainagul is 42 years old, married and raising 4 children. Ainagul has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry. Thanks to Ainagul's hard work, today her farm contains 4 cows. Her combined monthly income amounts up to 15,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Ainagul requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a cow for fattening up and subsequent resale at a higher price at a market. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy a cow for fattening and  subsequent esale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase the necessary ingredients to make Sambusa ( traditional food) in a large quanity to sell to the local residents

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen’s Group live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Yen makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 55, is very passionate about dairy farming. He has 2 healthy dairy cows on his 2-acre piece of land in Kaplelmet village in Nandi Hills, Kenya. His main income source is milk. He uses milk income to take care of his wife, who has been with him for 28 years, and 5 children.
 
John's major challenge is brought about by poor road conditions. Therefore he is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle that is affordable, economic, versatile and suitable for poor road conditions.
 
It is always a nightmare for many farmers from the area to transport their produce to the market. Although many road development projects are ongoing around the country, the majority of roads are in a very poor condition. In Kaplelmet, for instance, roads are bad - cracked and riddled with potholes, invariably uneven, and essentially made up of rocky tracks. 

With your loan, John will acquire an Indian motorcycle that can handle roads impassable by cars. With this, he will be able to transport his produce to the market as often as he pleases. He can also make extra income by offering transportation services to other members of his community. Additional income from this investment will be used to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Protas

texts.en:
Protas is a 43-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married and blessed with three children of school-going age. 

Protas does carpentry and is self-employed, a business he has been doing for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 15,000.

He has applied for a loan with VisionFund Kenya, to purchase more timber for making furniture to sell to his customers. 

He will plow the anticipated profit back into the business so as to have stable capital for running his business.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for making furniture

loans.name: Chhoub's Group

texts.en: Chhoub’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chhoub works as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mamat

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Mamat. Mamat lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about a five-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Mamat owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and provides bill payment services to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn about how to expand his business in another sector, that of technology. Mamat is a friendly and hardworking agent and his community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Mamat needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Mamat’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for his community via Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Mamat is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to increase his daily revenue by selling mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Norng's Group

texts.en: Norng’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Norng makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this man and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Sunset Group

texts.en:
Out there in one of the rural areas of Zimbabwe, a harsh truth has been passed down from generation to generation: there is no fear but the fear of hunger. 

With this bitter truth in mind, from the age of 19, Mercy has always gotten up early at the break of dawn to unclamp a mosquito net hanging in her mother’s kitchen, which was also her bedroom during the night. Arriving early at a nearby river, Mercy and her mother have used this gigantic mosquito net as a sieve to catch fish. In her community, others use these mosquito nets as fishing nets. This has been a health hazard to the community as these insecticide-treated nets contaminate the water with chemicals.

Growing up amidst poverty and seeing the misuse of mosquito nets, Mercy has tried to find ways of solving problems in the community at the same time as feeding her family. One of her solutions has been to educate her community about the correct use of mosquito nets and give advice to fisherman about strong fishing nets.

Mercy is now 36 years old and a mother of one beautiful girl. She runs a small business selling fishing nets and fishing hooks which she buys from Tanzania. Her business has helped reduce the contamination of rivers with insecticide from mosquito nets.

When she heard about Thrive Microfinance she formed a group called Sunset to take up a group loan. She and a group of three women hope that a loan from Kiva will help them expand their businesses and supply more fishing nets to their community and other neighbouring communities with similar problems. They hope that soon the community will follow suit and stop using mosquito nets as fishing nets.

loans.use: to expand her fishing supplies business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas  está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien es modista quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una situación de pobreza extrema. Ella tiene muy buena clientela, que siempre le hace muchos pedidos y con ello tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia y otros seres queridos.
La Sra. Maria solicita de este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y agujas, y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y más venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas is in its 10th loan cycle of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs, where they all work and help each other to succeed. They form part of the program of eliminating poverty, where each one puts forward their best effort to be able to gradually overcome their own poverty situation. 

One of the members is Maria, who is a dressmaker that showed a poverty level within level one on her last survey, which is to say that she is in a situation of extreme poverty. She has very good clientele that always order from her, and with that she has the income to be able to help her family and other loved ones. 

Maria is asking for this loan to buy fabrics, thread and needles, etc., which will help her to get more production and more sales that will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to by fabrics, thread and needles, etc.

loans.name: Lizzi

texts.es:
La Sra. Lizzi tiene 26 años, ella es macatera, es decir hace ventas ambulantes, ella sale a vender sus productos por su barrio y zonas aledañas.
Ella es una persona joven que pese a la edad quiere luchar para poder crecer y salir adelante. Quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, y es por eso que se está esforzando mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, calzados y otros productos para poder vender en forma ambulante y poder seguir con su humilde trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lizzi is 26 years old and is a street vendor. She sells her products in her local barrio and in the surrounding areas. 

Lizzi is a young woman who, in spite of her age, wants to work hard in order to grow and progress. She wants to help her loved ones, and is thus working very hard.

Lizzi is applying for this loan in order to buy clothing items, footwear, and other items to sell as a street vendor. This will allow her to continue with her humble work.

loans.use: to buy clothing items, footwear, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Ángeles De Colon. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general. 
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene  un hijo de 4 años  el cual estudia en jardín de infantes. Su marido es comerciante. 
Doña Diana es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar como planchas, licuadoras, ollas,  sabanas, sobrecamas, cortinas y  otros productos de catalogo, su forma de venta es ir recorriendo la localidad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que entrega a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella también le da parte el crédito  a su marido el cual vende arroz al por mayor y menor. Lleva 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad y su marido muchos años más, es así como trabajando los dos ellos pueden salir adelante ya que cada vez más la situación económica es más difícil y solo trabajando pueden lograr sacar adelante a su pequeño.
Este crédito es para comprar toallas, sobrecamas, cortinas y arroz para el negocio de su marido. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un gran local para vender junto a su marido.
texts.en:
In the Los Ángeles sector of Colon parish in Ecuador’s city of Portoviejo, the members (all women) of the “Los Ángeles de Colon” loan group meet every fortnight. These members work in various sectors, including farming and general trade.

And it is here that 28-year-old Diana lives. She has a partner, a trader, with whom she has a four-year-old son. The couple’s son is in nursery school. 

Diana loves to work in order to help her partner to move forward in life. She makes a living in trade, selling household items, such as irons, blenders, pots, bed sheets, covers, curtains, and other items. Selling from catalogues, Diana goes around the town selling her products on credit and collecting payments every week. Diana will also give part of this loan to her partner in order to buy rice, which he sells both wholesale and retail. Diana has been selling her products for one year, while her partner has been selling rice for many more. By working, the couple can move forward. They have a tough financial situation and only by working can they help their little one to do better in life.

This loan will be used to buy towels, bedsheets, curtains, and rice for Diana’s partner’s business. Diana has been with the loan group since it began and likes it for the loans. Diana’s dream is to have large premises where she and her partner can sell their products alongside one another.

loans.use: to buy towels, bedsheets, curtains and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines and clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Letty Marilyn

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Ángeles De Colon. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general. 
En este lugar vive la señorita Letty, tiene 58 años de edad,  es soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Ella es socia fundadora del Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella pudo comenzar con su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante, por lo cual está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir y con las personas que hacen posible estos créditos.
Doña Letty es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ganar el sustento de ella y su mamá, ella  tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende colas, aguas, cervezas,  golosinas, hielo, entre otras cosas, aunque sus ventas no son muchas lo que vende les da lo necesario para salir adelante y esto le agrada ya que se gana sus ingresos dentro de casa y está atenta a las necesidades de su mamá la cual ya está anciana. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar aguas, sodas, dulces, golosinas y cervezas lo cual es lo que mejores ganancias les deja.  Sus sueños son tener una gran tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
In the area known as Los Angeles in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, all of the members of the loan group "Los Angeles de Colon" meet every 15 days. These same members are dedicated to various activities such as farming and general commerce.

Letty lives here. She is 58 years old, single and lives in her parents' home. She is a founding member of the loan group and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she was able to begin her business which allows her to get ahead so she is very thankful for the Fundacion Espoir and to the people who make these loans possible.

Letty is a woman who likes to work to support herself and her mother. She has a small business in her house where she sells cokes, water, beers, candies, ice, among other items. Although her sales are not a lot, what she sells gives her what she needs to get ahead and this pleases her since she earns at home and can attend to her mother who is elderly.
