This loan will be used to buy water, sodas, sweets, candies and beer which provides the best earnings. Her dream is to have a large grocery store.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, sweets, candies and beer.

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Pablo está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aún se encuentra en crecimiento, donde las integrantes hacen actividades eminentemente rurales, como su medio de salir adelante.
La Sra. Lourdes es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la cría de animales variados, es una mujer muy sacrificada que se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Poco a poco y mediante su trabajo quiere abrirse camino, y el día de mañana poder tener una propia granja.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, y con ello poder seguir con la cría de sus animales que viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank group San Pablo is in its third women's program loan cycle in the city of Curugaty.  The area is still in development and the members are involved in rural activities to earn a living.

Lourdes is one of the members and she raises different animals.  She is a self-sacrificing woman who makes every effort to give her family everything she was unable to have.  Little by little, through her work, she wants to make her way and one day have her own farm.  The loan she is requesting is to buy balanced animal feedor for her animals so she can continue the line of work she has been in.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clay to make bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a house on her land.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una mujer sonriente y alegre de 52 años de edad, vive con su pareja y dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos, su negocio lo inicio en el año 1994 y con este quería alimentar los sueños y las esperanzas de su familia, lo inicio por querer tener una mejor calidad de vida, por ayudar a su pareja, por comer mejor y hasta el día de hoy ha logrado que su familia viva mejor.
Ella quiere ser una mejor empresa, antes su preocupación era criar a sus muchachos, pero ahora que están grandes, busca apoyarlos para que se puedan capacitar en una universidad y convertirse en la primera generación que asiste a esta.
Luz Marina quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de carne, maíz y aderezos para realizar sus alimentos.
Este préstamo le podría ayudar a Luz Marina a aumentar la cantidad de alimentos que produce y buscar convenios con tiendas y vendedores de jugos para que vendan como complemento sus ricos productos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a smiley and happy woman who is 52 years old and lives with her spouse and two children. She is dedicated to selling food. She started her business in 1994 and with it she wished to nourish her dreams and her family's hopes. She started it through wanting to have a better quality of life, to help her spouse, and to eat better and until now she has managed to help her family live better.

She wishes to be a better entrepreneur. Previously, she was preoccupied with raising her children but now that they are older, she is searching to support them so they can enroll in university and become the first generation who attends university.

Luz Marina wants to request a loan which will be invested in the purchase of meat, maize and dressings to make her food. This loan will help her expand the quantity of food that she produces and seek agreements with shops and juice vendors so that they sell them as a complement to their delicious products.

loans.use: to buy meat, maize and dressings to make food.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio de 57 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad. Él se dedica al cultivo y venta de hortalizas actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años y que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar. Porfirio desea realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda, para lo que solicita un crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en: poliducto, alambre, caja térmica y mano de obra necesaria para realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Porfirio, 57, is a hard-working man who lives in his own house with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 9. He grows and sells vegetables, which he has been doing for 15 years to support his household economy.  Porfirio wants to install electricity in his home and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy plastic cabling, wire, and an electrical box, as well as hire workers needed to install electricity in his house.  This is so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy plastic cabling, wire, and an electrical box, and hire workers to install electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To print 500 copies of his book.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Elizabeth es ama de casa y madre de 4 hijos, dedicada a la cría de animales de granja como cerdos y pollos, los cuales vende en el mercado local. Está solicitando un crédito por dos mil cien dólares ($2.100). Este dinero lo empleará en la compra de tres cerdos para engorde y compra de semilla e insumos para la siembra de dos hectáreas  de maíz. La cosecha la dedicará exclusivamente para el engorde de estos animales.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a homemaker and mother of four children.  She raises farm animals such as pigs and chickens which she sells at the local market.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,100 USD to buy three pigs to raise, and seeds and supplies to plant two hectares of corn.  She will use the harvested corn exclusively to feed the animals.

loans.use: To buy three pigs to raise, and seeds and supplies to plant two hectares of corn.

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer joven de 28 años de edad, dedica la venta de informal de electrodomésticos y productos para salón de belleza, ella es madre de dos hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad, al no poder emplearse encontró en el comercio una salida para solventar sus “problemas económicos”, como lo son pago de servicios públicos, es decir, agua, electricidad, saneamiento, el alimento de sus hijos, transporte y estudio.

Al ser este negocio una salida que le resulto tan efectiva, quiere hacer de este algo grande, sueña con tener un loca, con empleados, lleno de personas con una gran sonrisa buscando algún producto, sueña con llorar al ver a sus hijos un día graduarse de la universidad, tener vivienda propia.

Liliana quiere solicitar un préstamo para potenciar sus ventas en productos de salón de belleza, con el préstamo comprara tratamientos, tinturas, peinillas, máquinas de motilar, secadores, planchas para cabello etc.
texts.en:
This young woman is Liliana. She is 28 years old and works in the informal sector, selling home appliances and beauty products. She is the mother of two children aged 2 and 8. Since she could not find a formal job, she decided to sell things in order to solve her “financial problems,” such as paying the utilities (i.e. water, electricity and sanitation), buy food for her children, and paying for their transport and studies.

She realized that this business was good, so she wants to expand it. She dreams of having her own store, employees and many customers that smile while they look for something they need. She also dreams of seeing her children graduate from the university and having a house of her own.

Liliana wants to request a loan to increase her beauty products sales. With the loan, she will buy hair products, dyes, combs, hair clippers, hair dryers, hair irons, etc.

loans.use: to buy hair products, combs, hair clippers, hair dryers, hair irons, etc.

loans.name: Henry De Jesus

texts.es:
Desde 1985 el señor Henry se dedica a caminar por las calles de Momil vendiendo pescado, con su alegría, su positivismo y sus ganas de salir adelante que siempre lo ha caracterizado.
Henry es padre de 4 hijos, ofrece un empleo y su sueño es ofrecer a sus 4 varones que son todos ellos menores de edad una mejor calidad de vida, estudio, una esperanza para que ellos tenga quizás una mejor oportunidad de progreso que él.
Su negocio lo inicio por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y es muy agradecido al saber que ha tenido éxito y que puede cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Henry solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de pescado, con este surtido tendrá un almacenamiento suficiente e iniciaría una estrategia más agresiva de promoción en su barrio.
texts.en:
Henry has been selling fish in the streets of Momil since 1985. He is well-known for being a joyful, positive, and persistent person.

Henry has four underage children. He has an employee. His dream is to improve his children’s living conditions and pay for their studies, thinking that in this way they might have better opportunities to get ahead than he did. He started this business because he likes it and his vocation is to be an independent worker. He is grateful for the success he has had and because he can cover the home expenses.

Henry is requesting a loan to buy fish. His stock levels will increase and he will be able to design a bolder marketing strategy to sell in his neighborhood.

loans.use: solicita un préstamo para la compra de pescado

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married to a barangay captain. They live in San Guillermo, Isabela, with their two children. The family earns through their welding shop. With indefinite income they find it hard to send their daughter Catherine to college. Catherine is taking a BS in Accountancy. She wants to finish her college education to help increase their standard of living. 

To make this dream come true, Grace wants an educational loan of PHP 200,000 from Kiva lenders so she can send Catherine to college.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Madeha

texts.en: Madeha, 39, is from Minia. She is married with two sons. Her husband is a part-time farmer with a very low income that can't cover the family's monthly expenses. Madeha decided to help her husband with the family income. Four years ago, she started a grocery project in her house. She looks forward to expanding her business with a 1,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more products such as rice, pasta and biscuits to increase her sales and make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, pasta and biscuits.

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en: Than’s group lives in a rural village in the Palin province in Cambodia. Than works as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, hair driers, fans and a generator to use in his salon.

loans.name: Sreyloeung's Group

texts.en: Sreyloeung’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sreyloeung makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en: Sokhim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokhim works as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phei's Group

texts.en: Phei’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phei works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a smallholder dairy farmer from Kegogi village in Nyamira, Kenya. He heads a family consisting of him, his wife and five children. Like most of the farmers in the region, James keeps dairy animals for milk. He has three dairy cows. 

During the dry season, farmers are forced to send their animals to far away locations with greener pastures. This creates a shortage of income from milk due to the 'migration' of the animals. The more expensive alternative to sending away animals is introducing zero-grazing. For zero-grazing to be implemented, however, cows have to have shelter. 

James is seeking a KES40,000 loan to construct a cowshed. He plans to minimize the cost of construction by using locally available materials. The cowshed will provide a healthy and conducive environment for the cows to be more productive. Soon, he will introduce zero-grazing which has proven over and over again to have better results in terms of milk production. 

Additional income from this investment will be used by James to meet the needs of his family, such as providing good education for his children.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 54 years old. He is married to Veronica who is also a farmer; and they are blessed with five school-going children
      
He has had a farming business for 20 years, currently earning KES35,000. He has borrowed KES20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his second loan, after successfully paying his previous loan. 

He will be using the loan to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides. He hopes that the anticipated profit will help him to cater for the family's basic needs, pay for the transportation of his farm products to the market and repay his loan. Paul's hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable farming business, secure a wider market for his farm products, provide a better education to his kids and enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Frelyn

texts.en:
Frelyn is 42 years old and has two children.  She is married and both of her children are in school.

Frelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Frelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Frelyn has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Frelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Khy's Group

texts.en:
Khy’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khy works as farmer and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en:
Ameer, age 21, operates a rickshaw transport business to earn a living. He brings goods to and from local traders with his rickshaw. Ameer reports that this is a good business and that it provides him with a good income. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city of Dier Al-Balah.

Ameer requested a Murabaha loan from FATEN. He will use his loan funds to buy a new rickshaw to replace his old, damaged one. This investment will help him to improve his business and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es:
Dinora es una mujer de 44 años de edad, perseverante, trabajadora, protectora, amorosa con sus hijos y muy responsable con su labor, ella maneja una tienda de abarrotes, vende todo tipo de productos desde chocolates, galletería, café, panes, panela, quesito, refrescos, aceite de cocina, condimentos, salsas, huevos, arroz, frijoles etc., etc., etc.
Es madre de 3 hijos, dos mujeres y un hombre, quiere crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia, ver sus hijos estudiando y encaminándose a un futuro prometedor.
Dinora quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en surtido de refrescos y cervezas, así seguir alimentando su máquina generadora de sueño es que es su empresa.
texts.en:
Dinora, 44, is a determined and hardworking woman.  She's protective and loving with her children and very responsible with her job.  She runs a grocery store where she sells all types of products, including chocolates, cookies, coffee, bread, raw cane sugar, soft cheese, soft drinks, cooking oil, condiments, sauces, eggs, rice, beans, and so on.

She's the mother of three children, two girls and a boy.  She wants to grow and have a better quality of life for herself and her family.  She also wants her children to go to school and have a promising future.

Dinora wants to request a loan to invest in a supply of soft drinks and beer so she can keep nourishing the dream-generating machine that is her business.

loans.use: to stock her business with soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sok makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
Luz Estela es una mujer madura dedicada a prestar servicios de salón de belleza, en ella genera un empleo y lleva operando como independiente desde el año 2013, gracias a sus conocimientos que adquirió estudiando y trabajando en empleos similares. 
Ella es madre de dos hijas adolescentes y se siente muy motivada ya que como su negocio está empezando a dar buenos resultados puede brindarles a sus dos hijas la posibilidad de una educación superior, esto la llena de energía, positivismo, se siente alegre, no solo por sus hijas, si no por ella misma al ver su progreso. 
Ahora buscando mejorar sus condiciones, su local, su hogar quiere solicitar un préstamo y está muy consciente de lo que es Kiva y te invita a participar de su progreso, apoyándola con un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de planchas, secadores, e insumos como tinturas, e implementos para ofertar servicios más óptimos.
texts.en: Luz Estela is a mature woman who offers beauty salon services with which she generates employment. She has been working independently since 2013, thanks to the knowledge she acquired by studying and working in similar jobs. She is the mother of two teenage daughters, and she feels very motivated because, since her business is starting to show good results, she can offer her two daughters the opportunity of a college education. This fills her with happiness and positive thoughts. She feels happy, not only for her daughters, but also for her when seeing her progress. In order to improve her salon, her home, she is requesting a loan. She knows well what Kiva is, and invites you to participate in her progress, supporting her with a loan that she will use to buy straightening brushes, hair dryers, and inputs such as hair colors and implements to offer more optimal services.

loans.use: to buy personal use products and inputs for beauty salons.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 33, sells clothing to earn her living. She started her business in order to be able to meet the increasing demands of her family, including school fees for her children. She and her husband have four children, ages two to 15. The three eldest children attend school. The family lives in Hoima.

Elizabeth has ambitions of growing and expanding her business. Presently, however, the achievement of her desires is hindered by inadequate capital. 

She has requested a loan in order to buy more clothes to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a 24-year-old married man from Dier El-Balah city. He lives with his wife in a simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in transferring goods for the local traders using his rickshaw. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. 

Yasin took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one. This will help him to improve his business and increase his income. 

Yasin appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, age 43, sells vegetables to earn her living. She has been engaged in this activity for 10 years, and she is able to earn a monthly income of Kes 5,000 from her business. She and her husband live in Kakamega with their six children.

Pamela has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more green vegetables to offer for sale. 

Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 48-year-old mother from the Kisumu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Mr. Jackson, who is a farmer and supports the family.  She supports five people in her family, and was blessed with three children.

She has stall where she sells second-hand clothes; it has been operating for the last nine years and generates a monthly income of KES. 7,500. 

She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase clothes materials. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the current business.

Her dream is expand her business and educate their children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes materials

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for five years  now. She is a 42-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has a 16-year-old daughter.  Aside from the hog raising business, she operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various items ranging from noodles, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, to soap and condiments.

She is asking for a loan to buy to buy fishing net, stock for the store, additional piglets and feed . This will help improve her over all livelihood. This will augment her income and give her the ability start to handle her finances.

She hopes that she could manage her business properly to finance the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, stock for the store, additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children from Dulag, Leyte. Amalia is engaged the farming of sweet potatoes and cassava. She also raises pigs for additional income. 

Amalia is asking to take a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the crops. She believes that a loan will help her improve her business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the crops

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children; they live in Dulag, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Amalia is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking, condiments, bread, biscuits, chips and snack foods. Through this loan, Amalia will be able to improve her inventory thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Amalia hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking, condiments, bread, biscuits, chips, and snack foods

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a married hard working man aged 25 years. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, beans and rice. He supplements his income by running a butcher shop where he gets extra income. He has managed to support his family using the proceeds. 

He dreams of expanding and developing his business, however, price fluctuations pose a big problem to his business. 

He will use the credit facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella, age 51, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ella and her husband have six children, three of whom are attending school.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Ella would like to save enough money to expand her business. Her goal is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Jetu

texts.en:
Jetu, age 39, runs a general store business to earn an income. In her store, she sells food items like sugar and salt, as well as household goods such as soap. She earns an additional income from selling stationery items.

Jetu and her husband have three children between the ages of eight and 10 years old.

Though she reports that her business is challenged by price fluctuations, Jetu hopes to grow and expand her enterprise over time. She will use her loan funds to buy salt, sugar, and other goods to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and other goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cruz Beidy

texts.es:
Cruz es una mujer soltera sin hijos que batalla diariamente por generar recursos para su familia, su padre, su madre, por estudiar, por el progreso, por tener un medio de sostenimiento fijo, por no pasar necesidades, por ser independiente y sentirse capaz.
Cruz tiene 31 años de edad, esta sorprendente mujer cuenta con 5 empleados internos que se convirtieron en su familia y ahora está en proyección de crecimiento para aumentar su número de empleados, y su sueño es llegar a convertir su salón de belleza en un spa de relajación, con servicios de belleza.
Cruz quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de sillas de manicura y pedicura que serán destinados a los nuevos empleados que aspira a tener.
texts.en:
Cruz, 31, is a single mother with no children.  She struggles every day so she can generate income for her family, her mother, and her father, and so she can study, make progress, have a fixed means of support, have everything she needs, be independent, and feel capable.

Cruz is an amazing woman.  She employed five people who became her family.  Now she's in the process of growing so she can increase her staff.  Her dream is to turn her beauty salon into a relaxing spa with beauty services.

Cruz wants to request a loan to buy manicure and pedicure chairs for the new employees she hopes to have.

loans.use: to buy manicure and pedicure chairs so she can generate jobs

loans.name: Petronila's Group

texts.en:
Petronila, age 45, has been a farmer for 15 years, and is proud to represent her group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District. 

Petronila describes herself as a very hard-working individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. She will also be receiving a solar light, which she is very excited about, as it will enable her to have light during dark hours, allowing her children to study. She and her husband have five children.

She plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business. 

In total, Petronila’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land. In addition, they will receive a total of five solar lights between them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Ánh

texts.en:
Mr. Ánh works in agriculture farming food. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Ánh is 47 years old and he is married with two children. He lives in the Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Ánh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. Ánh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Ánh faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Ánh hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Dung has a retail business selling fish. Dung has been involved in this business for eight years.

In 2008, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Dung faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

Dung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Tình

texts.en:
Tình works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture.

Tình is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Tình faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Tình hopes to maintain  a successful business for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 48-year-old married man and a father of four grown-up children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Antonio is makes a living through a hog raising business. He has been in the business for more than two years now. 

As of this time, he wants to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help him improve his hog raising business thus augmenting his profit and income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 29 years old, married and has two children attending school. 

To help her husband in gaining income, she offers bridal gowns for rent and catering services for all occasions. She has been in this business for almost eight years. 

She aims to continue and improve this business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more  bridal gowns and kitchen utensils needed in providing services. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more bridal gowns and kitchen utensils.

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 56 years old. She is not married but has 2 children whom she supports. 

Veronicah is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 15 years and it has been profitable. 

She has requested for a loan which she will use to purchase solar energy system. This will help her children study in a conducive environment. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system

loans.name: Jrennife

texts.en:
Jennifer, age 36, operates a taxi transportation business to earn her living. She has run her business for five years, and she is able to earn a monthly income of Kes 30,000. She is a single mother blessed with one child, age five.  

Jennifer has borrowed Kes 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. This is her first loan, and it will allow her to expand her business. Specifically, she will use her loan funds to buy spare parts and fuel for her taxi cab. She intends to use the anticipated profit to buy food for the family, pay school fees and provide medical care for her child, and further expand the current business, as well as to repay her loan. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a thriving business, provide a good education to her child, and offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel for her tax cab

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and has four children.  She is married and all of her children are in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Irene has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette, age 39, is a rice farmer. She has been engaged in this business for the past 21 years. She and her husband, who has his own business, have five children between the ages of three and 16 years old. Three of the children attend school.

With her loan from Kiva, Claudette would like to pay workers to help her plant rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers to help her plant rice

loans.name: Ceciliah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Ceciliah, 43 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer, who lives in Nyakoora, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Nyamira area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profits and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan and permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella lives in Hoima Uganda. She is married with 3 children and all attend school. She deals in produce mainly, buying and selling of maize and beans, among other items. She also owns rentals that help her make additional income for her family. She hopes to grow her business and educate her children; however, inadequate capital poses a threat to her business. She will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Edwin Andrei

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 40 años de edad, inicio con su negocio de alquiler de vestidos en el año 2012 como una salida a sus problemas económicos que de momento presentaba y no le encontraba solución ya que en ese entonces no tenía actividad que le presentara ingresos.
Edwin desde entonces por un consejo de amigo se involucró en dicha actividad y sigue adelante con sueños y esperanzas, aterrizado un poco más acerca de lo que es ser el administrador de un negocio, de la responsabilidad y buena gestión que necesita tener para lograr una sostenibilidad y competitividad en el mercado.
Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de vestidos de quinceañeras, ya que siempre son los que más piden.
Con este préstamo espera lograr mejores ventas, recomendaciones de usuarios atendidos, un capital para emprender un proyecto de comprar un local propio y brindarle a sus dos hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin, 40, started his business renting dresses in 2012 as a way out of the economic problems he was having at the time because he didn't have a job to earn an income.  Since then, Edwin got involved in that line of work on the advice of a friend and he's making progress with his hopes and dreams.  He quickly learned more about the responsibility and good management necessary to be sustainable and competitive in the market.

He wants to request a loan to buy Quinceañera [fifteenth birthday] dresses, which are in high demand.

With this loan he hopes to improve his sales and referrals from customers he has served, and have some capital to undertake a project to buy his own retail space.  He wants to give his two daughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of Quinceañera dresses to rent

loans.name: Jof De Jesus

texts.es:
Jof es un joven de 24 años de edad, que desde el año 2007 lleva trabajando arduamente en sus propias tierras, es padre de dos hermosas princesas de 2 y 6 años de edad.
Aprendió de sus dotes de agricultor gracias a su madre y ahora que emprendió su propio camino y ahora tiene sus sueños, pagar la educación de sus hijos, dejar el negocio a sus hijos, comprar vivienda, tantos sueños en los que pone tanto empeño, ya cumplió uno que fue tener su propio negocio y ahora seguirá con el siguiente en su lista.
Solicita un préstamo para arreglar sus terrenos de café, igualmente invertirá un capital en la compra de abonos.
texts.en:
Jof, 24, has been working hard on his own land since 2007.  He's the father of two beautiful princesses, ages 2 and 6.

He discovered his gifts as a farmer thanks to his mother.  Now he's on his own path and he has his dreams: to pay for his children's education, leave the business to his children, buy a home.  He has so many dreams into which he puts so much effort.  He already realized one dream, which was to have his own business.  Now he'll move on to the next one on his list.

Jof is requesting a loan to take care of his coffee fields.  He'll also invest some capital in buying soil amendments.

loans.use: to fertilize his coffee fields

loans.name: Swaleh

texts.en:
Swaleh lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and has five children of ages ranging from 28 to 10 years. Two attend school. 

He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, beans, and rice among other items. He gets additional income from riding a motorcycle for transport. 

He desires to grow and expand his business. However, his main challenge is inadequate capital and the high transportation costs due to the bad roads. He is seeking for credit to buy more maize to sell

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Wilson, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. He is 46 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and has four children.

Wilson is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Wilson says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. In addition, he will be purchasing a solar light, which will enable him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. Wilson will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of 11 solar lights, seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Koemheng's Group

texts.en:
Kimheng, age 47, is a farmer. Her primary source of income comes from growing and harvesting cassava and soybean crops. As a way of overcoming her family's hardship, she also works for others for a fee to supplement her income.

Kimheng and her husband live in the district of Kam Rieng in the province of Battambang. They have four children: two are grown, and two are school-going dependents. 

This is her second loan through Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has fully repaid her past loan. She now leads a group of two to obtain a new loan. She will spend her loan portion on seeds and fertilizers for her cassava field. 

Her goal is to expand her current business in order to attain a higher income, so that she can support her children in attending university.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cassava field

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Divina has operated her store for more than two years now. 

Divina is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and snack foods, among others. A loan will be used to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

n the future, Divina has hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and snack foods, among others

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a 41-year-old married man and a father of four children from Leyte, Philippines. 

He is engaged in retail sales of gasoline. Dennis also earns an additional income through providing sound system services through events in his place.

Dennis would like to take a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. In the future, Dennis hopes to expand his business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Mhay

texts.en:
Mhay is 53 years old and married with two children. 

Mhay is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Mhay requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mhay has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mhay would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Gregorio

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre del campo, humilde trabajador, entregado a su familia a su casa, gracias a su negocio de venta de cerdos, está actividad ha representado el progreso y la mejora de calidad de vida para los suyos, y en ella deposita sus esperanzas para seguir en pie de lucha y llevar cada día un alimento a su hogar.
Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de una cerda de cría, la razón es que la suya ya falleció por vejez y necesita una nueva.
Dicho préstamo será de gran ayuda para Luis, uno porque no dispone de todo el capital para comprarla y dos porque con la cerda no tiene que gastar tanto en compra de lechones.
texts.en:
Luis is a man from the countryside.  He is humble, hard-working, and committed to his family and household.  Thanks to his business of selling pigs, he has made progress and improved the quality of life for his family.  It is in his business that he places his hopes to continue struggling and to feed his household every day.

Luis wants to request a loan to buy a breeding sow.  The reason is that his died of old age, and he needs a new one.  The loan will be a big help to Luis.  One reason is because he does not have all of the money to buy one.  The second reason is that he does not have to spend so much buying piglets.

loans.use: to buy a breeding sow because the one he had died.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigles to stock her barn, because she only recently started her business and she has very few animals

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз 37 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Жылдыз - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 20 овец, 2 лошади,  а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,10 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдыз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота и корма. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zhyldyz is 37, married, and has four children. She has a secondary education and earns the main income for her family through livestock and crops. She started farming 16 years ago, and thanks to her hard work she currently has 3 cows, 20 sheep, 2 horses, and a 3.10 hectare plot of land where she plants beans. She earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Zyhldyz applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy sheep to increase her livestock headcount and feed for the animals. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale, as well feed for the livestock

loans.name: Deybis Manuel

texts.es:
Deybis es un hombre alegre, siempre sonriente y con buena disposición, colaborador, entregado a su familia y trabajo, padre de dos hijos, un campeón y una princesa, ambos menores de edad.
Como pueden observar en la foto se dedica a la cría de aves y es este negocio con el que ha sacado adelante su hogar y espera seguir haciéndolo.
Deybis quiere empezar a proyectarse, tener mayor número de gallinas y pollos para tratar de conseguir un contrato con alguna empresa para distribuir sus huevos y pollos criollos, es por esto que quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de 500 pollos y alimentos para ellos.
Con esta estrategia espera alcanzar su cometido y si logra tener dicho contrato representara un aumento en la calidad de vida de su familia muy considerable puesto que ya sus ventas serán fijas.
texts.en:
Deybis is a cheerful man who is always smiling, willing to help and devoted to his family and job. He has 2 minor children, a champion and a princess. As shown in the picture, he breeds birds to get ahead and support his household. He expects to keep doing so and to expand the business having a bigger number of hens and chickens. This way he could get a contract with a company to distribute its eggs and chicken. 

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of 500 chickens and food for them. He expects to meet his goal and to considerably increase the quality of life of his family thanks to the fixed sales.

loans.use: to buy 500 chickens.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 45 years old and married. She has four children. With three children currently in school, Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: M. Dilshad

texts.en:
M. Dilshad is a 28-year-old young and energetic boy living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his parents. He is not an educated person because he could not continue his studies due to to financial problems. He had been selling and getting experience from a laces selling shop. Now he has much experience about this business and has newly started his business with very low capital so he can generate enough income for his parents and sibling. Many tailors and the ladies of his town like to buy laces from his shop. His customers appreciate his collection and selection for its variety of laces.
 
Currently, he is interested in purchasing some of the latest variety of expensive laces and embroidered pieces of shirts to enhance his income, but finds it difficult due to financial constrains. 

Therefore, M. Dilshad has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy expensive laces, embroidered shirt pieces and additional items such as spools, paper cotton, buttons, packs of zippers, various colors of thread, etc. This will not only help him to grow his lace selling business, but will increase his net income and savings as well. 

He wants to provide education to his sibling because he wants to see the sibling be a literate person. For this purpose, more earnings are required. He hopes that the lenders will support him. He is very thankful to Kiva, the lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy expensive laces, embroidered shirt pieces and additional items, such as spools, paper cotton, buttons, packs of zippers, various colors of thread, etc.

loans.name: M. Shehbaz

texts.en:
M. Shehbaz is 39, living with his child and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
He has been running a mobile shop for three years and earning sufficient income. He troubleshoots mobile phones, sells mobile accessories such as chargers, bodies, data cables, etc. and provides recharge facilities for different networks.
 
Nowadays demand has increased for mobile accessories and for recharge, and sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he already has spent his all savings on household expenses.
 
Therefore, M. Shehbaz requested a loan so that he can be empowered to buy additional accessories and extra credit for the recharge facility. He thanks Kiva and to its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to purchase new mobile accessories and extra credit for recharging.

loans.name: Alfonso Miguel

texts.es:
Alfonso es un productor agrícola, dedicado cuerpo y alma al trabajo, es un separado pero que lucha perseverantemente para darle un mejor futuro a su hija, que ella no tenga que pasar por las necesidades que en una juventud le toco vivir Alfonso, pues para eso está él, para ayudarla dándole herramientas para que sea alguien en la vida, como lo es la posibilidad de estudiar.
Alfonso tiene como única obsesión que su hija estudie y que él pueda cubrir todas sus necesidades, por ello solicita un préstamo con el que impulsara su negocio, el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Alfonso is an agriculture producer.  He is devoted body and soul to his work.  He is separated, but he struggles persistently to give his daughter a better future so that she does not have to experience the times of need that Alfonso did during his youth.  That is why he is here to help her and give her tools, like the chance to go to school, to be successful in life.

Alfonso’s only obsession is for his daughter to go to school and that he is able to cover all of her necessities.  That is why he is requesting a loan, which will drive his business.  He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies to maintain his crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Rose  Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary, age 54 years, is married and has six children who all attend school at the moment. 

She is a farmer who grows tea as her main source of income. She started tea faming in 2003 from her local area of residence, Ryamugunguru Kyamuhunga, Bushenyi, and her clients are factories around Bushenyi.  

She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings) to buy fertilizer for her plantation. She wants to boost her business after getting the loan money. 

She is a hardworking and honest woman, working 10 hours a day and six days a week. She is faced with the challenge of poor weather like the dry season but has learnt to manage it. She is determined to boost her businesses and achieve her long-term dream of becoming financially stable and later buying a car. She really appreciates the Kiva support and partnership.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Elci Maria

texts.es:
Elci es una mujer de 39 años de edad que atiende un negocio de venta de abarrotes en la zona rural del Carmen del vivoral, es madre de 2 hijos y junto con su esposo trabaja con mucho empeño para darles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida.
Su propósito es convertirse en la mejor tienda de abarrotes de la zona y en un futuro poder construir un supermercado.
Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con abarrotes, refrescos y granos, para seguir progresando y demostrando que será en un futuro la mejor tienda del Carmen del vivoral.
texts.en:
Elci is a 39-year old woman who owns a grocery store in the rural area of Carmen del Vivoral. She has 2 children and works hard with her husband to provide them with a good quality of life. Her goal is make her store the best one in the area and to build a supermarket in the future. 

She is requesting a loan to stock her business with groceries, sodas and grains, so that she can keep improving and showing that it will become the best store in Carmen del Vivoral in the future.

loans.use: to buy sodas, grains and groceries to meet her goal of becoming the best store in Carmen del Vivoral.

loans.name: Ngome Group

texts.en:
Jamila, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children; one is still in school and the other one is still small. She has been running a grocery store since 2011. She works from 4 p.m. to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Jamila's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to renovate the grocery shop and also increased the drinks stock.  She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy the fast-moving drinks, like all types of beer, wines, sodas, water, etc., to meet the customers' demand. She dreams of taking her kids to good schools.  

Jamila will share this loan with her loan group, "Ngome," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast-moving drinks, like all types of beer, wines, sodas, water, etc., to meet the customers' demand.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven productor agrícola que durante su juventud se la paso trabajando mucho para juntar un ahorro y tener sus propias tierras ya que nos e veía empleado por otra persona, trabaja largas jornadas le pone mucho empeño a su cultivo y cuenta con un empleado.
Sueña con expandir sus cultivos, llegar a ser distribuidor de una plaza de mercado y en un futuro formar una familia sobre bases financieras firmes, pues no quiere traer hijos al mundo a aguantar hambre.
Solicita un préstamo que quiere invertir en insumos como gallinaza y fungicidas, abonos y riegos, con ellos protegerá y fertilizara sus campos, esperando una buena cosecha que signifiquen buenos ingresos y progreso
texts.en:
Jorge is a young agriculture producer.  He spent his youth working a lot in order to get together savings and to have his own land and not work for someone else.  He works long days, and he puts a lot of effort into his crops.  He has one employee.

He dreams of expanding his crops and becoming a distributor at a marketplace.  He dreams of creating a family with a strong financial foundation in the future.  He does not want to bring children who have to experience hunger into the world.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies like hen droppings, fungicides, compost, and irrigation.  With these he will protect and fertilize his fields.  He is hoping for a good harvest that means good earnings and progress.

loans.use: to buy supplies like hen droppings, fungicides, compost, and irrigation to protect his crops.

loans.name: Ana Hercilia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer soltera, muy pujante, luchadora, ella es madre cabeza de familia de una pequeña con tan solo 8 años de edad, ella oferta servicios de piscina en la zona de La Dorada, los niños y adultos se divierten y son felices, algo que es gratificante para ella.
Su negocio lo inicio por necesidad económica y busca siempre una mejora continua que le permita mantenerse en el mercado y generar sustento suficiente tanto para el mantenimiento de la piscina como para alimentar su familia y sostener su hogar.
Ella se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que lo quiere dividir en dos inversiones, la primera será para la adecuación de la piscina, arreglo en la bomba de agua, químicos, mangueras de agua, y la segunda parte por sugerencia de muchos clientes desea iniciar con la venta de comidas rápidas ya que divertirse en la piscina por un tiempo abre el apetito.
texts.en:
Ana is a single woman and mother to an 8-year old daughter. She works hard and fights offering pool services in La Dorada. Adults and children have fun, which is very fulfilling for her. She started her business for financial reasons and is always looking to make improvements so that she can stay in the market and support both the pool and her family. 

She is requesing a loan to make 2 separate investments. She will invest in improving the pool, repairing the water bomb, chemicals and the hose. Also, following the suggestion of many clients, she plans to start offering fast food, as playing in the pool for a while makes people hungry.

loans.use: to start selling food at her pool, so that clients can later enjoy some time in the water.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is 66 years old and has seven children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though David is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by seven farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

David started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

David’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. Even though David will not receive a solar light, a total of five solar lights will be received between the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Bovel district of Battambang province, Kimly is 45 years old and a mother of four dependent children, two of whom are studying in high school. To support her family conditions, she grows rice and raises two pigs as the main sources of income. To supplement the family income, she also works as a paid worker. 

This is her eighth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. As the group leader of two members, she will spend her loan portion to buy two pigs and pig feed and to rent farmland to grow rice. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and pig feed and to rent farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Katupyry, se formó en la ciudad de Lambaré, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que han puesto todo de sí para poder  ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y con ello poder ayudar a su familia.
 La Sra. Iginia, es una persona muy sacrificada, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, y con ello poco a poco va creciendo y teniendo los medios para poder  dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones. A través del  trabajo duro, las ganas de superación y el compromiso la Señora Iginia se va formando como una líder dentro de su comunidad siendo un ejemplo para el resto de las señoras de su comité y de su misma comunidad.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de gallinas ponedoras y con ello poder extender su producción de venta de huevos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry group was formed in the city of Lambaré. The members are very hard-working women who have focused all of their efforts on improving their life circumstances and thus helping their families. 

Iginia is a very self-sacrificing person who works raising animals. With this work, she has been expanding little by little and gaining the means to provide her family with a life in dignity and without deprivation. Through her hard work, her desire to get ahead, and her commitment, Señora Iginia has become a leader within her community and an example for the other women of her group and her community. 

She is requesting this loan to buy laying hens, and with this she will be able to expand her production and sale of eggs.

loans.use: to buy laying hens.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a 23-year-old woman and a mother of a 5-year-old child from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in a hog-raising business. 

For several years now, Donna has raised pigs to earn an income. As of this time, she is requesting to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. 

In the future, Donna has hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Tatiana Gissel

texts.es: Tatiana de 20 años de edad es una joven emprendedora que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, por lo que desde hace muchos años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, además vende prendas de vestir para aprovechar la clientela y de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Tatiana habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre, su abuela y su pequeño hermano de 6 años de edad. Tatiana es trabajadora y buscando la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: blusas, faldas, camisetas, productos de belleza, etc.
texts.en: Tatiana, 20 years old, is a young entrepreneur who always looks for the way to get head, for which for many years she has worked selling beauty products from a catalog. In addition, she sells clothing items to take advantage of the customer base and in this way get more income. Tatiana lives in her own house with her mother, grandmother and little brother, 6 years old. Tatiana is hard-working and, looking for a way to improve her quality of life and that of her family, has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in blouses, skirts, shirts, beauty products, etc.

loans.use: to invest in blouses, skirts, shirts, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer de 29 años de edad, ama de casa, dedicada a su esposo y su s dos hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad, que desea iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, una opción que opto por superación personal, por emplearse en alguna actividad, sentirse útil y demostrarle a su esposo e hijos que tienen una mujer en casa con  todas las capacidades para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
Su sueño es poder comprar una vivienda propia y ella más que nadie sabe que en su proyecto que es a largo plazo, pero está plantando los primeros pinitos, dando el primer paso para estar más cerca de este gran propósito que persigue.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas, comprar surtido de alimentos, implementos y comprara sillas, inicialmente estará afuera de su casa mientras se posesiona o encuentra un lugar más rentable para vender.
texts.en:
Leidy is a 29 year old housewife who is dedicated to her husband and two children aged 10 and 14. She wants to start a fast food business, something she decided on for her own improvement, to engage herself in an activity, to feel useful and to show her husband and children that they have a woman in the house with the capacity to get ahead and fulfill her dreams.

Her dream is to be able to buy her own house and she more than anyone knows it is a long term project. She is taking the first steps on the way to being closer to this goal that she pursues. She is requesting a loan to buy a fast food cart, and a supply of foods, tools and chairs. At the beginning it will be outside her house until she locates or owns a place that is more profitable.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart and an assortment of supplies, implements and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Darius

texts.en:
Darius is 30 years old. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 9 years; one of them goes to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing rice for the past 19 years. His wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who grow rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, bread products, flour, eggs and others.

loans.name: 24 De Septiembre Norte Group

texts.es:
Rufina es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 19 y 22 años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona central un lugar caracterizada por el comercio y manufactura en todos los rubros, donde; restaurantes, librerías, hoteles, mercados, oficinas, galerías, universidades, etc., conviven lado a lado, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 22 – 35 grados centígrados.
Rufina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, viste a la moda, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la derecha, usa blusa amarilla). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan, viven en un cuarto propio construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por abastecer las necesidades de su familia la impulsó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, taller mecánico, venta de ropa de segunda mano, salteñería, venta de cosméticos por catálogo, venta de chamarras y tienda de barrio, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la panadería. El olor a pan fresco domina el área, proviene de la panadería más popular del lugar, el suelo está lleno de cientos de panes y canastas; en el medio se distingue a la panadera, que muestra los recién horneados cuñapés que son elaboradas con harina de arroz, queso y manteca; “mi pasión por las pastas me ha hecho conocer con todo el barrio, mi siguiente meta es abrir un restaurante…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es constante al igual que los clientes, la desventaja es la distancia del lugar ya que debe viajar a comprar los ingredientes como harina y queso. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina como harina, arroz, fideo y otros para abrir un puesto de venta de comida y ampliar su panadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta labor de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Rufina solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de harinas para hornear e insumos de cocina para abrir un puesto de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Rufina is a 46-year old woman who lives with her partner, with whom she has 2 sons aged 19 and 22. She has a bakery and is a good mother, independent, constant, patient, responsible and hard-working. She works in the center of a place characterized for the trade and industry in all kind of jobs, where restaurants, book stores, hotels, markets, offices, galleries and universities live next to each other. The weather is tropical with a temperature that varies between 22 and 35 ºC. 

Rufina has dark skin, long and dark hair in a ponytale, dun eyes, short height and medium complexity. She follows fashion tendencies and her mother tongue is the Guaraní, which she speaks at home. She also speaks Spanish for general culture and for her business. She is one wearing yellow at the right side of the picture. 

She shares her life with her partner, who works in the same business, and with their children, who study and work. They live in their own house, made of brick and cement with a ceiling of corrugated iron. They have drinking water, electric power and sewage system. The need to cover their household expenses motivated her to create a group of people in different businesses: food sales, mechanic garage, second-hand clothing sales, cosmetic sales by catalogue, coat sales and grocery store, to request a loan and expand their activities. She has a bakery and the smell of fresh bread dominates the area. Hers is the most popular bakery in the area and the floor is full of bread and baskets. The baker shows the fresh "cuñapes", made of rice flour, cheese and butter. 

"My passion for the pastries has allowed me to meet everyone in the neighborhood. My next goal is to open a restaurant...", she says. The advantage of her business is that is constant, as well as her clients. The disadvantage is that she needs to go far away to buy ingredients, such as flour and cheese. Her dream is to open a restaurant and to buy ingredients, such as flour, rice, noodles and others to start a food stand and expand the bakery. 

This is her first loan with the institution in 10 years running the business. Rufina is requesing a loan to buy different types of flour to bake and ingredients for the food stand.

loans.use: to buy various types of baking flours and ingredients to open a food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and brick to build a bedroom on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, wood, wires, nails and metal sheets to build an adobe house.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José Abel de 29 años de edad, es originario de  Managua, casado con un hijo menor de seis años de edad,  el cual está estudiando, este hombre se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo  estudiar, en la actualidad lucha para sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de madera desde hace tres años el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El dedica a dicha actividad una ochos horas diarias para mantener y aumenta su clientela y sus ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es compra madera el cual se la están ofreciendo a buen precio como pochote, pino, cedros, etc. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Y poder ayudarlo a cumplir sus sueños y metas como es formar a sus hijos y terminar de hacerle mejoras de su casa. José Abel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
José Abel, 29 years old, is from Managua, married with a young son, six years old, who is going to school. This man is characterized as being hard-working, responsible, with desire to improve himself. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources, he couldn't go to school. Currently, he is struggling to get his business and his family ahead.

Thanks to his desire to get ahead, he has worked selling wood for three years. His business is located in his house. He works at this job for eight hours each day to maintain and expand his customer base and his income. The objective for the loan is to purchase wood which is being offered at a good price such as pochote, pine, cedar, etc. so that in the not-so-distant future, he can get more income and be able to help realize his dreams and goals such as educate his children and finish making improvements to his house. José Abel is grateful for the help of the Kiva investors who offer people with limited resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua a means of having respectable work.

loans.use: to buy and sell wood such as pine, cedar, pochote, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. 

She has had a school business for five years which has been flourishing. 

She will be using the loan to purchase school furniture and office supplies and hopes this will help her expand the school. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and provide a better life for them.

loans.use: to purchase school furniture and office supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Maribeth is engaged in a pig raising business. 

Maribeth is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. 

A loan will help her improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ricardina se sigue dedicando al trabajo de una empresa de comunicaciones, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este trabajo, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of "Amanecer 15 de agosto" group. The group is located in the district of Santa Ana, province of La Convención, department of Cusco. 

Ricardina works in a communications company from 8am to 7pm. She has been in this business for several years and is her way to support her family. She is grateful for the loan and commits to making the payments as scheduled. She is requesting the loan to buy a TV for her house.

loans.use: to buy a TV for her house.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 49-year-old businesswoman from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in a retail business. She has been running a small sari-sari or grocery store in her place for more than 15 years now. 

For now Editha needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, condiments and cooking oil, bread and snack foods.   

In the future, Editha hopes of making her business a success.
