loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, condiments and cooking oil, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Hernándo Emilio

texts.es:
Hernando es un productor agrícola de 58 años de edad quien lleva prácticamente toda su vida ejerciendo está profesión, es padre de 4 hijos y aspira que en un futuro alguno de ellos continúe esta tradición familiar a la cual le agradece pues le ha permitido generar el sustento para toda su familia.
su deseo es generar una mejora continua, que su negocio crezca, sea más reconocido, compita en los grandes mercados y que valga la pena el esfuerzo, empeño y amor que coloca en sus actividades.
Hernando quiere solicitar un préstamo para proteger y abonar sus flores, y quiere que le ayudes, tu prestado significara progreso, mejora, compromiso de parte de Hernando pues está ayuda la aprovechara en lo máximo para sacar su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Hernando is a farmer, 58 years old, who has spent practically his entire life working in this profession. He is the father of 4 children and hopes that in the future one of them will continue this family tradition to which he is grateful since it has allowed him to generate the sustenance for his whole family. 

His desire is to generate continuous improvement, that his business grows, is more well-known, competes in the big markets, and is worth the effort, dedication and love which he places in his work. 

Hernando wants to ask for a loan to protect and fertilize his flowers, and wants you to help him. Your loan will mean progress, improvement, and commitment on the part of Hernando since he will take maximum advantage of this help to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to protect and fertilize his fields; he is a client who has completely paid off two loans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 37 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 4 and 15 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 19 years. His wife is a farmer. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for growing rice.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who grow rice.

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Joshua, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to three children, known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Joshua joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Joshua plans to buy a cow.

Between the 15 farmers in Joshua's Group, a total of 7.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer, given that some members of the group will be purchasing a solar light, so a total of 10 solar lights will also be  received with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Chhiengmai's Group

texts.en:
Chhiengmai, 30, lives with her family in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is a mother of one kid who is still in school. 

She struggles for a living via working as a tailor. She has been involved in this business for five years. This is her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she fully repaid her past loans. 

In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to repair her sewing machine and to buy some sewing materials for supporting her business. 

She hopes that she can expand her current business to earn more income.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine and to buy some sewing materials for supporting her business

loans.name: M. Jibran

texts.en:
M. Jibran lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his wife. He owns a small jewelry shop in which he sells artificial jewelry such as bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings and earrings. He makes golden jewelry on demand also. Global gold prices have been increased, so the customers are more likely to buy artificial jewelry than gold jewelry. But most of the rich people give him orders sometimes to make gold jewelry. 

This situation has happened often recently. He has taken an order to make gold jewelry, and the customer given some cash in advance, too. But he still cannot purchase gold due to his poor financial capacity.
 
Therefore, M. Jibran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan to buy the gold and fulfill the order within the specified duration. With the help of his profits, he will buy artificial jewelry for his shop to sell. 

He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy gold, fulfill the order and generate more profit than before.

M. Jibran is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase gold to make jewelry.

loans.name: M. Waqas

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is named M. Waqas; he is 30 years old and living in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for many years near his house and the business is operating very well. In this way he is feeding his old parents and sibling.

He has been running a small general store for five years; he established a general store with the help of his father. His shop is situated in a populated area, and there are a lot of customers available here to buy miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in routine. He wants to offer stationery items such as copies, pencils, pens, lead pencils, erasers, etc. But the major problem is the shortage of funds. 

Therefore, M. Waqas requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy the sacks of rice, sugar, flour, and additional stationery items. He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

M. Waqas is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and he assures that he will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, flour, and additional stationery items.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 35, is married with 2 children who are 2 and 4 years old. 

He is a subsistence agriculturalist but also does retail business from his village in Nyakahita, Bushenyi, where his clients are all categories of people. He started his business to be able to generate income for his family. He works 8 hours a day in order to maximize profit. 

He has applied for a loan of two million shillings (UGX 2,000,000) to buy more stock of corn flour, rice, sugar, soap, beverages, and bread among other items to sell in his business.  He is faced with a challenge of limited working capital but hopes to get it sorted after getting a loan. He is an honest man and determined to continue working hard to achieve his long-term dream of building a house. 

He is optimistic that with the continuous support from UGAFODE, his dream will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe y Esperanza están en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las personas que se destaca es la Sra. Nélida, quien hace comestibles para poder vender.
Ella comenta que todos los días empieza su trabajo muy temprano, se levanta para poder hacer sus comidas y después salir a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien solicita este préstamo para la compra de variedad y más cantidad de materiales  para la elaboración de los comestibles, como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas, y otros, que le será útil para poder seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Fe y Esperanza group is in its sixth loan cycle in the women's committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are part of the poverty elimination program where one of the people who stands out is Nélida who makes meals to sell. 

She says that every day she begins her work very early, she gets up to prepare the dishes and later goes out to sell them as a street vendor. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person who asks for this loan to purchase a variety and more quantity of ingredients to make her foods such as meat, seasonings, vegetables, and more, which will be useful to her to be able to continue working and struggling as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase meat, seasonings, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph comes from a small rural location in Kericho area of Kenya which is known for tea farming. Joseph practices crop farming. He spends most of his time of the day in the field tending to his garden. 

Joseph is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle. He made up his mind to buy a motorcycle after years of struggling to transport his produce to the market. The poor condition of roads in rural areas like where Joseph is from limits the trade potential. Farmers have resorted to acquiring the very reasonably priced Indian motorcycles that seem to operate just fine even in areas impassable by vehicles.  

The impact of your loan to Joseph and his family is improved livelihood. The motorcycle will make the transportation of goods to and from market centers very easy for Joseph, a change that will only improve his trade. He will also make more income by using the motorcycle to offer transportation services to other members of the community.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle

loans.name: Wavousse Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALFO est responsable du groupe WAVOUSSE. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 02an. 01 va à l’école. Il a 08personnes en charge.
Mr est cultivateur et fait le jardinage depuis 11ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier.
Il veut s’acheter  04boites de pépinière et 10sacs d’engrais.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne bien construire sa cour.
texts.en:
Salfo is the leader of the Wavousse Group.  He is married and has five children.  The eldest is fifteen years old and the youngest is two years old.  One of his children currently attends school.  Salfo is responsible for a total of eight people.

Salfo has been growing vegetables for eleven years.  He buys his supplies locally.  He plans to use his loan to buy boxes of seed and sacks of fertilizer for his business.

His profits will be reinvested in his business.  Salfo dreams of building his own home one day.

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of onion seed and 5 sacks of fertilizer for his vegetable growing business.

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristhian tiene 34 años, está casado hace 12 años con la señora Elvira con quien tiene un hijo pequeño que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido creciendo.
El señor Cristhian es mecánico de vehículo desde hace 5 años, anteriormente trabajaba como empleado, luego se independizo para tener su propio taller.
El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para poder utilizarlos en su taller, y con ello poder seguir ofreciendo un buen trabajo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristhian is 34 years old, married for 12 years to Elvira, with whom he has a small boy who, with great sacrifice and effort, he has been managing to raise.

Cristhian has been a car mechanic for 5 years. Previously he worked as an employee, later he became independent to have his own shop.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of spare parts to use them in his shop, and with this be able to continue offering good work to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to use in his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store, satisfy her customers and increase her sales.

loans.name: Youtenga Group

texts.fr:
Mr YACOUBA est responsable du groupe YOUTENGA. Marié, il est père de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 01an 08 mois. 05 vont à l’école et il a 12personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 30ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 10 moutons.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et acheter une  parcelle.
texts.en: Mr. Yacouba is the leader of the group Youtenga.  Married, he is the father of 8 children.  The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 1 year and 8 months old.  5 of his children go to school and he is responsible for 12 people.  He has been raising animals for 30 years.  He supplies the surrounding markets.  With the money from this loan, he can buy 10 sheep.  He wants to use the profits to reinvest in his activity.  His ambition is to extend the limits of his activity and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Badnogo Group

texts.fr:
Mr MAHAMOUDOU est responsable du groupe BADNOGO. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé de 20ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 04vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 2008. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
Il veut s’acheter 10moutons.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices il veut bien s’occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne payer une moto pour sa femme.
texts.en:
Mr. MAHAMOUDOU is the official of the group BADNOGO. Married, he is the father of five children. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 7. Four of them go to school. He has seven persons to support. 

Mr. MAHAMOUDOU has been raising livestock since 2008. He gets his supplies from the market in his district. He wants to purchase 10 sheep. He wants to use the profits to do a good job caring for his family. His ambition is to pay for a motorbike for his wife.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Linoghin Group

texts.fr:
Mr ABDOULAYE est responsable du groupe LINOGHIN. Marié, il est père de 11 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 04 vont à l’école et il a 19 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de  l’élevage  depuis 20 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 moutons.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour  réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et bien construire sa cour.
texts.en: Mr. Abdoulaye is the leader of the group LINOGHIN.  Married, he is the father of 11 children.  The oldest is 28 and the youngest is 3.  4 of them go to school and he is in charge of 19 people.  He has been raising animals for 20 years.  He supplies nearby markets.  With this loan he can buy 5 sheep.  He wants to use the profits of the loan to reinvest in his activity.  His ambition is to educate his children and build a his courtyard.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep

loans.name: Pengdwende Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SOULEYMANE est responsable du groupe PENGDWENDE.  Marié, il est père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans.  01 va à l’école et il a 05 personnes en charge.
Mr fait du jardinage  depuis 07 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 100 m de grillage et 04 sacs d’engrais.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire sa cour.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane is in charge of the Pengdwende group. He is married and the father of three children. The oldest is eleven and the youngest is seven years old. One of them attends school and he has five persons under his care.

He has been a gardener for the past seven years, and resupplies in surrounding markets. With the money granted, he will buy 100 meters of wire mesh and four bags of fertilizer.

He wants to reinvest the proceeds of the loan in his business, and aims to educate his children and build up his courtyard.

loans.use: buy 100 meters of wire mesh and four bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Tavousse Group

texts.fr:
Mr HATO est responsable du groupe TAVOUSSE. Marié, il est père de 8 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26 ans et le moins âgé a 13 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 10 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne construire sa cour et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Hato is the representative of the Tavousse group. He is married and the father of eight. His eldest child is 26 years old, and his youngest is 13 years old. Four of his children are in school; he has 10 dependents in total.

Hato has been raising livestock for 10 years. He stocks up at the nearby markets. He plans to use his loan to buy four sheep. He would like to use the revenue from his loan to reinvest in his business. His goal is to build a home and provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy four sheep.

loans.name: Laongtaore Group

texts.fr:
Mr  KARIM est responsable du groupe LAONGTAORE. Marié, il est père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 05 vont à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de  l’élevage  depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 moutons.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour s’occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et payer une moto pour sa femme.
texts.en:
Mr. Karim is in charge of the Laongtaore group. He is married and the father of five children. The oldest is 25 and the youngest is seven years old. Five of the children attend school and he has four persons under his care.

He has been raising livestock for the past ten years, and restocks in surrounding markets. With the money granted, he plans to buy five sheep.

He wants to use the proceeds of the loan to take care of his family, and aims to educate his children and buy a motorcycle for his wife.

loans.use: buy five sheep

loans.name: Nahartenga Group

texts.fr:
Mr IDRISSA ZAKARIE est responsable du groupe NAHARTENGA. Marié, il est père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24 ans et le moins âgé a 10 ans .06 vont à l’école et il a 09 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de  l’élevage  depuis 07 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 07 moutons.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour s’occuper de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants. Il ambitionne pour  bien construire sa cour et payer une moto pour sa femme.
texts.en:
Mr Idrissa Zakarie is in charge of the Nahartenga group. He is married and the father of six children. The oldest is 24 and the youngest is ten years old. Six of them attend school and he has nine persons to care for.

He has been raising livestock for the past seven years, and restocks in surrounding markets. With the money granted, he plans to buy seven sheep.

He wants to use the proceeds of the loan to take care of his family and see to his children's education. He aims to fully build up his courtyard and buy a motorcycle for his wife.

loans.use: buy seven sheep

loans.name: Toghin Bangre Group

texts.fr:
Mr SOULEYMANE est responsable du groupe TOGHIN BANGRE. Marié, il est père de 15 enfants. Le plus âgé à 21 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 05 vont à l’école et il a 19 personnes en charge.
Mr fait du maraichage  depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 sacs d’engrais.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour  réinvestir dans son activité  et  payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et bien construire sa cour.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane is in charge of the Toghin Bangre group. He is the married father of 15 children. The oldest is 21 and the youngest is four years old. Five of them attend school and he has 19 persons under his care.

He has been crop farming for the past 15 years, and resupplies in surrounding markets. With the money granted, he plans to buy five bags of fertilizer.

He wants to use the proceeds of the loan to reinvest in his business and pay tuition fees for his children. He aims to extend the boundaries of his activity and build up his courtyard.

loans.use: buy five bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Kolokom Group

texts.fr:
Mr NOUFOU est responsable du groupe KOLOKOM.  Marié, il est père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11 ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans.  02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 07 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur, afin  d’aider sa femme à créer un commerce pour mieux  s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Noufou is in charge of the Kolokom group. He is married and the father of three children. The oldest is eleven and the youngest is six years old. Two of the children go to school and he has four persons under his care.

He has been raising livestock for the past seven years, and restocks in surrounding markets. With the money granted, he plans to buy five sheep.

He wants to use the proceeds of the loan to reinvest in his business. He aims to become a great livestock breeder, to help his wife create a business and take better care of their children.

loans.use: buy five sheep

loans.name: Nagreonkoudogo Group

texts.fr:
Mr ABDOULAYE est responsable du groupe NAGREONKOUDOGO. Marié, il est père de 15 enfants. Le plus âgé a 34 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. 06 vont à l’école et il a 13 personnes en charge.
Mr est jardinier et cultivateur  depuis 09 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 02 kg de semences  d’oignons et 02 sacs d’engrais.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour s’occuper de la santé de sa famille,  de la scolarité de ses enfants  et aussi réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne agrandir  son activité et  mieux s’occuper de ses enfants  en assurant leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye is in charge of the Nagreonkoudogo group. He is married and the father of 15 children. The oldest is 34 and the youngest is eight years old. Six of them attend school and he has 13 persons under his care.

He has been a gardener and crop farmer for the past nine years, and resupplies in surrounding markets. With the money granted, he plans to buy two kilos of onion seeds and two bags of fertilizer.

He wants to use the proceeds of the loan to take care of his family's health, his children's education and also reinvest in his business. He aims to expand his business and take better care of his children by ensuring their education.

loans.use: buy two kilos of onion seeds and two bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 8 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 17 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta y compra de chatarra.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, dedicada, decidida, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas de clima templado, con una temperatura que varía durante el año entre 14-24 grados centígrados todo el año.
Catalina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es el comercio de chatarra, ella se encarga de comprar motores y repuestos en desuso para ofertarlos a talleres mecánicos y a clientes particulares, cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo dónde expone algunos motores. “aprendí esta actividad por la necesidad de las personas de comprar repuestos baratos, yo los compro de autos en desuso y los oferto…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que conoce los motores y tiene experiencia en el negocio, la desventaja es la competencia porque se encuentra en una zona comercial. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de motores y partes de automóvil en desuso para ofertarlos a mecánicos y generar mejores ingresos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en la institución en 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Catalina solicita un préstamo para la compra de motores y chatarra para ofertarla a talleres mecánicos y mejorar sus ventas
texts.en:
Catalina is a 38-year old woman who lives with her partner and children, one 8-year old son and 2 daughters aged 17 and 14. She works buying and selling scrap. She is a good mother, patient, delicate, decided, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the South area of the city, an area characterized for the trade business and industry in different fields. The weather is mild with temperatures between 14 and 24 ºC. 

Catalina has dark skin, long dark hair in a pony tail, dun eyes, short height and robust complexity. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which she speaks at home. She speaks Spanish for general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in transportation, and with her children, who attend school. They live in their own house, made of brick and cement with ceiling of corrugated iron. They have water from a well and electric power. At her business, she buys engines and replacepartns in disuse to offer them to mechanic garages and individuals. She has a fixed stand where she shows some of the engines. "I learned this activity after realizing people needed cheap replacement parts; I buy them from cars in disuse and offer them", she says. Her advantage is that she knows the engines well and has experience. Her disadvantage is that there is a lot of competition in the area. 

Her dream is to expand the business. She wants to buy engines and car parts in disuse to offer them to mechanics and increase her income. This is her first loan with the institution in 13 years in the business. 

This is why Cataina is requesting a loan to buy engines and scrap to offer them to garages and to increase sales

loans.use: to buy engines and scrap to offer them to mechanic garages and improve her sales.

loans.name: Bety Azucena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Bety Azucena se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of "Amanecer 15 de agosto", located in the district of Santa Ana, province of La Convención, department of Cusco. 

Bety Azucena does craftwork and sells fabric, sweaters, blankets and drapes. She works from 8am to 7pm and has successfully been in the business for 8 years. Her dream is to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, sweaters and drapes. She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her payment obligations as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters and drapes.

loans.name: Emprendedores Del 12 Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “EMPRENDEDORES DEL 12” una de ellas es la Sra. Flor de 32 años soltera y con 2 hijos, la Sra. Flor  se dedica ya hace 3 años a ser Ventas de Ropa en un pequeño local  todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Flor ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Flor trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería (Telas, Hilos, Lana, ETC) y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Flor se encuentra sentada y se le distingue con un polo de rayas con blanco, se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en: This is a group made up of 6 responsible people who have different businesses; they are members of the communal bank group "Emprendedores del 12." One of them is Flor, 32 years old, single, with 2 children. Flor has worked for three years selling clothing in a small retail space every day with the achievement of getting ahead and in this way being able to pay for her children's schooling. With the fruit of her efforts, Flor has managed to improve her house and support her children's education. With the granted loan, she will invest in purchasing more merchandise (fabric, thread, wool, etc.) and be able to have more income. While Flor is found seated and is distinguished by her white and striped shirt, she leaves Kiva and Edaprospo with a hug and is grateful for the offered loan since it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread, wool.

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.ru: Толгонай, 23 года, замужем, детей нет. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Толгонай имеет в хозяйстве корову, 10 овец. На земельном участке мерою 1,00 Га она выращивает экологически-чистую фасоль. Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Толгонай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку топлива и удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания органической фасоли. Доходы от кредита Толгонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Tolgonai is 23, married, and does not have children. She started raising livestock and planting crops in order to earn the main income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, Tolgonai currently has ten sheep. She plants organic beans on a 1.00 hectare plot of land. Having concluded that her business is profitable, Tolgonai applied for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy fuel and fertilizers for growing organic beans. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fuel to cultivate her land and grow organic beans

loans.name: Nagreongo Group

texts.fr:
Mr RACHID est responsable du groupe NAGREONGO. Marié sans enfant.  Il  a 05 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de  l’élevage  depuis 03 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 moutons.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour  réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. RACHID is the official of the group NAGREONGO. Married and without children, he has five persons to support. Mr. RACHID has been raising livestock for three years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. 

With the money granted, he intends to purchase 5 sheep. He wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to expand his commerce.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sheep

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia hoy tiene una despensa en la que trabaja ayudada por su familia, es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora que esta trabajando arduamente para poder crecer y salir adelante. Ella comenta que con su préstamo anterior ha podido surtir su negocio y dar a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.
Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día. Ella hoy pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, hortalizas, bebidas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Eulogia has a grocery store where she works helped by her family. She is an entrepreneur and works hard to grow and get ahead. She says her previous loan helped her to stock the business and provide her clients with a good variety of products. 

She is grateful for the opportunity to improve each day. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks and others, so that she can maintain her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks and others.

loans.name: Maria Melfy

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 5 años, y su negocio es la elaboración de postres.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, activa, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ de la ciudad, caracterizada porque los habitantes son migrantes de tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente que se apropiaron del lugar y la siguiente descendencia generó la manufactura y el comercio en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-32 grados centígrados.
María es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que efectúa. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como cerrajero y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de postres, como; helados tipo bolo, gelatina de diferentes sabores, flan, y otros. “inicie mi actividad realizando una mínima inversión y con los beneficios que obtuve fui invirtiendo en mi negocio y ampliando mis productos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es el clima del lugar hace que las ventas sean altas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para diversificar los productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio amplio y reconocido para vender por mayor, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una congeladora para ofrecer nuevos productos y generar mejores ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora para producir mayor cantidad de postres y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old and lives with her spouse. She has 3 children aged 12, 10 and 5 years old. Her business is making desserts. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, active, consistent, responsible and hard-working.

She does her business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood of the city. The inhabitants are immigrants of the Ayorea native tribes of the area and miners relocated from the West who settled in the area and their decedents generated the manufacturing and commerce of all types. The climate is hot, tropical and very humid with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 to 32 degrees Celsius.

Maria is dark-skinned, with dark eyes, long black hair that she ties back, is short in stature and robust in build. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks in her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her husband who works as a metal worker and her children who study in school. They live in a room that they built themselves of brick and cement with a metal roof. It has running water, electricity and sewage.

Her business is making and selling desserts like ice-cream and different flavors of jello, flan, etc. "I started my business with a minimum investment and kept investing my profits in my business and expanding my products" she comments. Her advantage is that the climate makes her sales higher, her disadvantage is the lack of capital to diversify her product. Her dream is to have a large and well-known business in order to sell wholesale.

She wants to expand her business by buying a freezer to offer new products and to generate greater sales. This is her first loan with the institution in the 3 years she has been involved in this activity. For these reasons Maria is requesting a loan to buy a freezer to produce a greater quantity of desserts and sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to make a greater quantity of desserts and sell wholesale.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 31 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. По характеру Нургул очень трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 1 корову, а также на земельном наделе мерою 1,20 ГА, она выращивает фасоль. Нургул получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 8,000 сом (KGS). Она хочет развить свой бизнес, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для полеводства. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Nurgul is 31, married, and the mother of four children. She is very hardworking and responsible by nature. She plants crops and raises livestock as the main source of income for her family. She has a developed farm with one cow and 1.2 hectare plot of land where she grows beans. Nurgul earns around 8,000 som (KGS) per month. She wants to expand her business, so she applied for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers for the land. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in expanding her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow eco-friendly beans

loans.name: Isla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, es mixto está conformado por un hombre y 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Prudencia, José Roberto, Erika Roxana), de la etnia miskita que viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Prudencia y José Roberto vende ropa, Erika Roxana vende refrescos y pescados. Las tres se han propuesto luchar para hacer crecer sus negocios, con el deseo de llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida personal y de sus familias; se organizaron hace 6 meses para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

José Roberto: Es integrante del grupo solidario. Es un de joven 23 años de edad con deseos de superación, casado. Su esposa es comerciante. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal desde hace 5 años vende en su tramo en uno de los mercados de Bilwi ropa nueva, con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Solicita  financiamiento para comprar en Managua: pantalones para damas y caballeros, blusas, camisetas, faldas, vestidos, entre otros productos, venderlos a precios favorable a su clientela de Bilwi y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es ser un comerciante exitoso.

Con el primer crédito recibido de Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le permitió a Prudencia coordinadora del grupo solidario, comprar ropa y calzado, mejorar su nivel de ingreso y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of one man and two resourceful ladies (Prudencia, José Roberto and Erika Roxana), who belong to the Miskita ethnic group and live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Prudencia and José Roberto sell clothing, Erika Roxana sells soft drinks and fish. The three of them have proposed to fight to expand their businesses, fueled by the desire for a better quality of life for them and their families. They organised the group six months ago in order to access the loan through a solidarity guarantee from Pana Pana.

José Roberto is one of the members of this solidarity group. He is a 23 year old young married man with the desire to improve himself. His spouse is a
shopkeeper. Due to the lack of formal employment, for the last 5 years he has been selling new clothing from a stall in one of the Bilwi markets, in order to have his own source of income to contribute to the household costs. He is requesting this loan to buy clothing from Managua, including both ladies and mens trousers, blouses, t-shirts, skirts and dresses, to then sell at favorable prices to his customers in Bilwi and through this increase his income. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

This first loan from Pana Pana, financed by Kiva, has allowed Prudencia, coordinator of the solidarity group, to buy clothing and shoes, to increase her level of income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing from Managua, including both ladies and mens trousers, blouses, t-shirts, skirts and dresses

loans.name: Jorgina Berta

texts.es:
Jorgina, madre soltera con cinco hijos mayores de edad e independiente económicamente, es originaria de Managua,  mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación, lamentablemente no pudo estudiar y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como ropa de adultos y niños, pantalones, shores, faldas vestidos, pijamas, ropa interior, carteras, perfumes,  el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y también de forma ambulante y por encargo. El objetivo es surtir y aprovechar la temporada de semana santa donde las ventas aumentan,  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jorgina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Jorgina is a single mother of 5 children. She is financially independent and is a native of Managua. She is a hard-working and responsible woman with the desire to excel. Unfortunately she could not study and had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses. Thanks to her desire to get ahead she has a business selling merchandise in general like clothing for adults and children, pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, pajamas, underwear, purses and perfume. Her business is at her house and she also sell itinerantly and by order. Her objective is to stock up and take advantage of Easter week when sales increase so that in the near future she can have higher income. Jorgina is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders for people of low resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, perfumes, purses and underwear.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad y le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. Ella se gana la vida desde hace 30 años vendiendo desayunos en el mercado central actividad en la que se ha apoyado para sacar adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera. María desea mejorar el pequeño local en el cual prepara y vende sus productos, además desea vender almuerzos para obtener mejores ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, azulejos, etc. para remodelar el local en el que se gana la vida desde hace tantos años.
texts.en:
49-year old María lives in her own house together with her adult children who contribute to household expenses. She has earned her living for 30 years selling breakfasts in the central market, a job that has enabled her to help her family get ahead as she is a single mother. 

María wants to improve the place where she prepares and sells the breakfasts. She also wants to expand into providing lunches too to earn more money. She is therefore seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, tiles etc. to remodel the premises where she has earned her living for so many years.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, gravel, tiles etc

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Fredy se dedica al negocio de venta de vidrios, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de vidrios. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar vidrios.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Fredy is a member of the Amanecer August 15 Community Bank located in the Santa Ana District, a part of La Concención Province in the department of Cusco.

Fredy earns his living selling glass. Now he wishes to get ahead by fulfilling his dream of expanding his business. He is seeking a loan to buy more glass.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: buy more glass

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Doris se sigue dedicando negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is a member of the Amanecer August 15 Community Bank located in the Santa Ana District, a part of La Concención Province in the department of Cusco.

She is continuing to earn her living growing fruit. In her fields she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins, and oranges. She works from 6 am to 5 pm on her land, a job she has had for several years. Doris is seeking a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothes, incense, and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a 35-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. Marites runs a small computer shop. This has been her source of income for more than two years now. Marites is asking for a loan to buy more computers for her shop. Marites believes that through a loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more computers for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en: Maridel is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her food vending business, selling home-cooked foods to the people in her area. Maridel has been in business for more than 2 years. She would like to take a loan to buy more ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, rice, etc. The loan will allow her to cook more and sell more to her customers. In the future, Maridel hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, rice, etc.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
Las 17 mujeres son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, se inspiran en poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no han podido tener. Cada una está trabajando en emprendimientos que les ayuda en mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Flora, una de las integrantes, se siente agradecida y promete esforzarse cada día para que todo salga bien. Ella se dedica a vender bebidas varias que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha podido emprender y con ello ayuda a su familia.
Tanto la Sra. Flora como las demás compañeras integrantes del grupo están constantemente incentivadas para que sean verdaderamente mujeres emprendedoras con ganas de trabajar y superar la pobreza. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias para la venta, y con ello poder seguir con su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
These 17 women are very hard-working and determined. They are inspired to improve their living conditions and to give their loved ones everything that they have not been able to have. Every woman is working on a business that helps her improve every day. 

Flora, one of the members, feels grateful and promises to make an effort every day so that everything goes well. She makes a living selling a variety of beverages. With great sacrifice and effort, she has been able to take on this job and, with it, to help her family.

Flora and the other members of this group are constantly encouraged to be entrepreneurial women who are truly willing to work and overcome poverty. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of beverages for sale. With this loan, she will be able to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in garments and beauty products for her catalogue sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy make-up, crèmes, shampoo, lotions, deodorants, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in his grocery store by acquiring basic products to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She is 54 years old, married and has two children. Mila has operated her sari-sari store for more than 15 years now. This is her source of income. Mila is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, cooking oil, condiments, soap and detergents, candies, bread and snack foods. Mila believes that a loan will help her improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, cooking oil, condiments, soap and detergents, candies, bread and snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and materials for the shop

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 51 años, es soltero, sin carga familiar, es conocido en el medio por su labor de servicio de fotocopiado y tipeos. Vive en casa propia con su madre, quien percibe una pensión de jubilación de viudez y hermano que se acaba de jubilar. Oswaldo cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, él vive en una comunidad ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú, dicha comunidad cuenta con un clima cálido y con gente muy amigable, y su población en su mayoría se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Oswaldo se dedica a prestar servicio de fotocopiado y tipeos en computadora, desde hace más de 14 años, cuenta con experiencia en este sector y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de útiles de oficina ya que desea implementar el servicio que ofrece con la venta de útiles para generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y con ello podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
51-year old Oswaldo is single and has no family responsibilities. He is known in the area for his photocopying and typing services.He lives in his own house with his mother, who receives a widow's retirement pension and a brother who recently retired. Oswaldo has good references from his neighbors. He lives in a community located 45 km from Chiclayo, in Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. This community has a warm climate and very friendly people; the majority of the population works in trade, agriculture, and animal husbandry.

Oswaldo has worked providing photocopying and computer typing services for over 14 years so he has lots of experience. The loan will be used to purchase office supplies since he wants to start a service that sells supplies to generate more income, better profits and, with that, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase office supplies since he wants to start a service that sells supplies

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 35 years old. He is married with two children. He has had a retail clothing business for five years. He will be using the loan to purchase bales of clothes that he hopes will help him to expand his shop and pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his clothing shop.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a 38-year-old resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Crisanto, who is a driver. They manage their household while operating the business. They work hard for their children to provide income for their everyday needs.

Rosanna maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct sales brands such as Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk and others. Customers' orders are bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customers with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers’ prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Rosanna's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every week.

To help Rosanna continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She will also buy more frozen food which she also sells.

Rosanna aims to have her own stall for her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional direct sales products and frozen food needed in her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 57 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Zenaida has a general store business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Zenaida has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fenehansi

texts.en:
Fenehansi, aged 31, is married and has 3 children. The family lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Fenehansi operates a sewing workshop, mainly making clothes such as dresses, trousers and school uniforms. He earns additional income from his cocoa garden. 

Fenehansi started the business to raise income for his family and to pay school fees for the children. His main challenges are the limited power supply and the high cost of cloth materials. Fenehansi wants to construct a permanent standard house in the future. He has asked for a loan to buy building materials such as stones, iron bars and sand, to build his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as stones, iron bars and sand, to build his house.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet James, a progressive smallholder mixed-farmer from the Kaspul location in the Nyamira area of Kenya. James heads a family that consists of his wife, Kesia, and 6 children. He owns a 1-acre piece of land where his home is located. On the farm, he also has poultry, goats and a garden filled with maize crops. Apart from farming, James, who is a pensioner, also makes money from his carpentry skills. 

This year, James is on a mission to grow and diversify his business. He is seeking a loan to pay for a grain milling machine. The market demand for flour is huge. Most end consumers choose flour, as opposed to grains, because flour assumes a form that can be used to prepare a wide variety of meals. With your loan, James will use the grain mill to process his grain and offer the same service to other farmers at an affordable fee. Income from the grain mill will be used by James to service the loan and ultimately improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy a grain milling machine

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru: Рахат успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Рахат на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы, на ежедневной основе она продает молоко. Основной деятельностью ее семьи стало полеводство. На 1,20 Га земли она выращивает фасоль и клевер. Ее развитое хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и вспашки земли. Доходы от кредита Рахат вложит в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Rakhat successfully repaid her loan, having used it as was intended. She is grateful to Kiva for helping her with financing. She currently owns two cows, and sells milk on a daily basis. Farming has become her family's primary activity. She raises beans and clover on 1.20 hectares. The business she has developed earns a monthly income of around 6,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop the business, Rakhat is again requesting a 30,000 som (KGS) loan from Bai-Tushum bank to buy fertilizer and till the land. Rakhat plans to invest earnings from use of the loan into home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel to cultivate her land and to grow eco-friendly beans and clover

loans.name: Simoeurn's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Simoeurn is 45 years old and the father of two dependent children, one in high school and the other too young to attend school. For a living, he grows rice as the main source of income. This is his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader of two members, he will spend his loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support his rice farm. He hopes that he can improve his rice farm to get more yields to update his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support his rice farm

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is a 32-year-old married mother living in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has three dependent children.  To support her family, Chantha works for others for a fee. She has been involved in this job for five years and it earns her about 32,500 KHR per day. 

Chantha is the leader of this two-member group seeking Chantha's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to renovate her old house and to buy some household supplies for the family's use. Chantha hopes that she has as proper a house as others.

loans.use: to renovate her old house and to buy some household supplies for family use

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 4 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar donde vivir tranquila. Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, los cuales luego vende para obtener ingresos económicos que le permitan salir adelante. Marisol desea terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que esta se encuentra a medio construir ya que ella no alcanzo a cubrir los gastos necesarios para realizar la mejora, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para terminar de construir su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
45-year old Marisol has lived in her own house with her family for four years; she is happy that she has a place where she can live quietly. Marisol earns her living raising pigs which she then sells and the income allows her to get ahead.
She wishes to complete the construction of her house. As she cannot afford the outlay of money required, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and rebar to complete her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and rebar to complete her house

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida, 50, is a married woman and a mother of two grown up children. She lives in Leyte, Philippines. For several years, Nida has earned a living through her hog raising business. She would like to take a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. Nida believes that a loan will help her improve her hog raising business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 49 years old, is a hardworking entrepreneur from Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, who is also her business partner. She sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Marilou buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys the fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. Marilou's store is located in a temporary fish market and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Marilou is taking out a loan of PHP 30,000 to continue operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy more fish which are necessary to increase her inventory. In the future, she wants her business to continue to flourish and to improve their present financial condition. Marilou meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of fish to offer

loans.name: Belmore

texts.en: Belmore, 49, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. For 20 years, Belmore has raised livestock in the Philippines. He has borrowed 15 times from Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to sustain his business. Belmore requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for his livestock. He would like to expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for his livestock

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: Namwetsi est une commerçante, membre d’un groupe de crédit «Mufariji», âgée de 25 ans, mariée à un cultivateur, mère de 3 enfants  dont 1 scolarisé et 2 sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse de la boisson locale dans une buvette à domicile dans une avenue animée depuis 5 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des ingrédients de production (maïs, manioc, sorgho, soja, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite renforcer son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Namwetsi is a retailer, member of a loan group called “Mufariji.” At the age of twenty-five, she is married to a farmer and a mother of three. One of the children goes to school, and the other two are still toddlers.

For the past five years, she has retailed the local drink from a stall integrated to her house in a busy street. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She will purchase some production ingredients (corn, manioc, sorghum, soy, etc.). Doing so, she wishes to strengthen her capital, send her children to school, and feed them.

She thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs excluded from traditional financing systems. It is worth signaling that some of the clients in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: buy production ingredients (corn, manioc, sorghum, soy, etc.).

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.fr: Sangi est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, membre de la banque villageoise «Alpha», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 4 scolarisé et 3 sont encore gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique avec divers articles manufacturés. Elle va acheter des savons, des piles, des huiles, sucre, riz, biscuits. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Sangi is a vendor. She and her husband  help each other. Sangi is a member of the Alpha banc villageoise and a client of the Hekima microfinance institution. She is married, 38 years old, and the mother of seven children, four of whom are in school and three are still very young. She launched her business with the funds received from her husband. She has a general store selling various commercial products. She will buy soap, batteries, oil, sugar, rice, cookies etc. She would like to keep taking out loans in order to expand her business and provide for her children’s schooling and food. In conclusion, Sangi thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy soap, batteries, oil, sugar, rice, cookies etc.

loans.name: Lucyline

texts.en:
Lucyline, 57, is a smallholder farmer in a rural agricultural town called Chuka. The cool weather, expansive maize plantations and rolling hills makes Chuka, arguably, the most beautiful countryside in Kenya. Like most farmers from the region, Lucyline has dairy cattle, poultry and a maize farm. She has depended on mixed farming for three years to provide for her 5 children. Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Gatune".

Lucyline is seeking a loan from Kiva, through Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a dairy cow. The additional cow will produce more milk for sales, increasing milk volume. Typical grade cows produce 10 to 15 litres of milk on average per day. Lucyline stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is that it generates income! Her biggest challenge is a lack of capital. 

Lucyline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "It focuses on improving the lives of people in rural areas." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, to which she replied, "It is flexible and accessible."

Lucyline's highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Lucyline replied, "It will expand our business."

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Proem

texts.en:
Proem, 59 years old, lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her. To support her family, Proem grows cassava, rice and rubber. 

This will be Proem's sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she has fully repaid her past loans. Proem will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and to rent farmland to grow cassava. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to get more yields to earn more income to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to rent farmland to grow cassava

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María, madre soltera con tres hijos mayores de edad e independiente económicamente, es originaria de  Managua, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta  de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracia a sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica  mercadería en general que consiste en vender ropa de niños y adultos, pantalones shores, camisas, faldas, cosméticos, body, perfumes, rubor, sombras de ojos, labiales, prenda de plata y oro laminado y acero.   Tiene treinta y ocho años de tener el negocio y lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella dedica unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Para mejorar sus clientela y sus productos. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a persona de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother with three adult children who are now financially independent. She is originally from Managua, and she is characterized as hard-working and responsible with a desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was not able to study; she needed to start working at an early age in order to help with household expenses. 

As a result of her desire to move forward, she sells general merchandise such as clothing for children and adults, pants, shorts, shirts, skirts, cosmetics, perfumes, blushes, eyeshadows, and lipsticks, as well as steel, gold plated, and silver jewelry. She has had this business for 38 years, and it is located in her home. She works ten hours per day offering her products. 

She is requesting a loan in order to improve her customer base and her products. Maria gives thanks to Kiva lenders for helping people with limited resources from poor countries such as Nicaragua have decent ways to make a living.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, blushes, eyeshadows, and pants as well as steel, gold plated, and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. Ruth is a farmer, and has been farming rice for more than eight years now. She also earns an additional income through hog raising business. 

Ruth would like to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. She also wants to buy additional piglets to raise. 

Ruth believes that a loan will help her improve her businesses as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. Salvacion is a very hard working woman. She earns a living through a hog raising business. 

Salvacion is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed. 

Salvacion believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Rosalia is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits among others. 

Rosalia believes that a loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits among others

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 45 years old. He is married with one child. 

He has had a farming business for five years and it has been profitable. 

Simon has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya; he will be using the loan to purchase a cow. This will help him expand his farming business and pay school fees for his child. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecille is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Cecille has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Cecille has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en:
Domitille is 54 years old. She is married with four children aged between 6 and 24 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 30 years; her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be uses to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Cham district of Kampong Cham province, Savet is 35 years old. She is a married woman with two children in high school. She raises pigs as the main source of income and she also works for others for a fee to supplement her family’s income. 

This is Savet’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to buy pig feed to support her business. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to support her business

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Kampong Cham District

loans.name: Radio Musondolya Group

texts.en:
Asasio is 64 years old, a hard working man who is married with 14 children. He is a member of Radio Musondolya Group, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Asasio is a farmer growing crops such as rice, cabbages, beans, cotton, maize and tomatoes for commercial purposes. Asasio has been in commercial farming since 1998, and also earns a salary from teaching, which has enabled him earn a living. 

He has a dream of educating his children, though he is faced with a challenge of debtors which affects his cash flow. 

Asasio is requesting a loan to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Bachuki

texts.en:
Bachuki is 50 years old. He lives with his wife Khatuna is the small village of Vani district. Bachuki is involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, they have nut trees and 0.9 hectare land where they grow maize. The average income for the family is 400-500 GEL, which is not enough to cover everyday costs, as the income is only seasonal. 

Accordingly, Bachuki decided to start new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get e loan of 6,000 GEL. With the received credit he will open a workshop, where he will produce wire entanglement (fencing) to sell. 

The Start Up program will be a great support for his family, as he will generate stable income.

loans.use: to open a workshop, where he will produce wire entanglement

loans.name: M. Amir

texts.en:
M. Amir is the age of 27, living with his two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He is a motorcycle mechanic by profession; he repairs and troubleshoots the motorbikes. He has been doing these services for many years. He provides the services near his hometown. Mostly people who have bikes like to repair their bikes from his workshop.

He has been running this business for many years and using very expensive tools for repairing, which have gone too depreciated. He wants to replace these tools with new ones but he does not have money to buy new tools. 

Therefore, M. Amir requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he would be able to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycles. 

M. Amir thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан, 55 лет, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Токтокан высшее образование, с 2005 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 2 козы и 20 овец. Она известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность Токтокан приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Toktokan is 55, married, and has an adult son.  She has a university education, and has been a farmer since 2005.  She has 6 cows, 2 goats and 20 sheep on her farm.  She's known as a principled, honest, decent and dependable person.  Currently, Toktokan's business activities bring in a monthly profit of 20,000 som.  

For the future development of her farm, she's requested a loan of 130,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank which will go towards buying livestock.  She plans on using the extra income due to the loan to develop her farm.

loans.use: buy some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Sa Em's Group
